*** gpac-h-all logs (GPAC version 1.1.0-DEV-revUNKNOWN-HEAD ) - test date 29/04/2021 23:35:20 ***


*** Subtest "single": executing "gpac -h *:*" ***

[32minspect[0m

Description: Inspect packets

The inspect filter can be used to dump pid and packets. It may also be used to check parts of payload of the packets. The default options inspect only pid changes.
The packet inspector can be configured to dump specific properties of packets using [33m[3mfmt[0m.
When the option is not present, all properties are dumped. Otherwise, only properties identified by [33m[3m$TOKEN$[0m are printed. You may use '$', '@' or '%' for [33m[3mTOKEN[0m separator. [33m[3mTOKEN[0m can be:
	* [33mpn[0m: packet (frame in framed mode) number
	* [33mdts[0m: decoding time stamp in stream timescale, N/A if not available
	* [33mddts[0m: difference between current and previous packets decoding time stamp in stream timescale, N/A if not available
	* [33mcts[0m: composition time stamp in stream timescale, N/A if not available
	* [33mdcts[0m: difference between current and previous packets composition time stamp in stream timescale, N/A if not available
	* [33mctso[0m: difference between composition time stamp and decoding time stamp in stream timescale, N/A if not available
	* [33mdur[0m: duration in stream timescale
	* [33mframe[0m: framing status
	  * [33minterface[0m: complete AU, interface object (no size info). Typically a GL texture
	  * [33mframe_full[0m: complete AU
	  * [33mframe_start[0m: beginning of frame
	  * [33mframe_end[0m: end of frame
	  * [33mframe_cont[0m: frame continuation (not beginning, not end)
	* [33msap or rap[0m: SAP type of the frame
	* [33milace[0m: interlacing flag (0: progressive, 1: top field, 2: bottom field)
	* [33mcorr[0m: corrupted packet flag
	* [33mseek[0m: seek flag
	* [33mbo[0m: byte offset in source, N/A if not available
	* [33mroll[0m: roll info
	* [33mcrypt[0m: crypt flag
	* [33mvers[0m: carousel version number
	* [33msize[0m: size of packet
	* [33mcsize[0m: cumulated size of packets
	* [33mcrc[0m: 32 bit CRC of packet
	* [33mlf[0m: insert linefeed
	* [33mcr[0m: insert carriage return
	* [33mt[0m: insert tab
	* [33mdata[0m: hex dump of packet ([3mbig output![0m)
	* [33mlp[0m: leading picture flag
	* [33mdepo[0m: depends on other packet flag
	* [33mdepf[0m: is depended on other packet flag
	* [33mred[0m: redundant coding flag
	* [33mck[0m: clock type used for PCR discontinuities
	* [33mP4CC[0m: 4CC of packet property
	* [33mPropName[0m: Name of packet property
	* [33mpid.P4CC[0m: 4CC of PID property
	* [33mpid.PropName[0m: Name of PID property

[33mExample:
fmt="PID $pid.ID$ packet $pn$ DTS $dts$ CTS $cts$ $lf$"[0m
This dumps packet number, cts and dts as follows: [33m[3mPID 1 packet 10 DTS 100 CTS 108 \n[0m
  
An unrecognized keyword or missing property will resolve to an empty string.

[36m[3mNote: when dumping in interleaved mode, there is no guarantee that the packets will be dumped in their original sequence order since the inspector fetches one packet at a time on each PID.[0m



[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mlog[0m (str, default: [3mstderr[0m, minmax: fileName, stderr, stdout or null): set inspect log filename
[32mmode[0m (enum, default: [3mpck[0m):     dump mode
	* [33mpck[0m: dump full packet
	* [33mblk[0m: dump packets before reconstruction
	* [33mframe[0m: force reframer
	* [33mraw[0m: dump source packets without demuxing

[32mspeed[0m (dbl, default: [3m1.0[0m):     set playback command speed. If speed is negative and start is 0, start is set to -1
[32mstart[0m (dbl, default: [3m0.0[0m):     set playback start offset. Negative value means percent of media duration with -1 equal to duration
[32mdur[0m (frac, default: [3m0/0[0m):      set inspect duration
[32mxml[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m, updatable): use xml formatting (implied if (-analyze]() is set) and disable [33m[3mfmt[0m
[32mcrc[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m, updatable): dump crc of NALU/OBU/... when analyzing
[32mdtype[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m, updatable): dump property type


[32mprobe[0m

Description: Probe source

The Probe filter is used by applications (typically [33m[3mMP4Box[0m) to query demuxed pids available in a source chain.
The filter does not produce any output nor feedback, it is up to the app developer to query input pids of the prober and take appropriated decisions.

No options


[32mcompositor[0m

Description: Compositor

The GPAC compositor allows mixing audio, video, text and graphics in a timed fashion.
The compositor operates either in media-client or filter-only mode.


[32mMedia-client mode[0m

In this mode, the compositor acts as a pseudo-sink for the video side and creates its own output window.
The video frames are dispatched to the output video pid in the form of frame pointers requiring later GPU read if used.
The audio part acts as a regular filter, potentially mixing and resampling the audio inputs to generate its output.
User events are directly processed by the filter in this mode.


[32mFilter mode[0m

In this mode, the compositor acts as a regular filter generating frames based on the loaded scene.
It will generate its outputs based on the input video frames and will not process any user event.
If no input video frames (e.g. pure BIFS / SVG / VRML), the filter will generate frames based on the [33m[3mfps[0m, at constant or variable frame rate.
It will stop generating frames as soon as all input streams are done, unless extended/reduced by [33m[3mdur[0m.
If audio streams are loaded, an audio output pid is created.

The default output pixel format in filter mode is:
- [33m[3mrgb[0m when the filter is explicitly loaded by the application
- [33m[3mrgba[0m when the filter is loaded during a link resolution
This can be changed by assigning the [33m[3mopfmt[0m option.

In filter-only mode, the special URL [33m[3mgpid://[0m is used to locate PIDs in the scene description, in order to design scenes independently from source media.
When such a pid is associated to a [33m[3mBackground2D[0m node in BIFS (no SVG mapping yet), the compositor operates in passthrough mode.
In this mode, only new input frames on the passthrough pid will generate new frames, and the scene clock matches the input packet time.
The output size and pixel format will be set to the input size and pixel format, unless specified otherwise in the filter options.

If only 2D graphics are used and display driver is not forced, 2D rasterizer will happen in the output pixel format (including YUV pixel formats).
In this case, inplace processing (rasterizing over the input frame data) will be used whenever allowed by input data.

If 3D graphics are used or display driver is forced, OpenGL will be used on offscreen surface and the output packet will be an OpenGL texture.


[32mSpecific URL syntaxes[0m

The compositor accepts any URL type supported by GPAC. It also accepts the following schemes for URLs:
	* [33mviews:// [0m: creates an auto-stereo scene of N views from [33m[3mviews://v1:.:vN[0m. vN can be any type of URL supported by GPAC.
	* [33mmosaic:// [0m: creates a mosaic of N views from [33m[3mmosaic://v1:.:vN[0m. vN can be any type of URL supported by GPAC.

The compositor can act as a source filter when the [33m[3msrc[0m option is explicitly set, independently from the operating mode:
[33mExample:
gpac compositor:src=source.mp4 vout[0m

The compositor can act as a source filter when the source url uses one of the compositor built-in protocol schemes:
[33mExample:
gpac -i mosaic://URL1:URL2 vout[0m




[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mbc[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m, updatable): default background color to use when displaying transparent images or video with no scene composition instructions
[32mfast[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m, updatable): enable speed optimization - whether the setting is applied or not depends on the graphics module / graphic card
[32mdrop[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m, updatable): drop late frame when drawing. By default frames are not dropped until a heavy desync of 1 sec is observed
[32mtimeout[0m (uint, default: [3m10000[0m, updatable): timeout in ms after which a source is considered dead
[32mfps[0m (frac, default: [3m30/1[0m, updatable): simulation frame rate when animation-only sources are played (ignored when video is present)
[32mtimescale[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m, updatable): timescale used for output packets when no input video pid. A value of 0 means fps numerator
[32mdur[0m (dbl, default: [3m0[0m, updatable): duration of generation. Mostly used when no video input is present. Negative values mean number of frames, positive values duration in second, 0 stops as soon as all streams are done
[32mamc[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m):     audio multichannel support; if disabled always downmix to stereo. Useful if the multichannel output does not work properly
[32mavol[0m (uint, default: [3m100[0m, updatable): audio volume in percent
[32mapan[0m (uint, default: [3m50[0m, updatable): audio pan in percent, 50 is no pan
[32mbuffer[0m (uint, default: [3m3000[0m, updatable): playout buffer in ms. overridden by BufferLenth property of input pid
[32mrbuffer[0m (uint, default: [3m1000[0m, updatable): rebuffer trigger in ms. overridden by RebufferLenth property of input pid
[32mmbuffer[0m (uint, default: [3m3000[0m, updatable): max buffer in ms (must be greater than playout buffer). overridden by BufferMaxOccupancy property of input pid
[32mntpsync[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m, updatable): ntp resync threshold in ms (drops frame if their NTP is more than the given threshold above local ntp), 0 disables ntp drop
[32mnbviews[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m, updatable): number of views to use in stereo mode
[32miod[0m (flt, default: [3m6.4[0m, updatable): inter-occular distance (eye separation) in cm (distance between the cameras). 
[32mfov[0m (flt, default: [3m1.570796326794897[0m, updatable): default field of view for VR


[32mmp4dmx[0m

Description: ISOBMFF/QT demuxer

This filter demultiplexes ISOBMF and QT files (regular or fragmented).

[32mTrack Selection[0m

The filter can use fragment identifiers of source to select a single track for playback. The allowed fragments are:
	 * [33m#audio[0m: only use the first audio track
	 * [33m#video[0m: only use the first video track
	 * [33m#auxv[0m: only use the first auxiliary video track
	 * [33m#pict[0m: only use the first picture track
	 * [33m#text[0m: only use the first text track
	 * [33m#trackID=VAL[0m: only use the track with given ID
	 * [33m#ID=VAL[0m: only use the track with given ID
	 * [33m#VAL[0m: only use the track with given ID


[32mScalable Tracks[0m

When scalable tracks are present in a file, the reader can operate in 3 modes using [33m[3msmode[0m option:
	* [33msmode=single[0m: resolves all extractors to extract a single bitstream from a scalable set. The highest level is used
In this mode, there is no enhancement decoder config, only a base one resulting from the merge of the configs
	* [33msmode=split[0m: all extractors are removed and every track of the scalable set is declared. In this mode, each enhancement track has no base decoder config
and an enhancement decoder config.
	* [33msmode=splitx[0m: extractors are kept in the bitstream, and every track of the scalable set is declared. In this mode, each enhancement track has a base decoder config
 (copied from base) and an enhancement decoder config. This is mostly used for DASHing content.

[31m[1mWarning: smode=splitx will result in extractor NAL units still present in the output bitstream, which shall only be true if the output is ISOBMFF based[0m




[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32msrc[0m (cstr):                    location of source content (only used when explicitly loading the demuxer)


[32mbifsdec[0m

Description: MPEG-4 BIFS decoder

This filter decodes MPEG-4 BIFS frames directly into the scene graph of the compositor. It cannot be used to dump BIFS content.

No options


[32modfdec[0m

Description: MPEG-4 OD decoder

This filter decodes MPEG-4 OD frames directly into the scene manager of the compositor. It cannot be used to dump OD content.

No options


[32mfin[0m

Description: File input

This filter dispatch raw blocks from input file into a filter chain.
Block size can be adjusted using [33m[3mblock_size[0m.
Content format can be forced through [33m[3mmime[0m and file extension can be changed through [33m[3mext[0m.
[36m[3mNote: Unless disabled at session level (see [33m[1m-no-probe[0m ), file extensions are usually ignored and format probing is done on the first data block.[0m
The special file name [33m[3mnull[0m is used for creating a file with no data, needed by some filters such as [33m[3mdasher[0m.
The special file name [33m[3mrand[0m is used to generate random data.
The special file name [33m[3mrandsc[0m is used to generate random data with fake start-codes (0x000001).

The filter handles both files and GF_FileIO objects as input URL.



[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32msrc[0m (cstr):                    location of source file
[32mrange[0m (lfrac, default: [3m0-0[0m):   byte range
[32mext[0m (cstr):                    override file extension
[32mmime[0m (cstr):                   set file mime type


[32mbtplay[0m

Description: BT/XMT/X3D loader

This filter parses MPEG-4 BIFS (BT and XMT), VRML97 and X3D (wrl and XML) files directly into the scene graph of the compositor.


[32mOptions (basic):[0m



[32mhttpin[0m

Description: HTTP input

This filter dispatch raw blocks from a remote HTTP resource into a filter chain.
Block size can be adjusted using [33m[3mblock_size[0m, and disk caching policies can be adjusted.
Content format can be forced through [33m[3mmime[0m and file extension can be changed through [33m[3mext[0m.
[36m[3mNote: Unless disabled at session level (see [33m[1m-no-probe[0m ), file extensions are usually ignored and format probing is done on the first data block.[0m


[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32msrc[0m (cstr):                    URL of source content
[32mrange[0m (lfrac, default: [3m0-0[0m):   set byte range, as fraction
[32mext[0m (cstr):                    override file extension
[32mmime[0m (cstr):                   set file mime type


[32msvgplay[0m

Description: SVG loader

This filter parses SVG files directly into the scene graph of the compositor.


[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32msockin[0m

Description: UDP/TCP input

This filter handles generic TCP and UDP input sockets. It can also probe for MPEG-2 TS over RTP input. Probing of MPEG-2 TS over UDP/RTP is enabled by default but can be turned off.

Data format can be specified by setting either [33m[3mext[0m or [33m[3mmime[0m options. If not set, the format will be guessed by probing the first data packet

- UDP sockets are used for source URLs formatted as [33m[3mudp://NAME[0m
- TCP sockets are used for source URLs formatted as [33m[3mtcp://NAME[0m
- UDP unix domain sockets are used for source URLs formatted as [33m[3mudpu://NAME[0m
- TCP unix domain sockets are used for source URLs formatted as [33m[3mtcpu://NAME[0m

When ports are specified in the URL and the default option separators are used (see [33m[3mgpac -h doc[0m), the URL must either:
- have a trailing '/', eg [33m[3mudp://localhost:1234/[:opts][0m
- use [33m[3mgpac[0m separator, eg [33m[3mudp://localhost:1234[:gpac:opts][0m



[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32msrc[0m (cstr):                    address of source content - see filter help
[32mport[0m (uint, default: [3m1234[0m):    default port if not specified
[32mlisten[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): indicate the input socket works in server mode
[32mmaxc[0m (uint, default: [3m+I[0m):      max number of concurrent connections
[32mext[0m (str):                     indicate file extension of udp data
[32mmime[0m (str):                    indicate mime type of udp data


[32mdvbin[0m

Description: DVB for Linux

Experimental DVB support for linux, requires a channel config file through [33m[3mchcfg[0m
  
The URL syntax is [33m[3mdvb://CHANNAME[@FRONTEND][0m, with:
	 * [33mCHANNAME[0m: the channel name as listed in the channel config file
	 * [33mfrontend[0m: the index of the DVB adapter to use (optional, default is 0)



[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32msrc[0m (cstr):                    URL of source content - see filter help
[32mchcfg[0m (cstr):                  path to channels.conf file

Description: SAF demuxer

This filter demultiplexes SAF (MPEG-4 Simple Aggregation Format for LASeR) files/data into a set of media PIDs and frames.

No options


[32mdashin[0m

Description: MPEG-DASH and HLS client

This filter reads MPEG-DASH, HLS and MS Smooth manifests and produce media output according to its mode.


[32mRegular mode[0m

This is the default mode, in which the filter produces media PIDs and frames from sources indicated in the manifest.
The default behavior is to perform adaptation according to [33m[3malgo[0m, but the filter can:
- run with no adaptation, to grab maximum quality.
[33mExample:
gpac -i MANIFEST_URL:algo=none:start_with=max_bw -o dest.mp4[0m
- run with no adaptation, fetching all qualities.
[33mExample:
gpac -i MANIFEST_URL:split_as fout:dst=$File$.mp4:clone[0m


[32mFile mode[0m

When [33m[3mforward[0m is set to [33m[3mfile[0m, the client forwards media files without demultiplexing them.
This is mostly used to expose the DASH session to a file server such as ROUTE or HTTP.
In this mode, the manifest is forwarded as an output PID.

[31m[1mWarning: This mode cannot be set through inheritance as it changes the link capabilities of the filter. The filter MUST be explicitly declared.[0m


To expose a live DASH session to route:
[33mExample:
gpac -i MANIFEST_URL dashin:forward=file @ -o route://225.0.0.1:8000/[0m

[36m[3mNote: This mode used to be trigger by [33m[1mfilemode[0m option, still recognized.[0m

If the source has dependent media streams (scalability) and all qualities and initialization segments need to be forwarded, add [33m[3msplit_as[0m.


[32mSegment bound modes[0m

When [33m[3mforward[0m is set to [33m[3msegs[0m or [33m[3mmani[0m, the client forwards media frames (after demux) together with segment and fragment boundaries of source files.

This mode can be used to process media data and regenerating the same manifest/segmentation.

[33mExample:
gpac -i MANIFEST_URL:forward=mani cecrypt:cfile=DRM.xml @ -o encrypted/live.mpd:pssh=mv[0m
This will encrypt an existing DASH session, inject PSSH in manifest and segments.

[33mExample:
gpac -i MANIFEST_URL:forward=segb cecrypt:cfile=DRM.xml @ -o encrypted/live.m3u8[0m
This will encrypt an existing DASH session and republish it as HLS, using same segment names and boundaries.

This mode will force [33m[3mnoseek[0m to [33m[3mtrue[0m to ensure the first segment fetched is complete, and [33m[3msplit_as[0m to [33m[3mtrue[0m to fetch all qualities.

Each first packet of a segment will have the following properties attached:
	* [33m`CueStart`[0m: to indicate this is a segment start (set by demuxer if it offers [33m[3msigfrag[0m option)
	* [33m`FileNumber`[0m: current segment number
	* [33m`FileName`[0m: current segment file name without manifest base url

If [33m[3mforward[0m is set to [33m[3mmani[0m, the first packet of a segment dispatched after a manifest update will also carry the manifest payload as a property:
	* [33m`DFManifest`[0m: contains main manifest (MPD, M3U8 master)
	* [33m`DFVariant`[0m: contains list of HLS child playlists as strings for the given quality
	* [33m`DFVariantName`[0m: contains list of associated HLS child playlists name

Each output PID will have the following properties assigned:
	* [33m`DFMode`[0m: set to 1 for [33m[3msegb[0m or 2 for [33m[3mmani[0m
	* [33m`DCue`[0m: set to [33m[3minband[0m
	* [33m`DFPStart`[0m: set to current period start value
	* [33m`FileName`[0m: set to associated init segment if any
	* [33m`Representation`[0m: set to the associated representation ID in the manifest
	* [33m`DashDur`[0m: set to the average segment duration as indicated in the manifest

When the [33m[3mdasher[0m is used together with this mode, this will force all generated segments to have the same name, duration and fragmentation properties as the input ones.
It is therefore not recommended for sessions stored/generated on local storage to generate the output in the same directory.



[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mstart_with[0m (enum, default: [3mmax_bw[0m): initial selection criteria
	* [33mmin_q[0m: start with lowest quality
	* [33mmax_q[0m: start with highest quality
	* [33mmin_bw[0m: start with lowest bitrate
	* [33mmax_bw[0m: start with highest bitrate; for tiles are used, all low priority tiles will have the lower (below max) bandwidth selected
	* [33mmax_bw_tiles[0m: start with highest bitrate; for tiles all low priority tiles will have their lowest bandwidth selected

[32mmax_res[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m): use max media resolution to configure display
[32muse_bmin[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): use the indicated min buffer time of the MPD if true, otherwise uses default player settings


[32mcdcrypt[0m

Description: CENC decryptor

The CENC decryptor supports decrypting CENC, ISMA and Adobe streams. It uses a configuration file for retrieving keys.
The syntax is available at https://wiki.gpac.io/Common-Encryption
The file can be set per PID using the property [33m[3mDecryptInfo[0m (highest priority), [33m[3mCryptInfo[0m (lower priority) or set at the filter level using [33m[3mcfile[0m (lowest priority).
When the file is set per PID, the first [33m[3mCryptInfo[0m with the same ID is used, otherwise the first [33m[3mCryptInfo[0m is used.


[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mcfile[0m (str):                   crypt file location - see filter help


[32mcecrypt[0m

Description: CENC  encryptor

The CENC encryptor supports CENC, ISMA and Adobe encryption. It uses a DRM config file for declaring keys.
The syntax is available at https://wiki.gpac.io/Common-Encryption
The DRM config file can be set per PID using the property [33m[3mCryptInfo[0m, or set at the filter level using [33m[3mcfile[0m.
When the DRM config file is set per PID, the first [33m[3mCrypTrack[0m in the DRM config file with the same ID is used, otherwise the first [33m[3mCrypTrack[0m is used.
If no DRM config file is defined for a given PID, this PID will not be encrypted, or an error will be thrown if [33m[3mallc[0m is specified.



[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mcfile[0m (str):                   crypt file location - see filter help
[32mallc[0m (str):                    throw error if no DRM config file is found for a PID - see filter help


[32mmp4mx[0m

Description: ISOBMFF/QT muxer

Muxes file according to ISOBMFF (14496-12 and derived specifications) or QuickTime
  

[32mTracks and Items[0m

By default all input PIDs with ItemID property set are muxed as items, otherwise they are muxed as tracks.
To prevent source items to be muxed as items, use [33m[3m-itemid[0m option from ISOBMF demuxer.
[33mExample:
-i source.mp4:itemid=false -o file.mp4[0m
  
To force non-item streams to be muxed as items, use [3m#ItemID[0m option on that PID:
[33mExample:
-i source.jpg:#ItemID=1 -o file.mp4[0m
  

[32mStorage[0m

The [33m[3mstore[0m option allows controlling if the file is fragmented ot not, and when not fragmented, how interleaving is done. For cases where disk requirements are tight and fragmentation cannot be used, it is recommended to use either [33m[3mflat[0m or [33m[3mfstart[0m modes.
  
The [33m[3mvodcache[0m option allows controlling how DASH onDemand segments are generated:
- If set to [33m[3mon[0m, file data is stored to a temporary file on disk and flushed upon completion, no padding is present.
- If set to [33m[3minsert[0m, SIDX/SSIX will be injected upon completion of the file by shifting bytes in file. In this case, no padding is required but this might not be compatible with all output sinks and will take longer to write the file.
- If set to [33m[3mreplace[0m, SIDX/SSIX size will be estimated based on duration and DASH segment length, and padding will be used in the file [3mbefore[0m the final SIDX. If input pids have the properties [33m[3mDSegs[0m set, this will be as the number of segments.
The [33m[3mon[0m and [33m[3minsert[0m modes will produce exactly the same file, while the mode [33m[3mreplace[0m may inject a [33m[3mfree[0m box before the sidx.
  

[32mCustom boxes[0m

Custom boxes can be specified as box patches:
For movie-level patch, the [33m[3mboxpatch[0m option of the filter should be used.
Per PID box patch can be specified through the PID property [33m[3mboxpatch[0m.
[33mExample:
src=source:#boxpatch=myfile.xml dst=mux.mp4[0m
Per Item box patch can be specified through the PID property [33m[3mboxpatch[0m.
[33mExample:
src=source:1ItemID=1:#boxpatch=myfile.xml dst=mux.mp4[0m
  
The box patch is applied before writing the initial moov box in fragmented mode, or when writing the complete file otherwise.
The box patch can either be a filename or the full XML string.
  

[32mTagging[0m

When tagging is enabled, the filter will watch the property [33m[3mCoverArt[0m and all custom properties on incoming pid.
The built-in tag names are indicated by [33m[3mMP4Box -h tags[0m.
Other tag class may be specified using [33m[3mtag_NAME[0m property names, and will be added if [33m[3mtags[0m is set to [33m[3mall[0m using:
- [33m[3mNAME[0m as a box 4CC if [33m[3mNAME[0m is four characters long
- [33m[3mNAME[0m as a box 4CC if [33m[3mNAME[0m is 3 characters long, and will be prefixed by 0xA9
- the CRC32 of the [33m[3mNAME[0m as a box 4CC if [33m[3mNAME[0m is not four characters long
  

[32mNotes[0m

The filter watches the property [33m[3mFileNumber[0m on incoming packets to create new files or new segments in DASH mode.



[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32midur[0m (frac, default: [3m0[0m):       only import the specified duration. If negative, specify the number of coded frames to import
[32mxps_inband[0m (enum, default: [3mno[0m): use inband (in sample data) parameter set for NALU-based video (AVC/HEVC/...)
	* [33mno[0m: paramater sets are not inband, several sample descriptions might be created
	* [33mall[0m: paramater sets are inband, no parameter sets in sample description
	* [33mboth[0m: paramater sets are inband, signaled as inband, and also first set is kept in sample description
	* [33mmix[0m: creates non-standard files using single sample entry with first PSs found, and moves other PS inband

[32mstore[0m (enum, default: [3minter[0m):  file storage mode
	* [33minter[0m: perform precise interleave of the file using [33m[3mcdur[0m (requires temporary storage of all media)
	* [33mflat[0m: write samples as they arrive and moov at end (fastest mode)
	* [33mfstart[0m: write samples as they arrive and moov before mdat
	* [33mtight[0m:  uses per-sample interleaving of all tracks (requires temporary storage of all media)
	* [33mfrag[0m: fragments the file using cdur duration
	* [33msfrag[0m: framents the file using cdur duration but adjusting to start with SAP1/3

[32mcdur[0m (frac, default: [3m-1/1[0m):    chunk duration for flat and interleaving modes or fragment duration for fragmentation modes
	* [33m0[0m: no specific interleaving but moov first
	* [33mnegative[0m: defaults to 1.0 unless overridden by storage profile
[32mmsn[0m (uint, default: [3m1[0m):        sequence number of first moof to N
[32mmsninc[0m (uint, default: [3m1[0m):     sequence number increase between moofs
[32mtfdt[0m (lfrac, default: [3m0[0m):      set TFDT of first traf
[32mtfdt_traf[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): set TFDT in each traf
[32mnofragdef[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): disable default flags in fragments
[32mvodcache[0m (enum, default: [3mreplace[0m): enable temp storage for VoD dash modes - see filter help
	* [33mon[0m: use temp storage of complete file for sidx and ssix injection
	* [33minsert[0m: insert sidx and ssix by shifting bytes in output file
	* [33mreplace[0m: precompute pace requirements for sidx and ssix and rewrite file range at end

[32mbtrt[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m):    set btrt box in sample description
[32mstyp[0m (str):                    set segment styp major brand to the given 4CC[.version]
[32mmediats[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m):    set media timescale. A value of 0 means inherit from pid, a value of -1 means derive from samplerate or frame rate
[32mase[0m (enum, default: [3mv0[0m):       set audio sample entry mode for more than stereo layouts
	* [33mv0[0m: use v0 signaling but channel count from stream, recommended for backward compatibility
	* [33mv0s[0m: use v0 signaling and force channel count to 2 (stereo) if more than 2 channels
	* [33mv1[0m: use v1 signaling, ISOBMFF style (will mux raw PCM as ISOBMFF style)
	* [33mv1qt[0m: use v1 signaling, QTFF style



[32mrfqcp[0m

Description: QCP reframer

This filter parses QCP files/data and outputs corresponding audio PID and frames.


[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mindex[0m (dbl, default: [3m1.0[0m):     indexing window length


[32mrfh263[0m

Description: H263 reframer

This filter parses H263 files/data and outputs corresponding visual PID and frames.


[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mfps[0m (frac, default: [3m15000/1000[0m): import frame rate
[32mindex[0m (dbl, default: [3m1.0[0m):     indexing window length


[32mrfmpgvid[0m

Description: M1V/M2V/M4V reframer

This filter parses MPEG-1/2 and MPEG-4 part 2 video files/data and outputs corresponding video PID and frames.
[36m[3mNote: The demux uses negative CTS offsets: CTS is corrrect, but some frames may have DTS greater than CTS.[0m


[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mfps[0m (frac, default: [3m0/1000[0m):   import frame rate (0 default to FPS from bitstream or 25 Hz)
[32mindex[0m (dbl, default: [3m1.0[0m):     indexing window length


[32mnhntr[0m

Description: NHNT reader

This filter reads NHNT files/data to produce a media PID and frames.
NHNT documentation is available at https://wiki.gpac.io/NHNT-Format



[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mindex[0m (dbl, default: [3m1.0[0m):     indexing window length


[32mnhmlr[0m

Description: NHML parser

This filter reads NHML files/data to produce a media PID and frames.
NHML documentation is available at https://wiki.gpac.io/NHML-Format



[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mindex[0m (dbl, default: [3m1.0[0m):     indexing window length


[32mrfnalu[0m

Description: AVC/HEVC reframer

This filter parses AVC|H264 and HEVC files/data and outputs corresponding video PID and frames.
This demuxer only produces ISOBMFF-compatible output: start codes are removed, NALU length field added and avcC/hvcC config created.
[36m[3mNote: The demux uses negative CTS offsets: CTS is corrrect, but some frames may have DTS greater than CTS.[0m


[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mfps[0m (frac, default: [3m0/1000[0m):   import frame rate (0 default to FPS from bitstream or 25 Hz)
[32mindex[0m (dbl, default: [3m-1.0[0m):    indexing window length. If 0, bitstream is not probed for duration. A negative value skips the indexing if the source file is larger than 100M (slows down importers) unless a play with start range > 0 is issued, otherwise uses the positive value


[32mm2psdmx[0m

Description: MPEG PS demuxer

This filter demultiplexes MPEG-2 program stream files/data to produce media PIDs and frames.

No options


[32mavidmx[0m

Description: AVI demuxer

This filter demultiplexes AVI files/data to produce media PIDs and frames.


[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mfps[0m (frac, default: [3m1/0[0m):      import frame rate, default is AVI one


[32mtxtin[0m

Description: Subtitle loader

This filter reads subtitle data from input file PID to produce subtitle frames on a single PID.
The filter supports the following formats:
	* [33mSRT[0m: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SubRip
	* [33mWebVTT[0m: https://www.w3.org/TR/webvtt1/
	* [33mTTXT[0m: https://wiki.gpac.io/TTXT-Format-Documentation
	* [33mQT 3GPP Text XML (TexML)[0m: Apple QT6, likely deprecated
	* [33mTTML[0m: https://www.w3.org/TR/ttml2/
	* [33mSUB[0m: one subtitle per line formatted as [33m[3m{start_frame}{end_frame}text[0m

Input files must be in UTF-8 or UTF-16 format, with or without BOM.
The internal frame format is: 
	* [33mWebVTT (and srt if desired)[0m: ISO/IEC 14496-30 VTT cues
	* [33mTTML[0m: ISO/IEC 14496-30 XML subtitles
	* [33mOthers[0m: 3GPP/QT Timed Text


[32mTTML Support[0m

The [33m[3mttml_dur[0m option controls how TTML are split into packets:
- if negative (default), TTML document is split in independent time segments by inspecting all overlapping subtitles in the body
- if 0, the input document is not split, forwarded as a single frame with [33m[3mCTS[0m matching the first active time in document and a duration equal to the document duration
- if >0, the input document is not split, forwarded as a single frame with [33m[3mCTS=0[0m and the specified duration in [33m[3mtimescale[0m units.

By default, media resources are kept as declared in TTML2 documents.
[33m[3mttml_embed[0m can be used to embed inside the TTML sample the resources in [33m[3m<head>[0m or [33m[3m<body>[0m.
- for [33m[3m<source>[0m, [33m[3m<image>[0m, [33m[3m<audio>[0m, [33m[3m<font>[0m, local URIs indicated in [33m[3msrc[0m will be loaded and [33m[3msrc[0m rewritten.
- for [33m[3m<data>[0m with base64 coding, the data will be decoded, [33m[3m<data>[0m element removed and parent <source> rewritten with [33m[3msrc[0m attribute inserted.

The embedded data is added as a subsample to the TTML frame, and the referring elements will use [33m[3msrc=urn:mpeg:14496-30:N[0m with [33m[3mN[0m the index of the subsample.

A [33m[3msubtitle zero[0m may be specified using [33m[3mttml_zero[0m. This will remove all subtitles before the given time [33m[3mT0[0m, and rewrite each subtitle begin/end [33m[3mT[0m to [33m[3mT-T0[0m using millisecond accuracy.

[31m[1mWarning: Original time formatting (tick, frames/subframe ...) will be lost when this option is used, converted to [33m[3mHH:MM:SS.ms[31m[1m.[0m


The subtitle zero time [1mmust[0m be prefixed with [33m[3mT[0m when the option is not set as a global argument:
[33mExample:
gpac -i test.ttml:ttml_zero=T10:00:00 [...][0m
[33mMP4Box -add test.ttml:sopt:ttml_zero=T10:00:00 [...][0m
[33mgpac -i test.ttml --ttml_zero=10:00:00 [...][0m
[33mMP4Box -add test.ttml --ttml_zero=10:00:00 [...][0m



[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mfontname[0m (str):                default font to use
[32mfontsize[0m (uint, default: [3m18[0m):  default font size
[32mlang[0m (str):                    default language to use
[32mwidth[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m):      default width of text area, set to 0 to resolve against visual PIDs
[32mheight[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m):     default height of text area, set to 0 to resolve against visual PIDs
[32mtxtx[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m):       default horizontal offset of text area: -1 (left), 0 (center) or 1 (right)
[32mtxty[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m):       default vertical offset of text area: -1 (bottom), 0 (center) or 1 (top)


[32mttxtdec[0m

Description: TTXT/TX3G decoder

This filter decodes TTXT/TX3G streams into a BIFS scene graph of the compositor filter.
The TTXT documentation is available at https://wiki.gpac.io/TTXT-Format-Documentation



[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mtxtw[0m (uint, default: [3m400[0m):     default width in standalone rendering
[32mtxth[0m (uint, default: [3m200[0m):     default height in standalone rendering


[32mvttdec[0m

Description: WebVTT decoder

This filter decodes WebVTT streams into a SVG scene graph of the compositor filter.
The scene graph creation is done through JavaScript.
The filter options are used to override the JS global variables of the WebVTT renderer.


[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mtxtw[0m (uint, default: [3m400[0m):     default width in standalone rendering
[32mtxth[0m (uint, default: [3m200[0m):     default height in standalone rendering


[32mttmldec[0m

Description: TTML decoder

This filter decodes TTML streams into a SVG scene graph of the compositor filter.
The scene graph creation is done through JavaScript.
The filter options are used to override the JS global variables of the TTML renderer.


[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mtxtw[0m (uint, default: [3m400[0m):     default width in standalone rendering
[32mtxth[0m (uint, default: [3m200[0m):     default height in standalone rendering


[32mrtpin[0m

Description: RTP/RTSP/SDP input

This filter handles SDP/RTSP/RTP input reading. It supports:
- SDP file reading
- RTP direct url through [33m[3mrtp://[0m protocol scheme
- RTSP session processing through [33m[3mrtsp://[0m and [33m[3msatip://[0m protocol schemes
 
The filter produces either media PIDs and compressed media frames, or file PIDs and multiplex data (e.g., MPEG-2 TS).


[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32msrc[0m (cstr):                    location of source content (SDP, RTP or RTSP URL)
[32mdefault_port[0m (uint, default: [3m554[0m, minmax: 0-65535): set default RTSP port
[32msatip_port[0m (uint, default: [3m1400[0m, minmax: 0-65535): set default port for SATIP
[32mudp_timeout[0m (uint, default: [3m10000[0m): default timeout before considering UDP is down
[32mrtsp_timeout[0m (uint, default: [3m3000[0m): default timeout before considering RTSP is down
[32muser_agent[0m (str, default: [3m$GUA[0m): user agent string, by default solved from GPAC preferences
[32mlanguages[0m (str, default: [3m$GLANG[0m): user languages, by default solved from GPAC preferences


[32mfout[0m

Description: File output

The file output filter is used to write output to disk, and does not produce any output PID.
It can work as a null sink when its destination is [33m[3mnull[0m, dropping all input packets. In this case it accepts ANY type of input pid, not just file ones.
In regular mode, the filter only accept pid of type file. It will dump to file incomming packets (stream type file), starting a new file for each packet having a [3mframe_start[0m flag set, unless operating in [33m[3mcat[0m mode.
If the output file name is [33m[3mstd[0m or [33m[3mstdout[0m, writes to stdout.
The ouput file name can use gpac templating mechanism, see [33m[3mgpac -h doc[0m.The filter watches the property [33m[3mFileNumber[0m on incoming packets to create new files.



[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mdst[0m (cstr):                    location of destination file - see filter help 
[32mstart[0m (dbl, default: [3m0.0[0m):     set playback start offset. Negative value means percent of media duration with -1 equal to duration
[32mspeed[0m (dbl, default: [3m1.0[0m):     set playback speed when vsync is on. If speed is negative and start is 0, start is set to -1
[32mow[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m):      overwrite output if existing
[32mmvbk[0m (uint, default: [3m8192[0m):    block size used when moving parts of the file around in patch mode
[32mredund[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): keep redundant packet in output file


[32muflatm[0m

Description: Raw AAC to LATM writer

This filter converts AAC streams into LATM encapsulated data.


[32mOptions (basic):[0m



[32mufadts[0m

Description: ADTS writer

This filter converts AAC streams into ADTS encapsulated data.


[32mOptions (basic):[0m



[32mufmhas[0m

Description: MHAS writer

This filter converts MPEG-H Audio streams into MHAS encapsulated data.


[32mOptions (basic):[0m



[32mreframer[0m

Description: Media Reframer

This filter provides various compressed domain tools on inputs:
- ensure reframing
- optionally force decoding
- real-time regulation
- packet filtering based on SAP types or frame numbers
- time-range extraction and splitting
This filter forces input pids to be properly framed (1 packet = 1 Access Unit).
It is typcially needed to force remultiplexing in file to file operations when source and destination files use the same format.
  

[32mSAP filtering[0m

The filter can remove packets based on their SAP types using [33m[3msaps[0m option.
For example, this can be used to extract only the key frame (SAP 1,2,3) of a video to create a trick mode version.
  

[32mFrame filtering[0m

This filter can keep only specific Access Units of the source using [33m[3mframes[0m option.
For example, this can be used to extract only specific key frame of a video to create a HEIF collection.
  

[32mFrame decoding[0m

This filter can force input media streams to be decoded using the [33m[3mraw[0m option.
[33mExample:
gpac src=m.mp4 reframer:raw=av @ [dst][0m

[32mReal-time Regulation[0m

The filter can perform real-time regulation of input packets, based on their timescale and timestamps.
For example to simulate a live DASH:
[33mExample:
gpac src=m.mp4 reframer:rt=on @ dst=live.mpd:dynamic[0m
  

[32mRange extraction[0m

The filter can perform time range extraction of the source using [33m[3mxs[0m and [33m[3mxe[0m options.
The formats allowed for times specifiers are:
	* [33m'T'H:M:S, 'T'M:S[0m: specify time in hours, minutes, seconds
	* [33m'T'H:M:S.MS, 'T'M:S.MS, 'T'S.MS[0m: specify time in hours, minutes, seconds and milliseconds
	* [33mINT, FLOAT[0m: specify time in seconds
	* [33mNUM/DEN[0m: specify time in seconds as fraction
	* [33m'F'NUM[0m: specify time as frame number
In this mode, the timestamps are rewritten to form a continuous timeline.
When multiple ranges are given, the filter will try to seek if needed and supported by source.

[33mExample:
gpac src=m.mp4 reframer:xs=T00:00:10,T00:01:10,T00:02:00:xe=T00:00:20,T00:01:20 [dst][0m
This will extract the time ranges [10s,20s], [1m10s,1m20s] and all media starting from 2m

If no end range is found for a given start range:
- if a following start range is set, the end range is set to this next start
- otherwise, the end range is open

[33mExample:
gpac src=m.mp4 reframer:xs=0,10,25:xe=5 [dst][0m
This will extract the time ranges [0s,5s], [10s,25s] and all media starting from 25s
[33mExample:
gpac src=m.mp4 reframer:xs=0,10,25 [dst][0m
This will extract the time ranges [0s,10s], [10s,25s] and all media starting from 25s

It is possible to signal range boundaries in output packets using [33m[3msplitrange[0m.
This will expose on the first packet of each range in each pid the following properties:
	* [33mFileNumber[0m: starting at 1 for the first range, to be used as replacement for $num$ in templates
	* [33mFileSuffix[0m: corresponding to [33m[3mStartRange_EndRange[0m or [33m[3mStartRange[0m for open ranges, to be used as replacement for $FS$ in templates

[33mExample:
gpac src=m.mp4 reframer:xs=T00:00:10,T00:01:10:xe=T00:00:20:splitrange -o dump_$FS$.264[0m
This will create two output files dump_T00.00.10_T00.02.00.264 and dump_T00.01.10.264.
[36m[3mNote: The [33m[1m:[36m[3m and [33m[1m/[36m[3m characters are replaced by [33m[1m.[36m[3m in [33m[1mFileSuffix[36m[3m property.[0m

It is possible to modify PID properties per range using [33m[3mprops[0m. Each set of property must be specified using the active separator set.
[33mExample:
gpac src=m.mp4 reframer:xs=0,30:props=#Period=P1,#Period=P2:#foo=bar[0m
This will assign to output PIDs
	* [33mduring the range [0,30][0m: property [33m[3mPeriod[0m to [33m[3mP1[0m
	* [33mduring the range [30, end][0m: properties [33m[3mPeriod[0m to [33m[3mP2[0m and property [33m[3mfoo[0m to [33m[3mbar[0m

For uncompressed audio pids, input frame will be split to closest audio sample number.

When [33m[3mxround[0m is set to [33m[3mseek[0m, the following applies:
- a single range shall be specified
- the first I-frame preceding or matching the range start is used as split point
- all packets before range start are marked as seek points
- packets overlapping range start are forwarded with a [33m[3mSkipBegin[0m property set to the amount of media to skip
- packets overlapping range end are forwarded with an adjusted duration to match the range end
This mode is typically used to extract a range in a frame/sample accurate way, rather than a GOP-aligned way.

When [33m[3mxround[0m is not set to [33m[3mseek[0m, compressed audio streams will still use seek mode.
Consequently, these streams will have modified edit lists in ISOBMFF which might not be properly handled by players.
This can be avoided using [33m[3mno_audio_seek[0m, but this will introduce audio delay.


[32mOther split actions[0m

The filter can perform splitting of the source using [33m[3mxs[0m option.
The additional formats allowed for [33m[3mxs[0m option are:
	* [33m'SAP'[0m: split source at each SAP/RAP
	* [33m'D'VAL[0m: split source by chunks of VAL ms
	* [33m'D'NUM/DEN[0m: split source by chunks of NUM/DEN seconds
	* [33m'S'VAL[0m: split source by chunks of estimated size VAL bytes, VAL can use property multipliers

[36m[3mNote: In these modes, [33m[1msplitrange[0m and [33m[1mxadjust[0m are implicitly set.[0m



[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mrt[0m (enum, default: [3moff[0m):       real-time regulation mode of input
	* [33moff[0m: disables real-time regulation
	* [33mon[0m: enables real-time regulation, one clock per pid
	* [33msync[0m: enables real-time regulation one clock for all pids

[32msaps[0m (uintl, minmax: 0|1|2|3|4): drop non-SAP packets, off by default. The list gives the SAP types (0,1,2,3,4) to forward. Note that forwarding only sap 0 will break the decoding

[32mrefs[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m):   forward only frames used as reference frames, if indicated in the input stream
[32mraw[0m (enum, default: [3mno[0m):       force input AV streams to be in raw format
	* [33mno[0m: do not force decoding of inputs
	* [33mav[0m: force decoding of audio and video inputs
	* [33ma[0m: force decoding of audio inputs
	* [33mv[0m: force decoding of video inputs

[32mxs[0m (strl):                     extraction start time(s), see filter help
[32mxe[0m (strl):                     extraction end time(s). If less values than start times, the last time interval extracted is an open range


[32mwritegen[0m

Description: Stream to file

Generic single stream to file converter, used when extracting/converting PIDs.
The writegen filter should usually not be explicetly loaded without a source ID specified, since the filter would likely match any pid connection.


[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mpfmt[0m (pfmt, default: [3mnone[0m, minmax: none,yuv420,yvu420,yuv420_10,yuv422,yuv422_10,yuv444,yuv444_10,uyvy,vyuy,yuyv,yvyu,uyvl,vyul,yuyl,yvyl,nv12,nv21,nv1l,nv2l,yuva,yuvd,yuv444a,yuv444p,yuv444ap,yuv444p_10,grey,algr,gral,rgb4,rgb5,rgb6,rgba,argb,bgra,abgr,rgb,bgr,xrgb,rgbx,xbgr,bgrx,rgbd,rgbds,rgbs,rgbas): pixel format for raw extract. If not set, derived from extension
[32mafmt[0m (afmt, default: [3mnone[0m, minmax: none,u8,s16,s24,s32,flt,dbl,u8p,s16p,s24p,s32p,fltp,dblp): audio format for raw extract. If not set, derived from extension
[32mframe[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m):  force single frame dump with no rewrite. In this mode, all codecids are supported
[32msstart[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m):     start number of frame to forward. If 0, all samples are forwarded
[32msend[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m):       end number of frame to forward. If less than start frame, all samples after start are forwarded
[32mdur[0m (frac, default: [3m0[0m):        duration of media to forward after first sample. If 0, all samples are forwarded
[32mmerge_region[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): merge TTML regions with same ID while reassembling TTML doc


[32mufnalu[0m

Description: AVC/HEVC to AnnexB writer

This filter converts AVC|H264 and HEVC streams into AnnexB format, with inband parameter sets and start codes.


[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mrcfg[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m):    force repeating decoder config at each I-frame
[32mpps_inband[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): inject PPS at each non SAP frame, ignored if rcfg is not set


[32mwriteqcp[0m

Description: QCP writer

This filter converts a single stream to a QCP output file.


[32mOptions (basic):[0m



[32mwritevtt[0m

Description: WebVTT writer

This filter converts a single stream to a WebVTT output file.


[32mOptions (basic):[0m



[32mnhntw[0m

Description: NHNT writer

This filter converts a single stream to an NHNT output file.
NHNT documentation is available at https://wiki.gpac.io/NHNT-Format



[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mlarge[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m):  use large file mode


[32mnhmlw[0m

Description: NHML writer

This filter converts a single stream to an NHML output file.
NHML documentation is available at https://wiki.gpac.io/NHML-Format



[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mname[0m (str):                    set output name of files produced (needed media/info files referred to from XML


[32mvobsubdmx[0m

Description: VobSub demuxer

This filter demultiplexes VobSub files/data to produce media PIDs and frames.


[32mOptions (basic):[0m



[32mavimx[0m

Description: AVI muxer

This filter multiplexes raw or compressed audio and video to produce an AVI output.

Unlike other multiplexing filters in GPAC, this filter is a sink filter and does not produce any PID to be redirected in the graph.
The filter can however use template names for its output, using the first input PID to resolve the final name.
The filter watches the property [33m[3mFileNumber[0m on incoming packets to create new files.



[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mdst[0m (cstr):                    location of destination file
[32mfps[0m (frac, default: [3m25/1[0m):     default framerate if none indicated in stream


[32maout[0m

Description: Audio output

This filter outputs a single uncompressed audio PID to a sound card or other audio output device.


[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mdrv[0m (cstr):                    audio driver name
[32mbnum[0m (uint, default: [3m2[0m):       number of audio buffers - 0 for auto
[32mbdur[0m (uint, default: [3m100[0m):     total duration of all buffers in ms - 0 for auto. The longer the audio buffer is, the longer the audio latency will be (pause/resume). The quality of fast forward audio playback will also be degradated when using large audio buffers
[32mspeed[0m (dbl, default: [3m1.0[0m, updatable): set playback speed. If speed is negative and start is 0, start is set to -1
[32mstart[0m (dbl, default: [3m0.0[0m, updatable): set playback start offset. Negative value means percent of media duration with -1 equal to duration
[32mvol[0m (uint, default: [3m100[0m, minmax: 0-100, updatable): set default audio volume, as a percentage between 0 and 100
[32mpan[0m (uint, default: [3m50[0m, minmax: 0-100, updatable): set stereo pan, as a percentage between 0 and 100, 50 being centered
[32mbuffer[0m (uint, default: [3m200[0m):   set playout buffer in ms
[32mmbuffer[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m):    set max buffer occupancy in ms (if less than buffer, use buffer)
[32mrbuffer[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m, updatable): rebuffer trigger in ms (if 0 or more than buffer, disable rebuffering


[32mufm4v[0m

Description: M4V writer

This filter converts MPEG-4 part 2 visual streams into dumpable format (reinsert decoder config).


[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mrcfg[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m):    force repeating decoder config at each I-frame


[32mresample[0m

Description: Audio resampler

This filter resamples raw audio to a target sample rate, number of channels or audio format.


[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32moch[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m):        desired number of output audio channels - 0 for auto
[32mosr[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m):        desired sample rate of output audio - 0 for auto
[32mofmt[0m (afmt, default: [3mnone[0m):    desired format of output audio - none for auto


[32mvout[0m

Description: Video output

This filter displays a single visual pid in a window.
The window is created unless a window handle (HWND, xWindow, etc) is indicated in the config file ( [Temp]OSWnd=ptr).
The output uses GPAC video output module indicated in [33m[3mdrv[0m option or in the config file (see GPAC core help).
The video output module can be further configured (see GPAC core help).
The filter can use OpenGL or 2D blit of the graphics card, depending on the OS support.
The filter can be used do dump frames as written on the graphics card.
In this case, the window is not visible and only the listed frames are drawn to the GPU.
The pixel format of the dumped frame is always RGB in OpenGL and matches the video backbuffer format in 2D mode.



[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mdrv[0m (cstr):                    video driver name
[32mstart[0m (dbl, default: [3m0.0[0m, updatable): set playback start offset. Negative value means percent of media duration with -1 equal to duration
[32mdur[0m (lfrac, default: [3m0[0m):       only play the specified duration
[32mspeed[0m (dbl, default: [3m1.0[0m, updatable): set playback speed when vsync is on. If speed is negative and start is 0, start is set to -1
[32mhold[0m (dbl, default: [3m1.0[0m):      number of seconds to hold display for single-frame streams. A negative value force a hold on last frame for single or multi-frames streams
[32mhide[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m):   hide output window
[32mfullscreen[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m, updatable): use fullscreen
[32mbuffer[0m (uint, default: [3m100[0m):   set playout buffer in ms
[32mmbuffer[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m):    set max buffer occupancy in ms (if less than buffer, use buffer)
[32mrbuffer[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m, updatable): rebuffer trigger in ms (if 0 or more than buffer, disable rebuffering


[32mvcrop[0m

Description: Video crop

This filter is used to crop raw video data.


[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mwnd[0m (str):                     size of output to crop, indicated as TxLxWxH. If % is indicated after a number, the value is in percent of the source width (for L and W) or height (for T and H). An absolute offset (+x, -x) can be added after percent


[32mvflip[0m

Description: Video flip

Filter used to flip video frames vertically, horizontally, in both directions or no flip


[32mOptions (basic):[0m



[32mrfrawvid[0m

Description: RAW video reframer

This filter parses raw YUV and RGB files/data and outputs corresponding raw video PID and frames.


[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32msize[0m (v2di, default: [3m0x0[0m):     source video resolution
[32mspfmt[0m (pfmt, default: [3mnone[0m, minmax: none,yuv420,yvu420,yuv420_10,yuv422,yuv422_10,yuv444,yuv444_10,uyvy,vyuy,yuyv,yvyu,uyvl,vyul,yuyl,yvyl,nv12,nv21,nv1l,nv2l,yuva,yuvd,yuv444a,yuv444p,yuv444ap,yuv444p_10,grey,algr,gral,rgb4,rgb5,rgb6,rgba,argb,bgra,abgr,rgb,bgr,xrgb,rgbx,xbgr,bgrx,rgbd,rgbds,rgbs,rgbas): source pixel format. When not set, derived from file extension
[32mfps[0m (frac, default: [3m25/1[0m):     number of frames per second
[32mcopy[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m):   copy source bytes into output frame. If not set, source bytes are referenced only


[32mrfpcm[0m

Description: PCM reframer

This filter parses raw PCM file/data and outputs corresponding raw audio PID and frames.


[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32msr[0m (uint, default: [3m44100[0m):     sample rate
[32msafmt[0m (afmt, default: [3mnone[0m, minmax: none,u8,s16,s24,s32,flt,dbl,u8p,s16p,s24p,s32p,fltp,dblp): audio format
[32mch[0m (uint, default: [3m2[0m):         number of channels


[32mjpgenc[0m

Description: JPG encoder

This filter encodes a single uncompressed video PID to JPEG using libjpeg.


[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mquality[0m (uint, default: [3m100[0m, minmax: 0-100, updatable): compression quality


[32mpngenc[0m

Description: PNG encoder

This filter encodes a single uncompressed video PID to PNG using libpng.

No options


[32mrewind[0m

Description: Audio/Video rewinder

This filter reverses audio and video frames in negative playback speed.
The filter is in passthrough if speed is positive. Otherwise, it reverts decoded GOPs for video, or revert samples in decoded frame for audio (not really nice for most codecs).


[32mOptions (basic):[0m



[32mflist[0m

Description: Sources concatenator

This filter can be used to play playlist files or a list of sources.

The filter loads any source supported by GPAC: remote or local files or streaming sessions (TS, RTP, DASH or other).
The filter forces input demultiplex and recomputes the input timestamps into a continuous timeline.
At each new source, the filter tries to remap input PIDs to already declared output PIDs of the same type, if any, or declares new output PIDs otherwise. If no input PID matches the type of an output, no packets are send for that PID.


[32mSource list mode[0m

The source list mode is activated by using [33m[3mflist:srcs=f1[,f2][0m, where f1 can be a file or a directory to enumerate.
The syntax for directory enumeration is:
	* [33mdir/*[0m: enumerates everything in dir
	* [33mfoo/*.png[0m: enumerates all files with extension png in foo
	* [33mfoo/*.png;*.jpg[0m: enumerates all files with extension png or jpg in foo

The resulting file list can be sorted using [33m[3mfsort[0m.
If the sort mode is [33m[3mdatex[0m and source files are images or single frame files, the following applies:
- options [33m[3mfloop[0m, [33m[3mrevert[0m and [33m[3mdur[0m are ignored
- the files are sorted by modification time
- the first frame is assigned a timestamp of 0
- each frame (coming from each file) is assigned a duration equal to the difference of modification time between the file and the next file
- the last frame is assigned the same duration as the previous one

[32mPlaylist mode[0m

The playlist mode is activated when opening a playlist file (m3u format, utf-8 encoding, default extensions [33m[3mm3u[0m, [33m[3mtxt[0m or [33m[3mpl[0m).
In this mode, directives can be given in a comment line, i.e. a line starting with '#' before the line with the file name.
Lines stating with [33m[3m##[0m are ignored.

The playlist file is refreshed whenever the next source has to be reloaded in order to allow for dynamic pushing of sources in the playlist.
If the last URL played cannot be found in the playlist, the first URL in the playlist file will be loaded.

When [33m[3mka[0m is used to keep refreshing the playlist on regular basis, the playlist must end with a new line.
Playlist refreshing will abort:
- if the input playlist has a line not ending with a LF [33m[3m(\n)[0m character, in order to avoid asynchronous issues when reading the playlist.
- if the input playlist has not been modified for 60 times the refresh rate (based on file system modification time info).

[35mPlaylist directives[0m
A playlist directive line can contain zero or more directives, separated with space. The following directives are supported:
	* [33mrepeat=N[0m: repeats N times the content (hence played N+1).
	* [33mstart=T[0m: tries to play the file from start time T seconds (double format only). This may not work with some files/formats not supporting seeking.
	* [33mstop=T[0m: stops source playback after T seconds (double format only). This works on any source (implemented independently from seek support).
	* [33mcat[0m: specifies that the following entry should be concatenated to the previous source rather than opening a new source. This can optionally specify a byte range if desired, otherwise the full file is concatenated.
[36m[3mNote: When sources are ISOBMFF files or segments on local storage or GF_FileIO objects, the concatenation will be automatically detected.[0m
	* [33msrange=T[0m: when cat is set, indicates the start T (64 bit decimal, default 0) of the byte range from the next entry to concatenate.
	* [33msend=T[0m: when cat is set, indicates the end T (64 bit decimal, default 0) of the byte range from the next entry to concatenate.
	* [33mprops=STR[0m: assigns properties described in [33m[3mSTR[0m to all pids coming from the listed sources on next line. [33m[3mSTR[0m is formatted according to [33m[3mgpac -h doc[0m using the default parameter set.
	* [33mdel[0m: specifies that the source file(s) must be deleted once processed, true by default is [33m[3mfdel[0m is set.
	* [33mout=V[0m: specifies splicing start time (cf below).
	* [33min=V[0m: specifies splicing end time (cf below).
	* [33mnosync[0m: prevents timestamp adjustments when joining sources (implied if [33m[3mcat[0m is set).
	* [33mkeep[0m: keeps spliced period in output (cf below).
	* [33mmark[0m: only inject marker for the splice period and do not load any replacement content (cf below).
	* [33msprops=STR[0m: assigns properties described in [33m[3mSTR[0m to all pids of the main content during a splice (cf below). [33m[3mSTR[0m is formatted according to [33m[3mgpac -h doc[0m using the default parameter set.

The following global options (applying to the filter, not the sources) may also be set in the playlist:
	* [33mka=N[0m: force [33m[3mka[0m option to [33m[3mN[0m millisecond refresh.
	* [33mfloop=N[0m: set [33m[3mfloop[0m option from within playlist.
	* [33mraw[0m: set [33m[3mraw[0m option from within playlist.

The default behavior when joining sources is to realign the timeline origin of the new source to the maximum time in all pids of the previous sources.
This may create gaps in the timeline in case each pid are not of equal duration (quite common with most audio codecs).
Using [33m[3mnosync[0m directive will disable this realignment and provide a continuous timeline but may introduce synchronization errors depending in the source encoding (use with caution).

[35mSource syntax[0m
The source lines follow the usual source syntax, see [33m[3mgpac -h[0m.
Additional pid properties can be added per source (see [33m[3mgpac -h doc[0m), but are valid only for the current source, and reset at next source.

The URL given can either be a single URL, or a list of URLs separated by " && " to load several sources for the active entry.

[31m[1mWarning: There shall not be any other space/tab characters between sources.[0m

[33mExample:
audio.mp4 && video.mp4[0m

[35mSource with filter chains[0m
Each URL can be followed by a chain of one or more filters, using the [33m[3m@[0m link directive as used in gpac (see [33m[3mgpac -h doc[0m).
A negative link index (e.g. [33m[3m@-1[0m) can be used to setup a new filter chain starting from the last specified source in the line.

[31m[1mWarning: There shall be a single character, with value space (' '), before and after each link directive.[0m


[33mExample:
src.mp4 @ reframer:rt=on[0m
This will inject a reframer with real-time regulation between source and [33m[3mflist[0m filter.
[33mExample:
src.mp4 @ reframer:saps=1 @1 reframer:saps=0,2,3[0m
[33msrc.mp4 @ reframer:saps=1 @-1 reframer:saps=0,2,3[0m
This will inject a reframer filtering only SAP1 frames and a reframer filtering only non-SAP1 frames between source and [33m[3mflist[0m filter

Link options can be specified (see [33m[3mgpac -h doc[0m).
[33mExample:
src.mp4 @#video reframer:rt=on[0m
This will inject a reframer with real-time regulation between video pid of source and [33m[3mflist[0m filter.

When using filter chains, the [33m[3mflist[0m filter will only accept PIDs from the last declared filter in the chain.
In order to accept other PIDs from the source, you must specify a final link directive with no following filter.
[33mExample:
src.mp4 @#video reframer:rt=on @-1#audio[0m
This will inject a reframer with real-time regulation between video pid of source and [33m[3mflist[0m filter, and will also allow audio pids from source to connect to [33m[3mflist[0m filter.

The empty link directive can also be used on the last declared filter
[33mExample:
src.mp4 @ reframer:rt=on @#audio[0m
This will inject a reframer with real-time regulation between source and [33m[3mflist[0m filter and only connect audio pids to [33m[3mflist[0m filter.

[35mSplicing[0m
The playlist can be used to splice content with other content following a media in the playlist.
A source item is declared as main media in a splice operation if and only if it has an [33m[3mout[0m directive set (possibly empty).
Directive can be used for the main media except concatenation directives.

The splicing operations do not alter media frames and do not perform uncompressed domain operations such as cross-fade or mixing.

The [33m[3mout[0m (resp. [33m[3min[0m) directive specifies the media splice start (resp. end) time. The value can be formatted as follows:
	* [33mempty[0m: the time is not yet assigned
	* [33m`now`[0m: the time is resolved to the next SAP point in the media
	* [33minteger, float or fraction[0m: set time in seconds
	* [33m`+VAL`[0m: used for [33m[3min[0m only, specify the end point as delta in seconds from the start point ([33m[3mVAL[0m can be integer, float or fraction)
	* [33mDATE[0m: set splice time according to wall clock [33m[3mDATE[0m, formatted as an [33m[3mXSD dateTime[0m
The splice times (except wall clock) are expressed in the source (main media) timing, not the reconstructed output timeline.

When a splice begins ([33m[3mout[0m time reached), the source items following the main media are played until the end of the splice or the end of the main media.
Sources used during the splice period can use directives such as [33m[3mstart[0m, [33m[3mdur[0m or [33m[3mrepeat[0m.

Once a splice is done ([33m[3min[0m time reached), the main media [33m[3mout[0m splice time is reset to undefined.

When the main media has undefined [33m[3mout[0m or [33m[3min[0m splice times, the playlist is reloaded at each new main media packet to check for resolved values.
- [33m[3mout[0m can only be modified when no splice is active, otherwise it is ignored. If modified, it resets the next source to play to be the one following the modified main media.
- [33m[3min[0m can only be modified when a splice is active with an undefined end time, otherwise it is ignored.

When the main media is over:
- if [33m[3mrepeat[0m directive is set, the main media is repeated, [33m[3min[0m and [33m[3mout[0m set to their initial values and the next splicing content is the one following the main content,
- otherwise, the next source queued is the one following the last source played during the last splice period.

It is allowed to defined several main media in the playlist, but a main media is not allowed as media for a splice period.

The filter will look for the property [33m[3mPeriod[0m on the output PIDs of the main media for multi-period DASH.
If found, [33m[3m_N[0m is appended to the period ID, with [33m[3mN[0m starting from 1 and increased at each main media resume.
If no [33m[3mPeriod[0m property is set on main or spliced media, period switch can still be forced using [33m[3m-pswitch[0m DASH option.

If [33m[3mmark[0m directive is set for a main media, no content replacement is done and the splice boundaries will be signaled in the main media.
If [33m[3mkeep[0m directive is set for a main media, the main media is forwarded along with the replacement content.
When [33m[3mmark[0m or [33m[3mkeep[0m directives are set, it is possible to alter the PID properties of the main media using [33m[3msprops[0m directive.

[33mExample:
#out=2 in=4 mark sprops=#xlink=http://foo.bar/[0m
[33msrc:#Period=main[0m
This will inject property xlink on the output pids in the splice zone (corresponding to period [33m[3mmain_2[0m) but not in the rest of the main media.

Directives [33m[3mmark[0m, [33m[3mkeep[0m and [33m[3msprops[0m are reset at the end of the splice period.



[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mfloop[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m):      loop playlist/list of files, [33m[3m0[0m for one time, [33m[3mn[0m for n+1 times, [33m[3m-1[0m for indefinitely
[32msrcs[0m (strl):                   list of files to play - see filter help
[32mfdur[0m (frac, default: [3m1/25[0m):    for source files with a single frame, sets frame duration. 0/NaN fraction means reuse source timing which is usually not set!
[32mfsort[0m (enum, default: [3mno[0m):     sort list of files
	* [33mno[0m: no sorting, use default directory enumeration of OS
	* [33mname[0m: sort by alphabetical name
	* [33msize[0m: sort by increasing size
	* [33mdate[0m: sort by increasing modification time
	* [33mdatex[0m: sort by increasing modification time - see filter help

[32mraw[0m (enum, default: [3mno[0m):       force input AV streams to be in raw format
	* [33mno[0m: do not force decoding of inputs
	* [33mav[0m: force decoding of audio and video inputs
	* [33ma[0m: force decoding of audio inputs
	* [33mv[0m: force decoding of video inputs



[32mm2tsmx[0m

Description: MPEG-2 TS muxer

GPAC TS multiplexer selects M2TS PID for media streams using the PID of the PMT plus the stream index.
For example, default config creates the first program with a PMT PID 100, the first stream will have a PID of 101.
Streams are grouped in programs based on input PID property ServiceID if present. If absent, stream will go in the program with service ID as indicated by [33m[3msid[0m option.
- [33m[3mname[0m option is overridden by input PID property [33m[3mServiceName[0m.
- [33m[3mprovider[0m option is overridden by input PID property [33m[3mServiceProvider[0m.
- [33m[3mpcr_offset[0m option is overridden by input PID property [33m[3m"tsmux:pcr_offset"[0m
- [33m[3mfirst_pts[0m option is overridden by input PID property [33m[3m"tsmux:force_pts"[0m
- [33m[3mtemi[0m option is overridden by input PID property [33m[3m"tsmux:temi"[0m


[32mTime and External Media Information (TEMI)[0m

The [33m[3mtemi[0m option allows specifying a list of URLs or timeline IDs to insert in streams of a program.
One or more TEMI timeline can be specified per PID.
The syntax is a comma-separated list of one or more TEMI description.
Each TEMI description is formatted as ID_OR_URL or #OPT1[#OPT2]#ID_OR_URL. Options are:
	* [33mS`N`[0m: gives number N indicating the target serviceID
	* [33mT`N`[0m: set timescale to use (default: PID timescale)
	* [33mD`N`[0m: set delay in ms between two TEMI url descriptors (default 1000)
	* [33mO`N`[0m: set offset (max 64 bits) to add to TEMI timecodes (default 0). If timescale is not specified, offset value is in ms, otherwise in timescale units.
	* [33mI`N`[0m: set initial value (max 64 bits) of TEMI timecodes. If not set, initial value will match first packet CTS. If timescale is not specified, value is in PID timescale units, otherwise in specified timescale units.
	* [33mP`N`[0m: indicate target PID in program. Possible values are
	  * [33m`V`[0m: only insert for video streams.
	  * [33m`A`[0m: only insert for audio streams.
	  * [33m`T`[0m: only insert for text streams.
	  * [33mN[0m: only insert for stream with index N (0-based) in the program.
	* [33mL`N`[0m: set 64bit timecode signaling. Possible values are:
	  * [33m`A`[0m: automatic switch between 32 and 64 bit depending on timecode value (default if not specified).
	  * [33m`Y`[0m: use 64 bit signaling only.
	  * [33m`N`[0m: use 32 bit signaling only and wrap around timecode value.
	* [33mN[0m: insert NTP timestamp in TEMI timeline descriptor
	* [33mID_OR_URL[0m: If number, indicates the TEMI ID to use for external timeline. Otherwise, gives the URL to insert
  
[33mExample:
temi="url"[0m
Inserts a TEMI URL+timecode in the each stream of each program.
[33mExample:
temi="#P0#url,#P1#4"[0m
Inserts a TEMI URL+timecode in the first stream of all programs and an external TEMI with ID 4 in the second stream of all programs.
[33mExample:
temi="#P0#2,#P0#url,#P1#4"[0m
Inserts a TEMI with ID 2 and a TEMI URL+timecode in the first stream of all programs, and an external TEMI with ID 4 in the second stream of all programs.
[33mExample:
temi="#S20#4,#S10#URL"[0m
Inserts an external TEMI with ID 4 in the each stream of program with ServiceID 20 and a TEMI URL in each stream of program with ServiceID 10.
[33mExample:
temi="#N#D500#PV#T30000#4"[0m
Inserts an external TEMI with ID 4 and timescale 30000, NTP injection and carousel of 500 ms in the video stream of all programs.


[31m[1mWarning: multipliers (k,m,g) are not supported in TEMI options.[0m


[32mNotes[0m

In DASH mode, the PCR is always initialized at 0, and [33m[3mflush_rap[0m is automatically set.
The filter watches the property [33m[3mFileNumber[0m on incoming packets to create new files or new segments in DASH mode.



[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mpmt_id[0m (uint, default: [3m100[0m):   define the ID of the first PMT to use in the mux
[32mrate[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m):       target rate in bps of the multiplex. If not set, variable rate is used
[32mpmt_rate[0m (uint, default: [3m200[0m): interval between PMT in ms
[32mpat_rate[0m (uint, default: [3m200[0m): interval between PAT in ms
[32mnb_pack[0m (uint, default: [3m4[0m):    pack N TS packets in output packets
[32mrealtime[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): use real-time output
[32mpcr_init[0m (lsint, default: [3m-1[0m): set initial PCR value for the programs. Negative value implies random value is picked
[32msid[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m):        set service ID for the program - see filter help
[32mname[0m (str):                    set service name for the program - see filter help
[32mprovider[0m (str):                set service provider name for the program - see filter help
[32msdt_rate[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m):   interval in ms between two DVB SDT tables. If 0, SDT is disabled


[32mdasher[0m

Description: DASH and HLS segmenter


[32mGPAC DASH and HLS segmenter[0m

This filter provides segmentation and manifest generation for MPEG-DASH and HLS formats.
The segmenter currently supports:
- MPD and m3u8 generation (potentially in parallel)
- ISOBMFF, MPEG-2 TS, MKV and raw bitstream segment formats
- override of profiles and levels in manifest for codecs
- most MPEG-DASH profiles
- static and dynamic (live) manifest offering
- context store and reload for batch processing of live/dynamic sessions

The filter does perform per-segment real-time regulation using [33m[3msreg[0m.
If you need per-frame real-time regulation on non-real-time inputs, insert a [33m[3mreframer[0m before to perform real-time regulation.
[33mExample:
src=file.mp4 reframer:rt=on @ -o live.mpd:dmode=dynamic[0m

[35mTemplate strings[0m
The segmenter uses templates to derive output file names, regardless of the DASH mode (even when templates are not used). The default one is [33m[3m$File$_dash[0m for ondemand and single file modes, and [33m[3m$File$_$Number$[0m for separate segment files
[33mExample:
template=Great_$File$_$Width$_$Number$[0m
If input is foo.mp4 with 640x360 video, this will resolve in Great_foo_640_$Number$ for the DASH template.
[33mExample:
template=Great_$File$_$Width$[0m
If input is foo.mp4 with 640x360 video, this will resolve in Great_foo_640.mp4 for onDemand case.

Standard DASH replacement strings: 
	* [33m$Number[%%0Nd]$[0m: replaced by the segment number, possibly prefixed with 0
	* [33m$RepresentationID$[0m: replaced by representation name
	* [33m$Time$[0m: replaced by segment start time
	* [33m$Bandwidth$[0m: replaced by representation bandwidth.
[36m[3mNote: these strings are not replaced in the manifest templates elements.[0m

Additional replacement strings (not DASH, not generic GPAC replacements but may occur multiple times in template):
	* [33m$Init=NAME$[0m: replaced by NAME for init segment, ignored otherwise
	* [33m$XInit=NAME$[0m: complete replace by NAME for init segment, ignored otherwise
	* [33m$Index=NAME$[0m: replaced by NAME for index segments, ignored otherwise
	* [33m$Path=PATH$[0m: replaced by PATH when creating segments, ignored otherwise
	* [33m$Segment=NAME$[0m: replaced by NAME for media segments, ignored for init segments
	* [33m$FS$ (FileSuffix)[0m: replaced by [33m[3m_trackN[0m in case the input is an AV multiplex, or kept empty otherwise
[36m[3mNote: these strings are replaced in the manifest templates elements.[0m


[35mPID assignment and configuration[0m
To assign PIDs into periods and adaptation sets and configure the session, the segmenter looks for the following properties on each input pid:
	* [33mRepresentation[0m: assigns representation ID to input pid. If not set, the default behavior is to have each media component in different adaptation sets. Setting the RepresentationID allows explicit multiplexing of the source(s)
	* [33mPeriod[0m: assigns period ID to input pid. If not set, the default behavior is to have all media in the same period with the same start time
	* [33mPStart[0m: assigns period start. If not set, 0 is assumed, and periods appear in the Period ID declaration order. If negative, this gives the period order (-1 first, then -2 ...). If positive, this gives the true start time and will abort DASHing at period end
[36m[3mNote: When both positive and negative values are found, the by-order periods (negative) will be inserted AFTER the timed period (positive)[0m
	* [33mASID[0m: assigns parent adaptation set ID. If not 0, only sources with same AS ID will be in the same adaptation set
[36m[3mNote: If multiple streams in source, only the first stream will have an AS ID assigned[0m
	* [33mxlink[0m: for remote periods, only checked for null pid
	* [33mRole, PDesc, ASDesc, ASCDesc, RDesc[0m: various descriptors to set for period, AS or representation
	* [33mBUrl[0m: overrides segmenter [-base] with a set of BaseURLs to use for the pid (per representation)
	* [33mTemplate[0m: overrides segmenter [33m[3mtemplate[0m for this PID
	* [33mDashDur[0m: overrides segmenter segment duration for this PID
	* [33mStartNumber[0m: sets the start number for the first segment in the PID, default is 1
	* [33mIntraOnly[0m: indicates input pid follows HLS EXT-X-I-FRAMES-ONLY guidelines
	* [33mNon-dash properties[0m: Bitrate, SAR, Language, Width, Height, SampleRate, NumChannels, Language, ID, DependencyID, FPS, Interlaced, Codec. These properties are used to setup each representation and can be overridden on input PIDs using the general PID property settings (cf global help).
  
[33mExample:
src=test.mp4:#Bitrate=1M dst=test.mpd[0m
This will force declaring a bitrate of 1M for the representation, regardless of actual input bitrate.
[33mExample:
src=muxav.mp4 dst=test.mpd[0m
This will create unmuxed DASH segments.
[33mExample:
src=muxav.mp4:#Representation=1 dst=test.mpd[0m
This will create muxed DASH segments.
[33mExample:
src=m1.mp4 src=m2.mp4:#Period=Yep dst=test.mpd[0m
