This will put src m1.mp4 in first period, m2.mp4 in second period.
[33mExample:
src=m1.mp4:#BUrl=http://foo/bar dst=test.mpd[0m
This will assign a baseURL to src m1.mp4.
[33mExample:
src=m1.mp4:#ASCDesc=<ElemName val="attval">text</ElemName> dst=test.mpd[0m
This will assign the specified XML descriptor to the adaptation set.
[36m[3mNote:  this can be used to inject most DASH descriptors not natively handled by the segmenter.[0m
The segmenter handles the XML descriptor as a string and does not attempt to validate it. Descriptors, as well as some segmenter filter arguments, are string lists (comma-separated by default), so that multiple descriptors can be added:
[33mExample:
src=m1.mp4:#RDesc=<Elem attribute="1"/>,<Elem2>text</Elem2> dst=test.mpd[0m
This will insert two descriptors in the representation(s) of m1.mp4.
[33mExample:
src=video.mp4:#Template=foo$Number$ src=audio.mp4:#Template=bar$Number$ dst=test.mpd[0m
This will assign different templates to the audio and video sources.
[33mExample:
src=null:#xlink=http://foo/bar.xml:#PDur=4 src=m.mp4:#PStart=-1[0m
This will insert an create an MPD with first a remote period then a regular one.
[33mExample:
src=null:#xlink=http://foo/bar.xml:#PStart=6 src=m.mp4[0m
This will create an MPD with first a regular period, dashing ony 6s of content, then a remote one.

The segmenter will create muxing filter chains for each representation and will reassign PID IDs so that each media component (video, audio, ...) in an adaptation set has the same ID.

For HLS, the output pid will deliver the master playlist [1mand[0m the variant playlists.
The default variant playlist are $NAME_$N.m3u8, where $NAME is the radical of the output file name and $N is the 1-based index of the variant.


[35mSegmentation[0m
The default behavior of the segmenter is to estimate the theoretical start time of each segment based on target segment duration, and start a new segment when a packet with SAP type 1,2,3 or 4 with time greater than the theoretical time is found.
This behavior can be changed to find the best SAP packet around a segment theoretical boundary using [33m[3msbound[0m:
	* [33mclosest mode[0m: the segment will start at the closest SAP of the theoretical boundary
	* [33min mode[0m: the segment will start at or before the theoretical boundary

[31m[1mWarning: These modes will introduce delay in the segmenter (typically buffering of one GOP) and should not be used for low-latency modes.[0m

The segmenter can also be configured to:
- completely ignore SAP when segmenting using [33m[3msap[0m.
- ignore SAP on non-video streams when segmenting using [33m[3mstrict_sap[0m.


[35mDynamic (real-time live) Mode[0m
The dasher does not perform real-time regulation by default.
For regular segmentation, you should enable segment regulation [33m[3msreg[0m if your sources are not real-time.
[33mExample:
gpac -i source.mp4 -o live.mpd:segdur=2:profile=live:dmode=dynamic:sreg[0m

For low latency segmentation with fMP4, you will need to specify the following options:
	* [33mcdur[0m: set the fMP4 fragment duration
	* [33masto[0m: set the availability time offset for DASH. This value should be equal or slightly greater than segment duration minus cdur
	* [33mllhls[0m: enable low latency for HLS
If your sources are not real-time, insert a reframer filter with real-time regulation
[33mExample:
gpac -i source.mp4 reframer:rt=on @ -o live.mpd:segdur=2:cdur=0.2:asto=1.8:profile=live:dmode=dynamic[0m
This will create DASH segments of 2 seconds made of fragments of 200 ms and indicate to the client that requests can be made 1.8 seconds earlier than segment complete availability on server.
[33mExample:
gpac -i source.mp4 reframer:rt=on @ -o live.m3u8:segdur=2:cdur=0.2:llhls=br:dmode=dynamic[0m
This will create DASH segments of 2 seconds made of fragments of 200 ms and produce HLS low latency parts using byte ranges in the final segment.
[33mExample:
gpac -i source.mp4 reframer:rt=on @ -o live.m3u8:segdur=2:cdur=0.2:llhls=sf:dmode=dynamic[0m
This will create DASH segments of 2 seconds made of fragments of 200 ms and produce HLS low latency parts using dedicated files.

You can combine LL-HLS and DASH-LL generation:
[33mExample:
gpac -i source.mp4 reframer:rt=on @ -o live.mpd:dual:segdur=2:cdur=0.2:asto=1.8:llhls=br:profile=live:dmode=dynamic[0m

For DASH, the filter will use the local clock for UTC anchor points in DASH.
The filter can fetch and signal clock in other ways using [33m[3mutcs[0m.
[33mExample:
[opts]:utcs=inband[0m
This will use the local clock and insert in the MPD a UTCTiming descriptor containing the local clock.
[33mExample:
[opts]::utcs=http://time.akamai.com[::opts][0m
This will fetch time from [33m[3mhttp://time.akamai.com[0m, use it as the UTC reference for segment generation and insert in the MPD a UTCTiming descriptor containing the time server URL.
[36m[3mNote: if not set as a global option using [33m[1m--utcs=[36m[3m, you must escape the url using double [33m[1m::[36m[3m or use other separators.[0m


[35mCue-driven segmentation[0m
The segmenter can take a list of instructions, or Cues, to use for the segmentation process, in which case only these are used to derive segment boundaries. Cues can be set through XML files or injected in input packets.

Cue files can be specified for the entire segmenter, or per PID using [33m[3mDashCue[0m property.
Cues are given in an XML file with a root element called <DASHCues>, with currently no attribute specified. The children are one or more <Stream> elements, with attributes:
	* [33mid[0m: integer for stream/track/pid ID
	* [33mtimescale[0m: integer giving the units of following timestamps
	* [33mmode[0m: if present and value is [33m[3medit[0m, the timestamp are in presentation time (edit list applied) otherwise they are in media time
	* [33mts_offset[0m: integer giving a value (in timescale) to subtract to the DTS/CTS values listed

The children of <Stream> are one or more <Cue> elements, with attributes:
	* [33msample[0m: integer giving the sample/frame number of a sample at which splitting shall happen
	* [33mdts[0m: long integer giving the decoding time stamp of a sample at which splitting shall happen
	* [33mcts[0m: long integer giving the composition / presentation time stamp of a sample at which splitting shall happen

[31m[1mWarning: Cues shall be listed in decoding order.[0m


If the [33m[3mDashCue[0m property of a PID equals [33m[3minband[0m, the PID will be segmented according to the [33m[3mCueStart[0m property of input packets.
This feature is typically combined with a list of files as input:
[33mExample:
-i list.m3u:sigcues -o res/live.mpdThis will load the [33m[3mflist[33m filter in cue mode, generating continuous timelines from the sources and injecting a [33m[3mCueStart[33m property at each new file.[0m

[35mManifest Generation only mode[0m
The segmenter can be used to generate manifests from already fragmented ISOBMFF inputs using [33m[3msigfrag[0m.
In this case, segment boundaries are attached to each packet starting a segment and used to drive the segmentation.
This can be used with single-track ISOBMFF sources, either single file or multi file.
For single file source:
- if onDemand [33m[3mprofile[0m is requested, sources have to be formatted as a DASH self-initializing media segment with the proper sidx.
- templates are disabled.
- [33m[3msseg[0m is forced for all profiles except onDemand ones.
For multi files source:
- input shall be a playlist containing the initial file followed by the ordered list of segments.
- if no [33m[3mtemplate[0m is provided, the full or main [33m[3mprofile[0m will be used
	* [33mif [-template]() is provided, it shall be correct[0m: the filter will not try to guess one from the input file names and will not validate it either.

The manifest generation-only mode supports both MPD and HLS generation.

[33mExample:
-i ondemand_src.mp4 -o dash.mpd:sigfrag:profile=onDemand[0m
This will generate a DASH manifest for onDemand Profile based on the input file.
[33mExample:
-i ondemand_src.mp4 -o dash.m3u8:sigfrag[0m
This will generate a HLS manifest based on the input file.
[33mExample:
-i seglist.txt -o dash.mpd:sigfrag[0m
This will generate a DASH manifest in Main Profile based on the input files.
[33mExample:
-i seglist.txt:Template=$XInit=init$$q1/$Number$ -o dash.mpd:sigfrag:profile=live[0m
This will generate a DASH manifest in live Profile based on the input files. The input file will contain [33m[3minit.mp4[0m, [33m[3mq1/1.m4s[0m, [33m[3mq1/2.m4s[0m...


[35mMuxer development considerations[0m
Output muxers allowing segmented output must obey the following:
- inspect packet properties
	 * [33mFileNumber[0m: if set, indicate the start of a new DASH segment
	 * [33mFileName[0m: if set, indicate the file name. If not present, output shall be a single file. This is only set for packet carrying the [33m[3mFileNumber[0m property, and only on one PID (usually the first) for multiplexed outputs
	 * [33mIDXName[0m: gives the optional index name (if not present, index shall be in the same file as dash segment). Only used for MPEG-2 TS for now
	 * [33mEODS[0m: property is set on packets with no payload and no timestamp to signal the end of a DASH segment. This is only used when stopping/resuming the segmentation process, in order to flush segments without dispatching an EOS (see [33m[3msubdur[0m )
- for each segment done, send a downstream event on the first connected PID signaling the size of the segment and the size of its index if any
- for muxers with init data, send a downstream event signaling the size of the init and the size of the global index if any
- the following filter options are passed to muxers, which should declare them as arguments:
	 * [33mnoinit[0m: disables output of init segment for the muxer (used to handle bitstream switching with single init in DASH)
	 * [33mfrag[0m: indicates muxer shall use fragmented format (used for ISOBMFF mostly)
	 * [33msubs_sidx=0[0m: indicates an SIDX shall be generated - only added if not already specified by user
	 * [33mxps_inband=all|no[0m: indicates AVC/HEVC/... parameter sets shall be sent inband or out of band
	 * [33mnofragdef[0m: indicates fragment defaults should be set in each segment rather than in init segment

The segmenter will add the following properties to the output PIDs:
	* [33mDashMode[0m: identifies VoD (single file with global index) or regular DASH mode used by segmenter
	* [33mDashDur[0m: identifies target DASH segment duration - this can be used to estimate the SIDX size for example



[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32msegdur[0m (frac, default: [3m0/0[0m):   target segment duration in seconds. A value less than or equal to 0 means to 1.0 second
[32mtpl[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m):     use template mode (multiple segment, template URLs)
[32mstl[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m):    use segment timeline (ignored in on_demand mode)
[32mdmode[0m (enum, default: [3mstatic[0m, updatable): dash content mode
	* [33mstatic[0m: static content
	* [33mdynamic[0m: live generation
	* [33mdynlast[0m: last call for live, will turn the MPD into static

[32msap[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m):     enable splitting segments at SAP boundaries
[32mm2ts[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m):   generate MPEG-2 TS output
[32mtemplate[0m (str):                template string to use to generate segment name - see filter help
[32msegext[0m (str):                  file extension to use for segments
[32minitext[0m (str):                 file extension to use for the init segment
[32mmuxtype[0m (enum, default: [3mauto[0m): muxtype to use for the segments
	* [33mmp4[0m: uses ISOBMFF format
	* [33mts[0m: uses MPEG-2 TS format
	* [33mmkv[0m: uses Matroska format
	* [33mwebm[0m: uses WebM format
	* [33mogg[0m: uses OGG format
	* [33mraw[0m: uses raw media format (disables muxed representations)
	* [33mauto[0m: guess format based on extension, default to mp4 if no extension

[32mprofile[0m (enum, default: [3mauto[0m): target DASH profile. This will set default option values to ensure conformance to the desired profile. For MPEG-2 TS, only main and live are used, others default to main
	* [33mauto[0m: turns profile to live for dynamic and full for non-dynamic
	* [33mlive[0m: DASH live profile, using segment template
	* [33monDemand[0m: MPEG-DASH live profile
	* [33mmain[0m: MPEG-DASH main profile, using segment list
	* [33mfull[0m: MPEG-DASH full profile
	* [33mhbbtv1.5.live[0m: HBBTV 1.5 DASH profile
	* [33mdashavc264.live[0m: DASH-IF live profile
	* [33mdashavc264.onDemand[0m: DASH-IF onDemand profile
	* [33mdashif.ll[0m: DASH IF low-latency profile (set UTC server to time.akamai.com if none set)

[32mbuf[0m (sint, default: [3m-100[0m):     min buffer duration in ms. negative value means percent of segment duration (eg -150 = 1.5*seg_dur)
[32mcheck_dur[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m): check duration of sources in period, trying to have roughly equal duration. Enforced whenever period start times are used
[32mtitle[0m (str):                   MPD title
[32msource[0m (str):                  MPD Source
[32minfo[0m (str):                    MPD info url
[32mcprt[0m (str):                    MPD copyright string
[32mlang[0m (str):                    language of MPD Info
[32mlocation[0m (strl):               set MPD locations to given URL
[32mtsb[0m (dbl, default: [3m30[0m):        time-shift buffer depth in seconds. A negative value means infinity


[32mtileagg[0m

Description: HEVC tile aggregator

This filter reaggregates a set of split tiled HEVC streams ([33m[3mhvt1[0m or [33m[3mhvt2[0m in isobmff) into a single HEVC stream.


[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mtiledrop[0m (uintl, default: [3m[0m, updatable): specify indexes of tiles to drop


[32mtilesplit[0m

Description: HEVC tile bitstream splitter

This filter splits an HEVC tiled stream into tiled HEVC streams ([33m[3mhvt1[0m or [33m[3mhvt2[0m in isobmff).
The filter will move to passthrough mode if the bitstream is not tiled.
If the [33m[3mBitrate[0m property is set on the input PID, the output tile PIDs will have a bitrate set to [33m[3m(Bitrate - 10k)/nb_opids[0m, 10 kbps being reserved for the base.

Each tile PID will be assigned the following properties:
	* [33m`ID`[0m: equal to the base PID ID (same as input) plus the 1-based index of the tile in raster scan order.
	* [33m`TileID`[0m: equal to the 1-based index of the tile in raster scan order.


[31m[1mWarning: The filter does not check if tiles are independently-coded (MCTS) ![0m



[31m[1mWarning: Support for dynamic changes of tiling grid has not been tested ![0m




[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mtiledrop[0m (uintl, default: [3m[0m, updatable): specify indexes of tiles to drop (0-based, in tile raster scan order)


[32mpin[0m

Description: pipe input

This filter handles generic input pipes (mono-directional) in blocking or non blocking mode.

[31m[1mWarning: Input pipes cannot seek.[0m

Data format of the pipe may be specified using extension (either in file name or through [33m[3mext[0m) or MIME type through [33m[3mmime[0m.
[36m[3mNote: Unless disabled at session level (see [33m[1m-no-probe[0m ), file extensions are usually ignored and format probing is done on the first data block.[0m


[32mstdin pipe[0m

The filter can handle reading from stdin, by using [33m[3m-[0m or [33m[3mstdin[0m as input file name.
[33mExample:
gpac -i - vout[0m
[33mgpac -i stdin vout[0m


[32mNamed pipes[0m

The filter can handle reading from named pipes. The associated protocol scheme is [33m[3mpipe://[0m when loaded as a generic input (eg, [33m[3m-i pipe://URL[0m where URL is a relative or absolute pipe name).
On Windows hosts, the default pipe prefix is [33m[3m\\.\pipe\gpac\[0m if no prefix is set.
[33mExample:
dst=mypipe resolves in \\.\pipe\gpac\mypipe[0m
[33mdst=\\.\pipe\myapp\mypipe resolves in \\.\pipe\myapp\mypipe[0m
Any destination name starting with [33m[3m\\[0m is used as is, with [33m[3m\[0m translated in [33m[3m/[0m.

Input pipes are created by default in non-blocking mode.

The filter can create the pipe if not found using [33m[3mmkp[0m. On windows hosts, this will create a pipe server.
On non windows hosts, the created pipe will delete the pipe file upon filter destruction.

Input pipes can be setup to run forever using [33m[3mka[0m. In this case, any potential pipe close on the writing side and end of stream will only be triggered upon session close.
This can be useful to pipe raw streams from different process into gpac:
Receiver side: [33m[3mgpac -i pipe://mypipe:ext=.264:mkp:ka[0m
Sender side: [33m[3mcat raw1.264 > mypipe && gpac -i raw2.264 -o pipe://mypipe:ext=.264[0m
The pipe input can be created in blocking mode or non-blocking mode. If the filter creates the pipe, blocking mode is always enabled.



[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32msrc[0m (cstr):                    name of source pipe
[32mext[0m (str):                     indicate file extension of pipe data
[32mmime[0m (str):                    indicate mime type of pipe data
[32mmkp[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m):    create pipe if not found - see filter help


[32mpout[0m

Description: pipe output

This filter handles generic output pipes (mono-directional) in blocking mode only.

[31m[1mWarning: Output pipes do not currently support non blocking mode.[0m

The associated protocol scheme is [33m[3mpipe://[0m when loaded as a generic output (eg, -o [33m[3mpipe://URL[0m where URL is a relative or absolute pipe name).
Data format of the pipe [1mshall[0m be specified using extension (either in filename or through [33m[3mext[0m option) or MIME type through [33m[3mmime[0m
The pipe name indicated in [33m[3mdst[0m can use template mechanisms from gpac, e.g. [33m[3mdst=pipe_$ServiceID$[0m

On Windows hosts, the default pipe prefix is [33m[3m\\.\pipe\gpac\[0m if no prefix is set 
[33mExample:
dst=mypipe resolves in \\.\pipe\gpac\mypipe[0m
[33mdst=\\.\pipe\myapp\mypipe resolves in \\.\pipe\myapp\mypipe[0m
Any destination name starting with [33m[3m\\[0m is used as is, with [33m[3m\[0m translated in [33m[3m/[0m

The pipe input can create the pipe if not found using [33m[3mmkp[0m. On windows hosts, this will create a pipe server.
On non windows hosts, the created pipe will delete the pipe file upon filter destruction.


[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mdst[0m (cstr):                    name of destination pipe
[32mext[0m (str):                     indicate file extension of pipe data
[32mmime[0m (str):                    indicate mime type of pipe data
[32mstart[0m (dbl, default: [3m0.0[0m):     set playback start offset. Negative value means percent of media duration with -1 equal to duration
[32mspeed[0m (dbl, default: [3m1.0[0m):     set playback speed. If speed is negative and start is 0, start is set to -1
[32mmkp[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m):    create pipe if not found - see filter help


[32mgsfmx[0m

Description: GSF Muxer

This filter provides GSF ([3mGPAC Serialized Format[0m) multiplexing.
It serializes the stream states (config/reconfig/info update/remove/eos) and packets of input PIDs. This allows either saving to file a session, or forwarding the state/data of streams to another instance of GPAC using either pipes or sockets. Upstream events are not serialized.

The default behavior does not insert sequence numbers. When running over general protocols not ensuring packet order, this should be inserted.
The serializer sends tune-in packets (global and per pid) at the requested carousel rate - if 0, no carousel. These packets are marked as redundant so that they can be discarded by output filters if needed.


[32mEncryption[0m

The stream format can be encrypted in AES 128 CBC mode. For all packets, the packet header (header, size, frame size/block offset and optional seq num) are in the clear and the followings byte until the last byte of the last multiple of block size (16) fitting in the payload are encrypted.
For data packets, each fragment is encrypted individually to avoid error propagation in case of losses.
For other packets, the entire packet is encrypted before fragmentation (fragments cannot be processed individually).
For header/tunein packets, the first 25 bytes after the header are in the clear (signature,version,IV and pattern).
The [33m[3mIV[0m is constant to avoid packet overhead, randomly generated if not set and sent in the initial stream header. Pattern mode can be used (cf CENC cbcs) to encrypt K block and leave N blocks in the clear.


[32mFiltering properties[0m

The header/tunein packet may get quite big when all pid properties are kept. In order to help reduce its size, the [33m[3mminp[0m option can be used: this will remove all built-in properties marked as droppable (cf property help) as well as all non built-in properties.
The [33m[3mskp[0m option may also be used to specify which property to drop:
[33mExample:
skp="4CC1,Name2[0m
This will remove properties of type 4CC1 and properties (built-in or not) of name Name2.


[32mFile mode[0m

By default the filter only accepts framed media streams as input PID, not files. This can be changed by explicitly loading the filter with [33m[3mext[0m or [33m[3mdst[0m set.
[33mExample:
gpac -i source.mp4 gsfmx:dst=manifest.mpd @ -o dump.gsf[0m
This will DASH the source and store every files produced as PIDs in the GSF mux.
In order to demux such a file, the GSF demuxer will likely need to be explicitly loaded:
[33mExample:
gpac -i mux.gsf gsfdmx @ -o dump/$File$:dynext:clone[0m
This will extract all files from the GSF mux.

When working in file mode, the filter by default only accepts PID of type [33m[3mfile[0m as input.
To allow a mix of files and streams, use [33m[3mmixed[0m:
[33mExample:
gpac -i source.mp4 gsfmx:dst=manifest.mpd:mixed @ -o dump.gsf[0m
This will DASH the source, store the manifest file and the media streams with their packet properties in the GSF mux.



[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32msigsn[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m):  signal packet sequence number after header field and before size field. Sequence number is per PID, encoded on 16 bits. Header packet does not have a SN
[32mkey[0m (mem):                     encrypt packets using given key - see filter helps
[32mIV[0m (mem):                      set IV for encryption - a constant IV is used to keep packet overhead small (cbcs-like)


[32mgsfdmx[0m

Description: GSF Demuxer

This filter provides GSF ([3mGPAC Serialized Format[0m) demultiplexing.
It unserializes the stream states (config/reconfig/info update/remove/eos) and packets of input PIDs.
This allows either reading a session saved to file, or receiving the state/data of streams from another instance of GPAC using either pipes or sockets

The stream format can be encrypted in AES 128 CBC mode, in which case the demux filters must be given a 128 bit key.


[32mOptions (basic):[0m



[32msockout[0m

Description: UDP/TCP output

This filter handles generic output sockets (mono-directional) in blocking mode only.
The filter can work in server mode, waiting for source connections, or or in client mode, directly connecting.
In server mode, the filter can be instructed to keep running at the end of the stream.
In server mode, the default behavior is to keep input packets when no more clients are connected; this can be adjusted though the [33m[3mkp[0m option, however there is no realtime regulation of how fast packets are dropped.
If your sources are not real time, consider adding a real-time scheduler in the chain (cf reframer filter), or set the send [33m[3mrate[0m option.

- UDP sockets are used for destinations URLs formatted as [33m[3mudp://NAME[0m
- TCP sockets are used for destinations URLs formatted as [33m[3mtcp://NAME[0m
- UDP unix domain sockets are used for destinations URLs formatted as [33m[3mudpu://NAME[0m
- TCP unix domain sockets are used for destinations URLs formatted as [33m[3mtcpu://NAME[0m

When ports are specified in the URL and the default option separators are used (see [33m[3mgpac -h doc[0m), the URL must either:
- have a trailing '/', eg [33m[3mudp://localhost:1234/[:opts][0m
- use [33m[3mgpac[0m '/', eg [33m[3mudp://localhost:1234[:gpac:opts][0m

The socket output can be configured to drop or revert packet order for test purposes.
For both mode, a window size in packets is specified as the drop/revert fraction denominator, and the index of the packet to drop/revert is given as the numerator/
If the numerator is 0, a packet is randomly chosen in that window.
[33mExample:
:pckd=4/10[0m
This drops every 4th packet of each 10 packet window.
[33mExample:
:pckr=0/100[0m
This reverts the send order of one random packet in each 100 packet window.




[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mdst[0m (cstr):                    URL of destination - see filter help
[32mport[0m (uint, default: [3m1234[0m):    default port if not specified
[32mext[0m (str):                     file extension of pipe data - see filter help
[32mmime[0m (str):                    mime type of pipe data - see filter help
[32mstart[0m (dbl, default: [3m0.0[0m):     set playback start offset. Negative value means percent of media duration with -1 equal to duration
[32mspeed[0m (dbl, default: [3m1.0[0m):     set playback speed. If speed is negative and start is 0, start is set to -1


[32mrfav1[0m

Description: AV1/IVF/VP9 reframer

This filter parses AV1 OBU, AV1 AnnexB or IVF with AV1 or VP9 files/data and outputs corresponding visual PID and frames.


[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mfps[0m (frac, default: [3m0/1000[0m):   import frame rate (0 default to FPS from bitstream or 25 Hz)
[32mindex[0m (dbl, default: [3m-1.0[0m):    indexing window length. If 0, bitstream is not probed for duration. A negative value skips the indexing if the source file is larger than 100M (slows down importers) unless a play with start range > 0 is issued, otherwise uses the positive value


[32mufobu[0m

Description: IVF/OBU/annexB writer

This filter is used to rewrite AV1 OBU bitstream into IVF, annex B or OBU sequence, reinserting the temporal delimiter OBU.


[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mrcfg[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m):    force repeating decoder config at each I-frame


[32mroutein[0m

Description: ROUTE input

This filter is a receiver for ROUTE sessions (ATSC 3.0 and generic ROUTE).
- ATSC 3.0 mode is identified by the URL [33m[3matsc://[0m.
- Generic ROUTE mode is identified by the URL [33m[3mroute://IP:PORT[0m.

The filter can work in cached mode, source mode or standalone mode.

[32mCached mode[0m

The cached mode is the default filter behavior. It populates GPAC HTTP Cache with the received files, using [33m[3mhttp://groute/serviceN/[0m as service root, N being the ROUTE service ID.
In cached mode, repeated files are always pushed to cache.
The maximum number of media segment objects in cache per service is defined by [33m[3mnbcached[0m; this is a safety used to force object removal in case DASH client timing is wrong and some files are never requested at cache level.
  
The cached MPD is assigned the following headers:
	* [33mx-route[0m: integer value, indicates the ROUTE service ID.
	* [33mx-route-first-seg[0m: string value, indicates the name of the first segment (completely or currently being) retrieved from the broadcast.
	* [33mx-route-ll[0m: boolean value, if yes indicates that the indicated first segment is currently being received (low latency signaling).
	* [33mx-route-loop[0m: boolean value, if yes indicates a loop in the service has been detected (usually pcap replay loop).
  
The cached files are assigned the following headers:
	* [33mx-route[0m: boolean value, if yes indicates the file comes from an ROUTE session.

If [33m[3mmax_segs[0m is set, file deletion event will be triggered in the filter chain.


[32mSource mode[0m

In source mode, the filter outputs files on a single output pid of type [33m[3mfile[0m. The files are dispatched once fully received, the output pid carries a sequence of complete files. Repeated files are not sent unless requested.
If needed, one pid per TSI can be used rather than a single pid. This avoids mixing files of different mime types on the same pid (e.g. mpd and isobmff).
[33mExample:
gpac -i atsc://gcache=false -o $ServiceID$/$File$:dynext[0m
This will grab the files and forward them as output PIDs, consumed by the [33m[3mfout[0m filter.

If [33m[3mmax_segs[0m is set, file deletion event will be triggered in the filter chain.


[32mStandalone mode[0m

In standalone mode, the filter does not produce any output pid and writes received files to the [33m[3modir[0m directory.
[33mExample:
gpac -i atsc://:odir=output[0m
This will grab the files and write them to [33m[3moutput[0m directory.

If [33m[3mmax_segs[0m is set, old files will be deleted.


[32mFile Repair[0m

In case of losses or incomplete segment reception (during tune-in), the files are patched as follows:
	* [33mMPEG-2 TS[0m: all lost ranges are adjusted to 188-bytes boundaries, and transformed into NULL TS packets.
	* [33mISOBMFF[0m: all top-level boxes are scanned, and incomplete boxes are transformed in [33m[3mfree[0m boxes, except mdat kept as is if [33m[3mrepair[0m is set to simple.

If [33m[3mkc[0m option is set, corrupted files will be kept. If [33m[3mfullseg[0m is not set and files are only partially received, they will be kept.


[32mInterface setup[0m

On some systems (OSX), when using VM packet replay, you may need to force multicast routing on your local interface.
For ATSC, you will have to do this for the base signaling multicast (224.0.23.60):
[33mExample:
route add -net 224.0.23.60/32 -interface vboxnet0[0m
Then for each ROUTE service in the multicast:
[33mExample:
route add -net 239.255.1.4/32 -interface vboxnet0[0m



[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32msrc[0m (cstr):                    URL of source content - see filter help
[32mtunein[0m (sint, default: [3m-2[0m):    service ID to bootstrap on for ATSC 3.0 mode. 0 means tune to no service, -1 tune all services -2 means tune on first service found
[32mtimeout[0m (uint, default: [3m5000[0m): timeout in ms after which tunein fails


[32mrtpout[0m

Description: RTP Streamer

The RTP streamer handles SDP/RTP output streaming.

[32mSDP mode[0m

When the destination url is an SDP, the filter outputs an SDP on a file pid and streams RTP packets over UDP, starting from the indicated [33m[3mport[0m.

[32mDirect RTP mode[0m

When the destination url uses the protocol scheme [33m[3mrtp://IP:PORT[0m, the filter does not output any SDP and streams a single input over RTP, using PORT indicated in the destination URL, or the first [33m[3mport[0m configured.
In this mode, it is usually needed to specify the desired format using [33m[3mext[0m or [33m[3mmime[0m.
[33mExample:
gpac -i src -o rtp://localhost:1234/:ext=ts[0m
This will indicate that the RTP streamer expects a MPEG-2 TS mux as an input.

[32mRTP Packets[0m

The RTP packets produced have a maximum payload set by the [33m[3mmtu[0m option (IP packet will be MTU + 40 bytes of IP+UDP+RTP headers).
The real-time scheduling algorithm works as follows:
- first initialize the clock by:
 - computing the smallest timestamp for all input pids
 - mapping this media time to the system clock
- determine the earliest packet to send next on each input pid, adding [33m[3mdelay[0m if any
- finally compare the packet mapped timestamp [3mTS[0m to the system clock [3mSC[0m. When [3mTS[0m - [3mSC[0m is less than [33m[3mtt[0m, the RTP packets for the source packet are sent



[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mip[0m (str):                      destination IP address (NULL is 127.0.0.1)
[32mport[0m (uint, default: [3m7000[0m):    port for first stream in session
[32mloop[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m):    loop all streams in session (not always possible depending on source type)
[32mmtu[0m (uint, default: [3m1460[0m):     size of RTP MTU in bytes
[32mdelay[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m):      send delay for packet (negative means send earlier)
[32mrunfor[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m):    run for the given time in ms. Negative value means run for ever (if loop) or source duration, 0 only outputs the sdp
[32mdst[0m (cstr):                    URL for direct RTP mode - see filter help


[32mrtspout[0m

Description: RTSP Server

The RTSP server partially implements RTSP 1.0, with support for OPTIONS, DESCRIBE, SETUP, PLAY, PAUSE and TEARDOWN.
Multiple PLAY ranges are not supported, PLAY range end is not supported, PAUSE range is not supported.
Only aggregated control is supported for PLAY and PAUSE, PAUSE/PLAY on single stream is not supported.
The server only runs on TCP, and handles request in sequence (will not probe for commands until previous response was sent).
The server supports both RTP over UDP delivery and RTP interleaved over RTSP delivery.

The filter can work as a simple output filter by specifying the [33m[3mdst[0m option:
[33mExample:
gpac -i source -o rtsp://myip/sessionname[0m
[33mgpac -i source dst=rtsp://myip/sessionname[0m
In this mode, only one session is possible. It is possible to [33m[3mloop[0m the input source(s).

The filter can work as a regular RTSP server by specifying the [33m[3mmounts[0m option to indicate paths of media file to be served:
[33mExample:
gpac rtspout:mounts=mydir1,mydir2[0m
In server mode, it is possible to load any source supported by gpac by setting the option [33m[3mdynurl[0m.
The expected syntax of the dynamic RTSP URLs is [33m[3mrtsp://servername/?URL1[&URLN][0m or [33m[3mrtsp://servername/@URL1[@URLN][0m 
Each URL can be absolute or local, in which case it is resolved against the mount point(s).
[33mExample:
gpac -i rtsp://localhost/?pipe://mynamepipe&myfile.mp4 [dst filters][0m
The server will resolve this URL in a new session containing streams from myfile.mp4 and streams from pipe mynamepipe.
When setting [33m[3mrunfor[0m in server mode, the server will exit at the end of the last session being closed.

In both modes, clients can setup multicast if the [33m[3mmcast[0m option is [33m[3mon[0m or [33m[3mmirror[0m.
When [33m[3mmcast[0m is set to [33m[3mmirror[0m mode, any DESCRIBE command on a resource already delivered through a multicast session will use that multicast.
Consequently, only DESCRIBE methods are processed for such sessions, other methods will return Unauthorized.

The scheduling algorithm and RTP options are the same as the RTP output filter, see [33m[3mgpac -h rtpout[0m



[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mdst[0m (cstr):                    location of destination resource - see filter help
[32mport[0m (uint, default: [3m554[0m):     server port
[32mmtu[0m (uint, default: [3m1460[0m):     size of RTP MTU in bytes
[32mmpeg4[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m):  send all streams using MPEG-4 generic payload format if posible
[32mlatm[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m):   use latm for AAC payload format
[32mmounts[0m (strl):                 list of directories to expose in server mode
[32muser_agent[0m (str, default: [3m$GUA[0m): user agent string, by default solved from GPAC preferences


[32mhttpout[0m

Description: HTTP Server

The HTTP output filter can act as:
- a simple HTTP server
- an HTTP server sink
- an HTTP server file sink
- an HTTP [3mclient[0m sink
- an HTTP server [3msource[0m
  
The server currently handles GET, HEAD, PUT, POST, DELETE methods.
Single or multiple byte ranges are supported for both GET and PUT/POST methods, in all server modes.
- for GET, the resulting body is a single-part body formed by the concatenated byte ranges as requested (no overlap checking).
- for PUT/POST, the received data is pushed to the target file according to the byte ranges specified in the client request.
  

[31m[1mWarning: the partial PUT request is RFC2616 compliant but not compliant with RFC7230. PATCH method is not yet implemented in GPAC.[0m

  
When a single read directory is specified, the server root [33m[3m/[0m is the content of this directory.
When multiple read directories are specified, the server root [33m[3m/[0m contains the list of the mount points with their directory names.
When a write directory is specified, the upload resource name identifies a file in this directory (the write directory name is not present in the URL).
  
Listing can be enabled on server using [33m[3mdlist[0m.
When disabled, a GET on a directory will fail.
When enabled, a GET on a directory will return a simple HTML listing of the content inspired from Apache.
  

[32mSimple HTTP server[0m

In this mode, the filter does not need any input connection and exposes all files in the directories given by [33m[3mrdirs[0m.
PUT and POST methods are only supported if a write directory is specified by [33m[3mwdir[0m option.
[33mExample:
gpac httpout:rdirs=outcoming[0m
This sets up a read-only server.
  
[33mExample:
gpac httpout:wdir=incoming[0m
This sets up a write-only server.
  
[33mExample:
gpac httpout:rdirs=outcoming:wdir=incoming:port=8080[0m
This sets up a read-write server running on [33m[3mport[0m 8080.
  

[32mHTTP server sink[0m

In this mode, the filter will forward input PIDs to connected clients, trashing the data if no client is connected unless [33m[3mhold[0m is specified.
The filter does not use any read directory in this mode.
This mode is mostly useful to setup live HTTP streaming of media sessions such as MP3, MPEG-2 TS or other muxed representations:
[33mExample:
gpac -i MP3_SOURCE -o http://localhost/live.mp3 --hold[0m
In this example, the server waits for client requests on [33m[3m/live.mp3[0m and will then push each input packet to all connected clients.
If the source is not real-time, you can inject a reframer filter performing realtime regulation.
[33mExample:
gpac -i MP3_SOURCE reframer:rt=on @ -o http://localhost/live.mp3[0m
In this example, the server will push each input packet to all connected clients, or trash the packet if no connected clients.
  
In this mode, ICECast meta-data can be inserted using [33m[3mice[0m. The default inserted values are [33m[3mice-audio-info[0m, [33m[3micy-br[0m, [33m[3micy-pub[0m (set to 1) and [33m[3micy-name[0m if input [33m[3mServiceName[0m property is set.
The server will also look for any property called [33m[3mice-*[0m on the input pid and inject them.
[33mExample:
gpac -i source.mp3:#ice-Genre=CoolRock -o http://IP/live.mp3 --ice[0m
This will inject the header [33m[3mice-Genre: CoolRock[0m in the response.  

[32mHTTP server file sink[0m

In this mode, the filter will write input PIDs to files in the first read directory specified, acting as a file output sink.
The filter uses a read directory in this mode, which must be writable.
Upon client GET request, the server will check if the requested URL matches the name of a file currently being written by the server.
- If so, the server will:
  - send the content using HTTP chunk transfer mode, starting with what is already written on disk
  - push remaining data to the client as soon as received while writing it to disk, until source file is done
- If not so, the server will simply send the file from the disk as a regular HTTP session, without chunk transfer.
  
This mode is typically used for origin server in HAS sessions where clients may request files while they are being produced (low latency DASH).
[33mExample:
gpac -i SOURCE reframer:rt=on @ -o http://localhost:8080/live.mpd --rdirs=temp --dmode=dynamic --cdur=0.1[0m
In this example, a real-time dynamic DASH session with chunks of 100ms is created, outputting files in [33m[3mtemp[0m. A client connecting to the live edge will receive segments as they are produced using HTTP chunk transfer.
  

[32mHTTP client sink[0m

In this mode, the filter will upload input PIDs data to remote server using PUT (or POST if [33m[3mpost[0m is set).
This mode must be explicitly activated using [33m[3mhmode[0m.
The filter uses no read or write directories in this mode.
[33mExample:
gpac -i SOURCE -o http://targethost:8080/live.mpd:gpac:hmode=push[0m
In this example, the filter will send PUT methods to the server running on [33m[3mport[0m 8080 at [33m[3mtargethost[0m location (IP address or name).
  

[32mHTTP server source[0m

In this mode, the server acts as a source rather than a sink. It declares incoming PUT or POST methods as output PIDs
This mode must be explicitly activated using [33m[3mhmode[0m.
The filter uses no read or write directories in this mode, and uploaded data is NOT stored by the server.
[33mExample:
gpac httpout:hmode=source vout aout[0m
In this example, the filter will try to play uploaded files through video and audio output.
  

[32mHTTPS server[0m

The server can run over TLS (https) for all the server modes. TLS is enabled by specifying [33m[3mcert[0m and [33m[3mpkey[0m options.
Both certificate and key must be in PEM format.
The server currently only operates in either HTTPS or HTTP mode and cannot run both modes at the same time. You will need to use two httpout filters for this, one operating in HTTPS and one operating in HTTP.



[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mdst[0m (cstr):                    location of destination resource - see filter help
[32mport[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m):       server port
[32mrdirs[0m (strl):                  list of directories to expose for read - see filter help
[32mwdir[0m (str):                    directory to expose for write - see filter help
[32mcert[0m (str):                    certificate file in PEM format to use for TLS mode
[32mpkey[0m (str):                    private key file in PEM format to use for TLS mode
[32muser_agent[0m (str, default: [3m$GUA[0m): user agent string, by default solved from GPAC preferences


[32mhevcsplit[0m

Description: HEVC tile splitter

This filter splits a motion-constrained tiled HEVC PID into N independent HEVC PIDs.
Use hevcmerge filter to merge initially motion-constrained tiled HEVC PID in a single output.


[32mOptions (basic):[0m



[32mhevcmerge[0m

Description: HEVC Tile merger

This filter merges a set of HEVC PIDs into a single motion-constrained tiled HEVC PID.
The filter creates a tiling grid with a single row and as many columns as needed.
If [33m[3mmrows[0m is set and tiles properly align on the final grid, multiple rows will be declared in the PPS.
Positioning of tiles can be automatic (implicit) or explicit.
The filter will check the SPS and PPS configurations of input PID and warn if they are not aligned but will still process them unless [33m[3mstrict[0m is set.
The filter assumes that all input PIDs are synchronized (frames share the same timestamp) and will reassemble frames with the same dts. If pids are of unequal duration, the filter will drop frames as soon as one pid is over.

[35mImplicit Positioning[0m
In implicit positioning, results may vary based on the order of input pids declaration.
In this mode the filter will automatically allocate new columns for tiles with height not a multiple of max CU height.

[35mExplicit Positioning[0m
In explicit positioning, the [33m[3mCropOrigin[0m property on input PIDs is used to setup the tile grid. In this case, tiles shall not overlap in the final output.
If [33m[3mCropOrigin[0m is used, it shall be set on all input sources.
If positive coordinates are used, they specify absolute positioning in pixels of the tiles. The coordinates are automatically adjusted to the next multiple of max CU width and height.
If negative coordinates are used, they specify relative positioning (eg [33m[3m0x-1[0m indicates to place the tile below the tile 0x0).
In this mode, it is the caller responsibility to set coordinates so that all tiles in a column have the same width and only the last row/column uses non-multiple of max CU width/height values. The filter will complain and abort if this is not respected.
- If an horizontal blank is detected in the layout, an empty column in the tiling grid will be inserted.
- If a vertical blank is detected in the layout, it is ignored.
  

[35mSpatial Relationship Description (SRD)[0m

The filter will create an [33m[3mSRDMap[0m property in the output PID if [33m[3mSRDRef[0m and [33m[3mSRD[0m or [33m[3mCropOrigin[0m are set on all input PIDs.
The [33m[3mSRDMap[0m allows forwarding the logical sources [33m[3mSRD[0m in the merged PID.
The output pid [33m[3mSRDRef[0m is set to the output video size.
The input [33m[3mSRDRef[0m and [33m[3mSRD[0m are usually specified in DASH MPD, but can be manually assigned to inputs.
- [33m[3mSRDRef[0m gives the size of the referential used for the input [33m[3mSRD[0m (usually matches the original video size, but not always)
- [33m[3mSRD[0m gives the size and position of the input in the original video, expressed in [33m[3mSRDRef[0m referential of the input.
The inputs do not need to have matching [33m[3mSRDRef[0m.EX src1:SRD=0x0x640x480:SRDRef=1280x720
This indicates that [33m[3msrc1[0m contains a video located at 0,0, with a size of 640x480 pixels in a virtual source of 1280x720 pixels.
[33mExample:
src2:SRD=640x0x640x480:SRDRef=1280x720[0m
This indicates that [33m[3msrc1[0m contains a video located at 640,0, with a size of 640x480 pixels in a virtual source of 1280x720 pixels.
 
Each merged input is described by 8 intergers in the output [33m[3mSRDMap[0m:
- the source [33m[3mSRD[0m is rescaled in the output [33m[3mSRDRef[0m to form the first part (4 integers) of the [33m[3mSRDMap[0m (i.e. [3mwhere was the input ?[0m)
- the source location in the reconstructed video forms the second part (4 integers) of the [33m[3mSRDMap[0m (i.e. [3mwhere are the input pixels in the output ?[0m)
Assuming the two sources are encoded at 320x240 and merged as src2 above src1, the output will be a 320x480 video with a [33m[3mSRDMap[0m of {0,160,160,240,0,0,320,240,0,0,160,240,0,240,320,240}
[36m[3mNote: merged inputs are always listed in [33m[1mSRDMap[36m[3m in their tile order in the output bitstream.[0m

Alternatively to using [33m[3mSRD[0m and [33m[3mSRDRef[0m, it is possible to specify [33m[3mCropOrigin[0m property on the inputs, in which case:
- the [33m[3mCropOrigin[0m gives the location in the source
- the input size gives the size in the source, and no rescaling of referential is done
[33mExample:
src1:CropOrigin=0x0  src1:CropOrigin=640x0 [0m
Assuming the two sources are encoded at 320x240 and merged as src1 above src2, the output will be a 320x480 video with a [33m[3mSRDMap[0m of {0,0,320,240,0,0,320,240,640,0,320,240,0,240,320,240}



[32mOptions (basic):[0m



[32mrfflac[0m

Description: FLAC reframer

This filter parses FLAC files/data and outputs corresponding audio PID and frames.


[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mindex[0m (dbl, default: [3m1.0[0m):     indexing window length


[32mrfmhas[0m

Description: MPEH-H Audio Stream reframer

This filter parses MHAS files/data and outputs corresponding audio PID and frames.
By default, the filter expects a MHAS stream with SYNC packets set, otherwise tune-in will fail. Using [33m[3mnosync[0m=false can help parsing bitstreams with no SYNC packets.
The default behavior is to dispatch a framed MHAS bitstream. To demultiplex into a raw MPEG-H Audio, use [33m[3mmpha[0m.



[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mindex[0m (dbl, default: [3m1.0[0m):     indexing window length
[32mmpha[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m):   demux MHAS and only forward audio frames
[32mpcksync[0m (uint, default: [3m4[0m):    number of unknwon packets to tolerate before considering sync is lost
[32mnosync[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m):  initial sync state - see filter help


[32mrfprores[0m

Description: ProRes reframer

This filter parses ProRes raw files/data and outputs corresponding visual PID and frames.


[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mfps[0m (frac, default: [3m0/1000[0m):   import frame rate (0 default to FPS from bitstream or 25 Hz)
[32mfindex[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m):  index frames. If true, filter will be able to work in rewind mode


[32mtssplit[0m

Description: MPEG Transport Stream splitter

This filter splits an MPEG-2 transport stream into several single program transport streams.
Only the PAT table is rewritten, the CAT table, PMT and all program streams are forwarded as is.
In [33m[3mfull[0m mode, global DVB tables of the input multiplex are forwarded to each output mux; otherwise these tables are discarded.


[32mOptions (basic):[0m



[32mbsrw[0m

Description: Compressed bitstream rewriter

This filter rewrites some metadata of various bitstream formats.
The filter can currently modify the following properties in video bitstreams:
- MPEG-4 Visual:
  - sample aspect ratio
  - profile and level
- AVC|H264 and HEVC:
  - sample aspect ratio
  - profile, level, profile compatibility
  - video format, video fullrange
  - color primaries, transfer characteristics and matrix coefficients (or remove all info)
- ProRes:
  - sample aspect ratio
  - color primaries, transfer characteristics and matrix coefficients
  
Values are by default initialized to -1, implying to keep the related info (present or not) in the bitstream.
A [33m[3msar[0m value of [33m[3m0/0[0m will remove sample aspect ratio info from bitstream if possible.
  
The filter can currently modify the following properties in the stream configuration but not in the bitstream:
	* [33mHEVC[0m: profile IDC, profile space, general compatibility flags
  
The filter will work in passthrough mode for all other codecs and media types.



[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mcprim[0m (cprm, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: reserved0,BT709,undef,reserved3,BT470M,BT470G,SMPTE170,SMPTE240,FILM,BT2020,SMPTE428,SMPTE431,SMPTE432,EBU3213, updatable): color primaries according to ISO/IEC 23001-8 / 23091-2
[32mctfc[0m (ctfc, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: reserved0,BT709,undef,reserved3,BT470M,BT470BG,SMPTE170,SMPTE249,Linear,Log100,Log316,IEC61966,BT1361,sRGB,BT2020_10,BT2020_12,SMPTE2084,SMPTE428,STDB67, updatable): color transfer characteristics according to ISO/IEC 23001-8 / 23091-2
[32mcmx[0m (cmxc, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: GBR,BT709,undef,FCC,BT601,SMPTE170,SMPTE240,YCgCo,BT2020,BT2020cl,YDzDx, updatable): color matrix coeficients according to ISO/IEC 23001-8 / 23091-2
[32msar[0m (frac, default: [3m-1/-1[0m, updatable): aspect ratio to rewrite - see filter help
[32mm4vpl[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, updatable): set ProfileLevel for MPEG-4 video part two
[32mfullrange[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m, updatable): video full range for AVC|H264 and HEVC
[32mnovsi[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m, updatable): remove video_signal_type from VUI in AVC|H264 and HEVC
[32mprof[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, updatable): profile indication for AVC|H264
[32mlev[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, updatable): level indication for AVC|H264
[32mpcomp[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, updatable): profile compatibility for AVC|H264
[32mpidc[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, updatable): profile IDC for HEVC
[32mpspace[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, updatable): profile space for HEVC
[32mgpcflags[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, updatable): general compatibility flags for HEVC
[32mrmsei[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m, updatable): remove SEI messages from bitstream for AVC|H264 and HEVC
[32mvidfmt[0m (enum, default: [3m-1[0m, updatable): video format for AVC|H264 and HEVC

[32mffdmx:afc[0m

[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mmin_delay[0m (sint, default: [3m2[0m, minmax: 0-6000): minimum valid delay between frames (in hundredths of second)

	 * [33mglob_sequence[0m: select glob/sequence pattern type
	 * [33mglob[0m: select glob pattern type
	 * [33msequence[0m: select sequence pattern type
	 * [33mnone[0m: disable pattern matching
[32mpixel_format[0m (str):            set video pixel format
[32mstart_number[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: -I-I): set first number in the sequence
[32mstart_number_range[0m (sint, default: [3m5[0m, minmax: 1-I): set range for looking at the first sequence number
[32mvideo_size[0m (str):              set video size
[32mframe_size[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): force frame size in bytes
[32mts_from_file[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-2): set frame timestamp from file's one
	 * [33mnone[0m: none
	 * [33msec[0m: second precision
	 * [33mns[0m: nano second precision

Description: RTSP input

Configuration: --prefix=/usr --extra-version=0ubuntu0.2 --toolchain=hardened --libdir=/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu --incdir=/usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu --enable-gpl --disable-stripping --enable-avresample --enable-avisynth --enable-gnutls --enable-ladspa --enable-libass --enable-libbluray --enable-libbs2b --enable-libcaca --enable-libcdio --enable-libflite --enable-libfontconfig --enable-libfreetype --enable-libfribidi --enable-libgme --enable-libgsm --enable-libmp3lame --enable-libmysofa --enable-libopenjpeg --enable-libopenmpt --enable-libopus --enable-libpulse --enable-librubberband --enable-librsvg --enable-libshine --enable-libsnappy --enable-libsoxr --enable-libspeex --enable-libssh --enable-libtheora --enable-libtwolame --enable-libvorbis --enable-libvpx --enable-libwavpack --enable-libwebp --enable-libx265 --enable-libxml2 --enable-libxvid --enable-libzmq --enable-libzvbi --enable-omx --enable-openal --enable-opengl --enable-sdl2 --enable-libdc1394 --enable-libdrm --enable-libiec61883 --enable-chromaprint --enable-frei0r --enable-libopencv --enable-libx264 --enable-shared

[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32minitial_pause[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): do not start playing the stream immediately
[32mrtpflags[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m):   RTP muxer flags
	 * [33mlatm[0m: Use MP4A-LATM packetization instead of MPEG4-GENERIC for AAC
	 * [33mrfc2190[0m: Use RFC 2190 packetization instead of RFC 4629 for H.263
	 * [33mskip_rtcp[0m: Don't send RTCP sender reports
	 * [33mh264_mode0[0m: Use mode 0 for H.264 in RTP
	 * [33msend_bye[0m: Send RTCP BYE packets when finishing
[32mrtsp_transport[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m): set RTSP transport protocols
	 * [33mudp[0m: UDP
	 * [33mtcp[0m: TCP
	 * [33mudp_multicast[0m: UDP multicast
	 * [33mhttp[0m: HTTP tunneling
[32mrtsp_flags[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m): set RTSP flags
	 * [33mfilter_src[0m: only receive packets from the negotiated peer IP
	 * [33mlisten[0m: wait for incoming connections
	 * [33mprefer_tcp[0m: try RTP via TCP first, if available
[32mallowed_media_types[0m (uint, default: [3m15[0m): set media types to accept from the server
	 * [33mvideo[0m: Video
	 * [33maudio[0m: Audio
	 * [33mdata[0m: Data
	 * [33msubtitle[0m: Subtitle
[32mmin_port[0m (sint, default: [3m5000[0m, minmax: 0-65535): set minimum local UDP port
[32mmax_port[0m (sint, default: [3m65000[0m, minmax: 0-65535): set maximum local UDP port
[32mtimeout[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: -I-I): set maximum timeout (in seconds) to wait for incoming connections (-1 is infinite, imply flag listen)
[32mstimeout[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: -I-I): set timeout (in microseconds) of socket TCP I/O operations
[32mreorder_queue_size[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: -1-I): set number of packets to buffer for handling of reordered packets
[32mbuffer_size[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: -1-I): Underlying protocol send/receive buffer size
[32muser-agent[0m (str, default: [3mLavf57.83.100[0m): override User-Agent header

[32mframerate[0m (frac, default: [3m638776752/32607[0m): set the video framerate

[32mpattern_type[0m (sint, default: [3m4[0m, minmax: 0-I): set pattern type
	 * [33mglob_sequence[0m: select glob/sequence pattern type
	 * [33mglob[0m: select glob pattern type
	 * [33msequence[0m: select sequence pattern type
	 * [33mnone[0m: disable pattern matching
[32mpixel_format[0m (str):            set video pixel format
[32mstart_number[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: -I-I): set first number in the sequence
[32mstart_number_range[0m (sint, default: [3m5[0m, minmax: 1-I): set range for looking at the first sequence number
[32mvideo_size[0m (str):              set video size
[32mframe_size[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): force frame size in bytes
[32mts_from_file[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-2): set frame timestamp from file's one

	 * [33msec[0m: second precision
	 * [33mns[0m: nano second precision

	 * [33mnone[0m: disable pattern matching
[32mpixel_format[0m (str):            set video pixel format
[32mstart_number[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: -I-I): set first number in the sequence
[32mstart_number_range[0m (sint, default: [3m5[0m, minmax: 1-I): set range for looking at the first sequence number
[32mvideo_size[0m (str):              set video size
[32mframe_size[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): force frame size in bytes
[32mts_from_file[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-2): set frame timestamp from file's one
	 * [33mnone[0m: none
	 * [33msec[0m: second precision
	 * [33mns[0m: nano second precision

[32mffdmx[0m

Description: FFMPEG demuxer
Version: Lavf57.83.100
Configuration: --prefix=/usr --extra-version=0ubuntu0.2 --toolchain=hardened --libdir=/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu --incdir=/usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu --enable-gpl --disable-stripping --enable-avresample --enable-avisynth --enable-gnutls --enable-ladspa --enable-libass --enable-libbluray --enable-libbs2b --enable-libcaca --enable-libcdio --enable-libflite --enable-libfontconfig --enable-libfreetype --enable-libfribidi --enable-libgme --enable-libgsm --enable-libmp3lame --enable-libmysofa --enable-libopenjpeg --enable-libopenmpt --enable-libopus --enable-libpulse --enable-librubberband --enable-librsvg --enable-libshine --enable-libsnappy --enable-libsoxr --enable-libspeex --enable-libssh --enable-libtheora --enable-libtwolame --enable-libvorbis --enable-libvpx --enable-libwavpack --enable-libwebp --enable-libx265 --enable-libxml2 --enable-libxvid --enable-libzmq --enable-libzvbi --enable-omx --enable-openal --enable-opengl --enable-sdl2 --enable-libdc1394 --enable-libdrm --enable-libiec61883 --enable-chromaprint --enable-frei0r --enable-libopencv --enable-libx264 --enable-shared

Demultiplexes files and open protocol using FFMPEG.
See FFMPEG documentation (https://ffmpeg.org/documentation.html) for more details.
To list all supported demuxers for your GPAC build, use [33m[3mgpac -h ffdmx:*[0m.
This will list both supported input formats and protocols.
Input protocols are listed with [33m[3mDescription: Input protocol[0m, and the subclass name identitfes the protocol scheme.
For example, if [33m[3mffdmx:rtmp[0m is listed as input protocol, this means [33m[3mrtmp://[0m source URLs are supported.



[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32msrc[0m (cstr):                    URL of source content
[32mavioflags[0m (uint):               
	* [33mdirect[0m: reduce buffering
[32mprobesize[0m (lsint, default: [3m5000000[0m, minmax: 32-I): set probing size
[32mformatprobesize[0m (sint, default: [3m1048576[0m, minmax: 0-2147483646): number of bytes to probe file format
[32mfflags[0m (uint):                  
	* [33mignidx[0m: ignore index
	* [33mgenpts[0m: generate pts
	* [33mnofillin[0m: do not fill in missing values that can be exactly calculated
	* [33mnoparse[0m: disable AVParsers, this needs nofillin too
	* [33migndts[0m: ignore dts
	* [33mdiscardcorrupt[0m: discard corrupted frames
	* [33msortdts[0m: try to interleave outputted packets by dts
	* [33mkeepside[0m: don't merge side data
	* [33mfastseek[0m: fast but inaccurate seeks
	* [33mnobuffer[0m: reduce the latency introduced by optional buffering
[32mseek2any[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): allow seeking to non-keyframes on demuxer level when supported
[32manalyzeduration[0m (lsint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): specify how many microseconds are analyzed to probe the input
[32mcryptokey[0m (uint):              decryption key
[32mindexmem[0m (sint, default: [3m1048576[0m, minmax: 0-I): max memory used for timestamp index (per stream)
[32mrtbufsize[0m (sint, default: [3m3041280[0m, minmax: 0-I): max memory used for buffering real-time frames
[32mfdebug[0m (uint):                 print specific debug info
	* [33mts[0m: 
[32mmax_delay[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: -1-I): maximum muxing or demuxing delay in microseconds
[32mfpsprobesize[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: -1-2147483646): number of frames used to probe fps
[32mf_err_detect[0m (uint):           set error detection flags (deprecated; use err_detect, save via avconv)
	* [33merr_detect[0m: set error detection flags
	* [33mcrccheck[0m: verify embedded CRCs
	* [33mbitstream[0m: detect bitstream specification deviations
	* [33mbuffer[0m: detect improper bitstream length
	* [33mexplode[0m: abort decoding on minor error detection
	* [33mignore_err[0m: ignore errors
	* [33mcareful[0m: consider things that violate the spec, are fast to check and have not been seen in the wild as errors
	* [33mcompliant[0m: consider all spec non compliancies as errors
	* [33maggressive[0m: consider things that a sane encoder shouldn't do as an error
[32muse_wallclock_as_timestamps[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): use wallclock as timestamps
[32mskip_initial_bytes[0m (lsint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): set number of bytes to skip before reading header and frames
[32mcorrect_ts_overflow[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m): correct single timestamp overflows
[32mf_strict[0m (sint):               how strictly to follow the standards (deprecated; use strict, save via avconv)
	* [33mstrict[0m: how strictly to follow the standards
	* [33mvery[0m: strictly conform to a older more strict version of the spec or reference software
	* [33mstrict[0m: strictly conform to all the things in the spec no matter what the consequences
	* [33mnormal[0m: 
	* [33munofficial[0m: allow unofficial extensions
	* [33mexperimental[0m: allow non-standardized experimental variants
[32mmax_ts_probe[0m (sint, default: [3m50[0m, minmax: 0-I): maximum number of packets to read while waiting for the first timestamp
[32mdump_separator[0m (str, default: [3m, [0m): set information dump field separator
[32mcodec_whitelist[0m (str):         List of decoders that are allowed to be used
[32mformat_whitelist[0m (str):        List of demuxers that are allowed to be used
[32mprotocol_whitelist[0m (str):      List of protocols that are allowed to be used
[32mprotocol_blacklist[0m (str):      List of protocols that are not allowed to be used
[32mmax_streams[0m (sint, default: [3m1000[0m, minmax: 0-I): maximum number of streams
[32m*[0m (str):                       any possible options defined for AVFormatContext and sub-classes. See [33m[3mgpac -hx ffdmx[0m and [33m[3mgpac -hx ffdmx:*[0m

[32mlayer[0m (str, default: [3m[0m):        Set the decoding layer
[32mgamma[0m (flt, default: [3m1[0m):       Set the float gamma value when decoding
[32mapply_trc[0m (sint, default: [3m2[0m, minmax: 1-18): color transfer characteristics to apply to EXR linear input
	 * [33mbt709[0m: BT.709
	 * [33mgamma[0m: gamma
	 * [33mgamma22[0m: BT.470 M
	 * [33mgamma28[0m: BT.470 BG
	 * [33msmpte170m[0m: SMPTE 170 M
	 * [33msmpte240m[0m: SMPTE 240 M
	 * [33mlinear[0m: Linear
	 * [33mlog[0m: Log
	 * [33mlog_sqrt[0m: Log square root
	 * [33miec61966_2_4[0m: IEC 61966-2-4
	 * [33mbt1361[0m: BT.1361
	 * [33miec61966_2_1[0m: IEC 61966-2-1
	 * [33mbt2020_10bit[0m: BT.2020 - 10 bit
	 * [33mbt2020_12bit[0m: BT.2020 - 12 bit
	 * [33msmpte2084[0m: SMPTE ST 2084
	 * [33msmpte428_1[0m: SMPTE ST 428-1

[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mnon_pcm_mode[0m (sint, default: [3m3[0m, minmax: 0-3): Chooses what to do with NON-PCM
	 * [33mcopy[0m: Pass NON-PCM through unchanged
	 * [33mdrop[0m: Drop NON-PCM
	 * [33mdecode_copy[0m: Decode if possible else passthrough
	 * [33mdecode_drop[0m: Decode if possible else drop

[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mtxt_page[0m (str, default: [3m*[0m):    list of teletext page numbers to decode, * is all
[32mtxt_chop_top[0m (sint, default: [3m1[0m, minmax: 0-1): discards the top teletext line
[32mtxt_format[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-1): format of the subtitles (bitmap or text)
 - bitmap
 - text
[32mtxt_left[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-65535): x offset of generated bitmaps
[32mtxt_top[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-65535): y offset of generated bitmaps
[32mtxt_chop_spaces[0m (sint, default: [3m1[0m, minmax: 0-1): chops leading and trailing spaces from text
[32mtxt_duration[0m (sint, default: [3m30000[0m, minmax: 0-86400000): display duration of teletext pages in msecs
[32mtxt_transparent[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-1): force transparent background of the teletext
[32mtxt_opacity[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: -1-255): set opacity of the transparent background

[32mffdec[0m

Description: FFMPEG decoder
Version: Lavc57.107.100
Configuration: --prefix=/usr --extra-version=0ubuntu0.2 --toolchain=hardened --libdir=/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu --incdir=/usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu --enable-gpl --disable-stripping --enable-avresample --enable-avisynth --enable-gnutls --enable-ladspa --enable-libass --enable-libbluray --enable-libbs2b --enable-libcaca --enable-libcdio --enable-libflite --enable-libfontconfig --enable-libfreetype --enable-libfribidi --enable-libgme --enable-libgsm --enable-libmp3lame --enable-libmysofa --enable-libopenjpeg --enable-libopenmpt --enable-libopus --enable-libpulse --enable-librubberband --enable-librsvg --enable-libshine --enable-libsnappy --enable-libsoxr --enable-libspeex --enable-libssh --enable-libtheora --enable-libtwolame --enable-libvorbis --enable-libvpx --enable-libwavpack --enable-libwebp --enable-libx265 --enable-libxml2 --enable-libxvid --enable-libzmq --enable-libzvbi --enable-omx --enable-openal --enable-opengl --enable-sdl2 --enable-libdc1394 --enable-libdrm --enable-libiec61883 --enable-chromaprint --enable-frei0r --enable-libopencv --enable-libx264 --enable-shared

Decodes audio and video streams.
See FFMPEG documentation (https://ffmpeg.org/documentation.html) for more details.
To list all supported decoders for your GPAC build, use [33m[3mgpac -h ffdec:*[0m.

Options can be passed from prompt using [33m[3m-+OPT=VAL[0m
The default threading mode is to let libavcodec decide how many threads to use. To enforce single thread, use [33m[3m-+threads=1[0m



[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mflags[0m (uint):                   
	* [33munaligned[0m: allow decoders to produce unaligned output
	* [33mgray[0m: only decode/encode grayscale
	* [33mtruncated[0m: Input bitstream might be randomly truncated
	* [33mlow_delay[0m: force low delay
	* [33mbitexact[0m: use only bitexact functions (except (I)DCT)
	* [33moutput_corrupt[0m: Output even potentially corrupted frames
[32mignorecrop[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): ignore cropping information from sps
[32mchunks[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): Frame data might be split into multiple chunks
[32mshowall[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): Show all frames before the first keyframe
[32mexport_mvs[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): export motion vectors through frame side data
[32mskip_manual[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): do not skip samples and export skip information as frame side data
[32mass_ro_flush_noop[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): do not reset ASS ReadOrder field on flush
[32mar[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): set audio sampling rate (in Hz)
[32mac[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): set number of audio channels
[32mbug[0m (uint):                    work around not autodetected encoder bugs
	* [33mautodetect[0m: 
	* [33mold_msmpeg4[0m: some old lavc-generated MSMPEG4v3 files (no autodetection)
	* [33mxvid_ilace[0m: Xvid interlacing bug (autodetected if FOURCC == XVIX)
	* [33mump4[0m: (autodetected if FOURCC == UMP4)
	* [33mno_padding[0m: padding bug (autodetected)
	* [33mamv[0m: 
	* [33mac_vlc[0m: illegal VLC bug (autodetected per FOURCC)
	* [33mqpel_chroma[0m: 
	* [33mstd_qpel[0m: old standard qpel (autodetected per FOURCC/version)
	* [33mqpel_chroma2[0m: 
	* [33mdirect_blocksize[0m: direct-qpel-blocksize bug (autodetected per FOURCC/version)
	* [33medge[0m: edge padding bug (autodetected per FOURCC/version)
	* [33mhpel_chroma[0m: 
	* [33mdc_clip[0m: 
	* [33mms[0m: work around various bugs in Microsoft's broken decoders
	* [33mtrunc[0m: truncated frames
	* [33miedge[0m: 
[32mstrict[0m (sint):                 how strictly to follow the standards
	* [33mvery[0m: strictly conform to a older more strict version of the spec or reference software
	* [33mstrict[0m: strictly conform to all the things in the spec no matter what the consequences
	* [33mnormal[0m: 
	* [33munofficial[0m: allow unofficial extensions
	* [33mexperimental[0m: allow non-standardized experimental things
[32merr_detect[0m (uint):             set error detection flags
	* [33mcrccheck[0m: verify embedded CRCs
	* [33mbitstream[0m: detect bitstream specification deviations
	* [33mbuffer[0m: detect improper bitstream length
	* [33mexplode[0m: abort decoding on minor error detection
	* [33mignore_err[0m: ignore errors
	* [33mcareful[0m: consider things that violate the spec, are fast to check and have not been seen in the wild as errors
	* [33mcompliant[0m: consider all spec non compliancies as errors
	* [33maggressive[0m: consider things that a sane encoder should not do as an error
[32midct[0m (sint):                   select IDCT implementation
	* [33mauto[0m: 
	* [33mint[0m: 
	* [33msimple[0m: 
	* [33msimplemmx[0m: 
	* [33marm[0m: 
	* [33maltivec[0m: 
	* [33msh4[0m: 
	* [33msimplearm[0m: 
	* [33msimplearmv5te[0m: 
	* [33msimplearmv6[0m: 
	* [33msimpleneon[0m: 
	* [33msimplealpha[0m: 
	* [33mipp[0m: 
	* [33mxvid[0m: 
	* [33mxvidmmx[0m: deprecated, for compatibility only
	* [33mfaani[0m: floating point AAN IDCT
	* [33msimpleauto[0m: 
[32mec[0m (uint):                     set error concealment strategy
	* [33mguess_mvs[0m: iterative motion vector (MV) search (slow)
	* [33mdeblock[0m: use strong deblock filter for damaged MBs
	* [33mfavor_inter[0m: favor predicting from the previous frame
[32mdebug[0m (uint):                  print specific debug info
	* [33mpict[0m: picture info
	* [33mbitstream[0m: 
	* [33mmb_type[0m: macroblock (MB) type
	* [33mqp[0m: per-block quantization parameter (QP)
	* [33mmv[0m: motion vector
	* [33mdct_coeff[0m: 
	* [33mgreen_metadata[0m: 
	* [33mskip[0m: 
	* [33mstartcode[0m: 
	* [33mpts[0m: 
	* [33mer[0m: error recognition
	* [33mmmco[0m: memory management control operations (H.264)
	* [33mbugs[0m: 
	* [33mvis_qp[0m: visualize quantization parameter (QP), lower QP are tinted greener
	* [33mvis_mb_type[0m: visualize block types
	* [33mbuffers[0m: picture buffer allocations
	* [33mthread_ops[0m: threading operations
	* [33mnomc[0m: skip motion compensation
[32mvismv[0m (uint):                  visualize motion vectors (MVs) (deprecated)
	* [33mpf[0m: forward predicted MVs of P-frames
	* [33mbf[0m: forward predicted MVs of B-frames
	* [33mbb[0m: backward predicted MVs of B-frames
[32mflags2[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m):     (null)
[32mthreads[0m (sint):                set the number of threads
	* [33mauto[0m: autodetect a suitable number of threads to use
[32mskip_top[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: -I-I): number of macroblock rows at the top which are skipped
[32mskip_bottom[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: -I-I): number of macroblock rows at the bottom which are skipped
[32mlowres[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): decode at 1= 1/2, 2=1/4, 3=1/8 resolutions
[32mskip_loop_filter[0m (sint):       skip loop filtering process for the selected frames
	* [33mskip_idct[0m: skip IDCT/dequantization for the selected frames
	* [33mskip_frame[0m: skip decoding for the selected frames
	* [33mnone[0m: discard no frame
	* [33mdefault[0m: discard useless frames
	* [33mnoref[0m: discard all non-reference frames
	* [33mbidir[0m: discard all bidirectional frames
	* [33mnokey[0m: discard all frames except keyframes
	* [33mnointra[0m: discard all frames except I frames
	* [33mall[0m: discard all frames

[32mstream_name[0m (str, default: [3mrecord[0m): set stream description
[32msample_rate[0m (sint, default: [3m48000[0m, minmax: 1-I): set sample rate in Hz
[32mchannels[0m (sint, default: [3m2[0m, minmax: 1-I): set number of audio channels
[32mframe_size[0m (sint, default: [3m1024[0m, minmax: 1-I): set number of bytes per frame
[32mfragment_size[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: -1-I): set buffering size, affects latency and cpu usage
[32mwallclock[0m (sint, default: [3m1[0m, minmax: -1-1): set the initial pts using the current time

[32mffavin:x11grab[0m
