Description: FFMPEG encoder
Version: Lavc57.107.100
Configuration: --prefix=/usr --extra-version=0ubuntu0.2 --toolchain=hardened --libdir=/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu --incdir=/usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu --enable-gpl --disable-stripping --enable-avresample --enable-avisynth --enable-gnutls --enable-ladspa --enable-libass --enable-libbluray --enable-libbs2b --enable-libcaca --enable-libcdio --enable-libflite --enable-libfontconfig --enable-libfreetype --enable-libfribidi --enable-libgme --enable-libgsm --enable-libmp3lame --enable-libmysofa --enable-libopenjpeg --enable-libopenmpt --enable-libopus --enable-libpulse --enable-librubberband --enable-librsvg --enable-libshine --enable-libsnappy --enable-libsoxr --enable-libspeex --enable-libssh --enable-libtheora --enable-libtwolame --enable-libvorbis --enable-libvpx --enable-libwavpack --enable-libwebp --enable-libx265 --enable-libxml2 --enable-libxvid --enable-libzmq --enable-libzvbi --enable-omx --enable-openal --enable-opengl --enable-sdl2 --enable-libdc1394 --enable-libdrm --enable-libiec61883 --enable-chromaprint --enable-frei0r --enable-libopencv --enable-libx264 --enable-shared

Encodes audio and video streams.
See FFMPEG documentation (https://ffmpeg.org/documentation.html) for more details.
To list all supported encoders for your GPAC build, use [33m[3mgpac -h ffenc:*[0m.

The filter will try to resolve the codec name in [33m[3mc[0m against a libavcodec codec name (eg [33m[3mlibx264[0m) and use it if found.
If not found, it will consider the name to be a GPAC codec name and find a codec for it. In that case, if no pixel format is given, codecs will be enumerated to find a matching pixel format.

Options can be passed from prompt using [33m[3m-+OPT=VAL[0m (global options) or appending [33m[3m::OPT=VAL[0m to the desired encoder filter.

The filter will look for property [33m[3mTargetRate[0m on input PID to set the desired bitrate per PID.

The filter will force a closed gop boundary:
- at each packet with a [33m[3mFileNumber[0m property set or a [33m[3mCueStart[0m property set to true.
- if [33m[3mfintra[0m and [33m[3mrc[0m is set.
When forcing a closed GOP boundary, the filter will flush, destroy and recreate the encoder to make sure a clean context is used, as currently many encoders in libavcodec do not support clean reset when forcing picture types.
If [33m[3mfintra[0m is not set and the output of the encoder is a DASH session in live profile without segment timeline, [33m[3mfintra[0m will be set to the target segment duration and [33m[3mrc[0m will be set.



[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mc[0m (str):                       codec identifier. Can be any supported GPAC codec name or ffmpeg codec name
[32mpfmt[0m (pfmt, default: [3mnone[0m):    pixel format for input video. When not set, input format is used
[32mfintra[0m (frac, default: [3m-1/1[0m):  force intra / IDR frames at the given period in sec, eg [33m[3mfintra=60000/1001[0m will force an intra every 2 seconds on 29.97 fps video; ignored for audio
[32mb[0m (lsint, default: [3m200000[0m, minmax: 0-I): set bitrate (in bits/s)
[32mab[0m (lsint, default: [3m128000[0m, minmax: 0-I): set bitrate (in bits/s)
[32mbt[0m (sint, default: [3m4000000[0m, minmax: 1-I): Set video bitrate tolerance (in bits/s). In 1-pass mode, bitrate tolerance specifies how far ratecontrol is willing to deviate from the target average bitrate value. This is not related to minimum/maximum bitrate. Lowering tolerance too much has an adverse effect on quality.
[32mflags[0m (uint):                   
	* [33mmv4[0m: use four motion vectors per macroblock (MPEG-4)
	* [33mqpel[0m: use 1/4-pel motion compensation
	* [33mloop[0m: use loop filter
	* [33mgmc[0m: use gmc
	* [33mmv0[0m: always try a mb with mv=<0,0>
	* [33mgray[0m: only decode/encode grayscale
	* [33mpsnr[0m: error[?] variables will be set during encoding
	* [33mnaq[0m: normalize adaptive quantization
	* [33mildct[0m: use interlaced DCT
	* [33mlow_delay[0m: force low delay
	* [33mglobal_header[0m: place global headers in extradata instead of every keyframe
	* [33mbitexact[0m: use only bitexact functions (except (I)DCT)
	* [33maic[0m: H.263 advanced intra coding / MPEG-4 AC prediction
	* [33milme[0m: interlaced motion estimation
	* [33mcgop[0m: closed GOP
[32mfast[0m (bool):                   allow non-spec-compliant speedup tricks
	* [33mnoout[0m: skip bitstream encoding
	* [33mlocal_header[0m: place global headers at every keyframe instead of in extradata
	* [33mflags2[0m: 
[32mme_method[0m (sint):              set motion estimation method
	* [33mzero[0m: zero motion estimation (fastest)
	* [33mfull[0m: full motion estimation (slowest)
	* [33mepzs[0m: EPZS motion estimation
	* [33mesa[0m: esa motion estimation (alias for full)
	* [33mtesa[0m: tesa motion estimation
	* [33mdia[0m: diamond motion estimation (alias for EPZS)
	* [33mlog[0m: log motion estimation
	* [33mphods[0m: phods motion estimation
	* [33mx1[0m: X1 motion estimation
	* [33mhex[0m: hex motion estimation
	* [33mumh[0m: umh motion estimation
	* [33miter[0m: iter motion estimation
[32mg[0m (sint, default: [3m12[0m, minmax: -I-I): set the group of picture (GOP) size
[32mar[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): set audio sampling rate (in Hz)
[32mac[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): set number of audio channels
[32mcutoff[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: -I-I): set cutoff bandwidth
[32mframe_size[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): (null)
[32mqcomp[0m (flt, default: [3m0.5[0m):     video quantizer scale compression (VBR). Constant of ratecontrol equation. Recommended range for default rc_eq: 0.0-1.0
[32mqblur[0m (flt, default: [3m0.5[0m):     video quantizer scale blur (VBR)
[32mqmin[0m (sint, default: [3m2[0m, minmax: -1-69): minimum video quantizer scale (VBR)
[32mqmax[0m (sint, default: [3m31[0m, minmax: -1-1024): maximum video quantizer scale (VBR)
[32mqdiff[0m (sint, default: [3m3[0m, minmax: -I-I): maximum difference between the quantizer scales (VBR)
[32mbf[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: -1-I): set maximum number of B-frames between non-B-frames
[32mb_qfactor[0m (flt, default: [3m1.25[0m): QP factor between P- and B-frames
[32mrc_strategy[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: -I-I): ratecontrol method
[32mb_strategy[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: -I-I): strategy to choose between I/P/B-frames
[32mps[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: -I-I): RTP payload size in bytes
[32mstrict[0m (sint):                 how strictly to follow the standards
	* [33mvery[0m: strictly conform to a older more strict version of the spec or reference software
	* [33mstrict[0m: strictly conform to all the things in the spec no matter what the consequences
	* [33mnormal[0m: 
	* [33munofficial[0m: allow unofficial extensions
	* [33mexperimental[0m: allow non-standardized experimental things
[32mb_qoffset[0m (flt, default: [3m1.25[0m): QP offset between P- and B-frames
[32mmpeg_quant[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: -I-I): use MPEG quantizers instead of H.263
[32mqsquish[0m (flt, default: [3m0[0m):     deprecated, use encoder private options instead
[32mrc_qmod_amp[0m (flt, default: [3m0[0m): deprecated, use encoder private options instead
[32mrc_qmod_freq[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: -I-I): deprecated, use encoder private options instead
[32mrc_eq[0m (str):                   deprecated, use encoder private options instead
[32mmaxrate[0m (lsint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): maximum bitrate (in bits/s). Used for VBV together with bufsize.
[32mminrate[0m (lsint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: -I-I): minimum bitrate (in bits/s). Most useful in setting up a CBR encode. It is of little use otherwise.
[32mbufsize[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: -I-I): set ratecontrol buffer size (in bits)
[32mrc_buf_aggressivity[0m (flt, default: [3m1[0m): deprecated, use encoder private options instead
[32mi_qfactor[0m (flt, default: [3m-0.8[0m): QP factor between P- and I-frames
[32mi_qoffset[0m (flt, default: [3m0[0m):   QP offset between P- and I-frames
[32mrc_init_cplx[0m (flt, default: [3m0[0m): deprecated, use encoder private options instead
[32mdct[0m (sint):                    DCT algorithm
	* [33mauto[0m: autoselect a good one
	* [33mfastint[0m: fast integer
	* [33mint[0m: accurate integer
	* [33mmmx[0m: 
	* [33maltivec[0m: 
	* [33mfaan[0m: floating point AAN DCT
[32mlumi_mask[0m (flt, default: [3m0[0m):   compresses bright areas stronger than medium ones
[32mtcplx_mask[0m (flt, default: [3m0[0m):  temporal complexity masking
[32mscplx_mask[0m (flt, default: [3m0[0m):  spatial complexity masking
[32mp_mask[0m (flt, default: [3m0[0m):      inter masking
[32mdark_mask[0m (flt, default: [3m0[0m):   compresses dark areas stronger than medium ones
[32midct[0m (sint):                   select IDCT implementation
	* [33mauto[0m: 
	* [33mint[0m: 
	* [33msimple[0m: 
	* [33msimplemmx[0m: 
	* [33marm[0m: 
	* [33maltivec[0m: 
	* [33msh4[0m: 
	* [33msimplearm[0m: 
	* [33msimplearmv5te[0m: 
	* [33msimplearmv6[0m: 
	* [33msimpleneon[0m: 
	* [33msimplealpha[0m: 
	* [33mipp[0m: 
	* [33mxvid[0m: 
	* [33mxvidmmx[0m: deprecated, for compatibility only
	* [33mfaani[0m: floating point AAN IDCT
	* [33msimpleauto[0m: 
[32mpred[0m (sint):                   prediction method
	* [33mleft[0m: 
	* [33mplane[0m: 
	* [33mmedian[0m: 
[32maspect[0m (frac, default: [3m0/0[0m):   sample aspect ratio
[32msar[0m (frac, default: [3m0/0[0m):      sample aspect ratio
[32mdebug[0m (uint):                  print specific debug info
	* [33mrc[0m: rate control
[32mcmp[0m (sint):                    full-pel ME compare function
	* [33msubcmp[0m: sub-pel ME compare function
	* [33mmbcmp[0m: macroblock compare function
	* [33mildctcmp[0m: interlaced DCT compare function
	* [33mprecmp[0m: pre motion estimation compare function
	* [33msad[0m: sum of absolute differences, fast
	* [33msse[0m: sum of squared errors
	* [33msatd[0m: sum of absolute Hadamard transformed differences
	* [33mdct[0m: sum of absolute DCT transformed differences
	* [33mpsnr[0m: sum of squared quantization errors (avoid, low quality)
	* [33mbit[0m: number of bits needed for the block
	* [33mrd[0m: rate distortion optimal, slow
	* [33mzero[0m: 0
	* [33mvsad[0m: sum of absolute vertical differences
	* [33mvsse[0m: sum of squared vertical differences
	* [33mnsse[0m: noise preserving sum of squared differences
	* [33mw53[0m: 5/3 wavelet, only used in snow
	* [33mw97[0m: 9/7 wavelet, only used in snow
	* [33mdctmax[0m: 
	* [33mchroma[0m: 
	* [33mmsad[0m: sum of absolute differences, median predicted
	* [33mskipcmp[0m: frame skip compare function
[32mdia_size[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: -I-I): diamond type & size for motion estimation
[32mlast_pred[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: -I-I): amount of motion predictors from the previous frame
[32mpreme[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: -I-I): pre motion estimation
[32mpre_dia_size[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: -I-I): diamond type & size for motion estimation pre-pass
[32msubq[0m (sint, default: [3m8[0m, minmax: -I-I): sub-pel motion estimation quality
[32mme_range[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: -I-I): limit motion vectors range (1023 for DivX player)
[32mibias[0m (sint, default: [3m999999[0m, minmax: -I-I): intra quant bias
[32mpbias[0m (sint, default: [3m999999[0m, minmax: -I-I): inter quant bias
[32mglobal_quality[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: -I-I): (null)
[32mcoder[0m (sint):                   
	* [33mvlc[0m: variable length coder / Huffman coder
	* [33mac[0m: arithmetic coder
	* [33mraw[0m: raw (no encoding)
	* [33mrle[0m: run-length coder
	* [33mdeflate[0m: deflate-based coder
[32mcontext[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: -I-I): context model
[32mmbd[0m (sint):                    macroblock decision algorithm (high quality mode)
	* [33msimple[0m: use mbcmp
	* [33mbits[0m: use fewest bits
	* [33mrd[0m: use best rate distortion
[32msc_threshold[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: -I-I): scene change threshold
[32mlmin[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): deprecated, use encoder private options instead
[32mlmax[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): deprecated, use encoder private options instead
[32mnr[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: -I-I): noise reduction
[32mrc_init_occupancy[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: -I-I): number of bits which should be loaded into the rc buffer before decoding starts
[32merror[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: -I-I): (null)
[32mthreads[0m (sint):                set the number of threads
	* [33mauto[0m: autodetect a suitable number of threads to use
[32mme_threshold[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: -I-I): motion estimation threshold
[32mmb_threshold[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: -I-I): macroblock threshold
[32mdc[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: -8-16): intra_dc_precision
[32mnssew[0m (sint, default: [3m8[0m, minmax: -I-I): nsse weight
[32mprofile[0m (sint):                 
	* [33munknown[0m: 
	* [33maac_main[0m: 
	* [33maac_low[0m: 
	* [33maac_ssr[0m: 
	* [33maac_ltp[0m: 
	* [33maac_he[0m: 
	* [33maac_he_v2[0m: 
	* [33maac_ld[0m: 
	* [33maac_eld[0m: 
	* [33mmpeg2_aac_low[0m: 
	* [33mmpeg2_aac_he[0m: 
	* [33mdts[0m: 
	* [33mdts_es[0m: 
	* [33mdts_96_24[0m: 
	* [33mdts_hd_hra[0m: 
	* [33mdts_hd_ma[0m: 
	* [33mmpeg4_sp[0m: 
	* [33mmpeg4_core[0m: 
	* [33mmpeg4_main[0m: 
	* [33mmpeg4_asp[0m: 
	* [33mmain10[0m: 
[32mlevel[0m (sint):                   
	* [33munknown[0m: 
[32mskip_threshold[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: -I-I): frame skip threshold
[32mskip_factor[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: -I-I): frame skip factor
[32mskip_exp[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: -I-I): frame skip exponent
[32mborder_mask[0m (flt, default: [3m0[0m): deprecated, use encoder private options instead
[32mmblmin[0m (sint, default: [3m236[0m, minmax: 1-32767): minimum macroblock Lagrange factor (VBR)
[32mmblmax[0m (sint, default: [3m3658[0m, minmax: 1-32767): maximum macroblock Lagrange factor (VBR)
[32mmepc[0m (sint, default: [3m256[0m, minmax: -I-I): motion estimation bitrate penalty compensation (1.0 = 256)
[32mbidir_refine[0m (sint, default: [3m1[0m, minmax: 0-4): refine the two motion vectors used in bidirectional macroblocks
[32mbrd_scale[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-10): downscale frames for dynamic B-frame decision
[32mkeyint_min[0m (sint, default: [3m25[0m, minmax: -I-I): minimum interval between IDR-frames
[32mrefs[0m (sint, default: [3m1[0m, minmax: -I-I): reference frames to consider for motion compensation
[32mchromaoffset[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: -I-I): chroma QP offset from luma
[32mtrellis[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: -I-I): rate-distortion optimal quantization
[32msc_factor[0m (sint, default: [3m6[0m, minmax: 0-I): multiplied by qscale for each frame and added to scene_change_score
[32mmv0_threshold[0m (sint, default: [3m256[0m, minmax: 0-I): (null)
[32mb_sensitivity[0m (sint, default: [3m40[0m, minmax: 1-I): adjust sensitivity of b_frame_strategy 1
[32mcompression_level[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: -I-I): (null)

[32mmax_prediction_order[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: -I-I): (null)
[32mtimecode_frame_start[0m (lsint, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: -1-I): GOP timecode frame start number, in non-drop-frame format

[32maudio_service_type[0m (sint):     audio service type
	* [33mma[0m: Main Audio Service
	* [33mef[0m: Effects
	* [33mvi[0m: Visually Impaired
	* [33mhi[0m: Hearing Impaired
	* [33mdi[0m: Dialogue
	* [33mco[0m: Commentary
	* [33mem[0m: Emergency
	* [33mvo[0m: Voice Over
	* [33mka[0m: Karaoke
[32mside_data_only_packets[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m): (null)
[32mfield_order[0m (sint):            Field order
	* [33mprogressive[0m: 
	* [33mtt[0m: 
	* [33mbb[0m: 
	* [33mtb[0m: 
	* [33mbt[0m: 
[32mdump_separator[0m (str):          set information dump field separator
[32mmax_pixels[0m (lsint, default: [3m+I[0m, minmax: 0-I): Maximum number of pixels
[32m*[0m (str):                       any possible options defined for AVCodecContext and sub-classes. see [33m[3mgpac -hx ffenc[0m and [33m[3mgpac -hx ffenc:*[0m

[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32madaptation_sets[0m (str):         Adaptation sets. Syntax: id=0,streams=0,1,2 id=1,streams=3,4 and so on
[32mwindow_size[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): number of segments kept in the manifest
[32mextra_window_size[0m (sint, default: [3m5[0m, minmax: 0-I): number of segments kept outside of the manifest before removing from disk
[32mmin_seg_duration[0m (sint, default: [3m5000000[0m, minmax: 0-I): minimum segment duration (in microseconds)
[32mremove_at_exit[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): remove all segments when finished
[32muse_template[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m): Use SegmentTemplate instead of SegmentList
[32muse_timeline[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m): Use SegmentTimeline in SegmentTemplate
[32msingle_file[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): Store all segments in one file, accessed using byte ranges
[32msingle_file_name[0m (str):        DASH-templated name to be used for baseURL. Implies storing all segments in one file, accessed using byte ranges
[32minit_seg_name[0m (str, default: [3minit-stream$RepresentationID$.m4s[0m): DASH-templated name to used for the initialization segment

[32mutc_timing_url[0m (str):          URL of the page that will return the UTC timestamp in ISO format

[32mffmx:f4v[0m

Description: F4V Adobe Flash Video
Version: Lavf57.83.100
Configuration: --prefix=/usr --extra-version=0ubuntu0.2 --toolchain=hardened --libdir=/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu --incdir=/usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu --enable-gpl --disable-stripping --enable-avresample --enable-avisynth --enable-gnutls --enable-ladspa --enable-libass --enable-libbluray --enable-libbs2b --enable-libcaca --enable-libcdio --enable-libflite --enable-libfontconfig --enable-libfreetype --enable-libfribidi --enable-libgme --enable-libgsm --enable-libmp3lame --enable-libmysofa --enable-libopenjpeg --enable-libopenmpt --enable-libopus --enable-libpulse --enable-librubberband --enable-librsvg --enable-libshine --enable-libsnappy --enable-libsoxr --enable-libspeex --enable-libssh --enable-libtheora --enable-libtwolame --enable-libvorbis --enable-libvpx --enable-libwavpack --enable-libwebp --enable-libx265 --enable-libxml2 --enable-libxvid --enable-libzmq --enable-libzvbi --enable-omx --enable-openal --enable-opengl --enable-sdl2 --enable-libdc1394 --enable-libdrm --enable-libiec61883 --enable-chromaprint --enable-frei0r --enable-libopencv --enable-libx264 --enable-shared

[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mmovflags[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m):   MOV muxer flags
	 * [33mrtphint[0m: Add RTP hint tracks
	 * [33mempty_moov[0m: Make the initial moov atom empty
	 * [33mfrag_keyframe[0m: Fragment at video keyframes
	 * [33mseparate_moof[0m: Write separate moof/mdat atoms for each track
	 * [33mfrag_custom[0m: Flush fragments on caller requests
	 * [33misml[0m: Create a live smooth streaming feed (for pushing to a publishing point)
	 * [33mfaststart[0m: Run a second pass to put the index (moov atom) at the beginning of the file
	 * [33momit_tfhd_offset[0m: Omit the base data offset in tfhd atoms
	 * [33mdisable_chpl[0m: Disable Nero chapter atom
	 * [33mdefault_base_moof[0m: Set the default-base-is-moof flag in tfhd atoms
	 * [33mdash[0m: Write DASH compatible fragmented MP4
	 * [33mfrag_discont[0m: Signal that the next fragment is discontinuous from earlier ones
	 * [33mdelay_moov[0m: Delay writing the initial moov until the first fragment is cut, or until the first fragment flush
	 * [33mglobal_sidx[0m: Write a global sidx index at the start of the file
	 * [33mwrite_colr[0m: Write colr atom (Experimental, may be renamed or changed, do not use from scripts)
	 * [33mwrite_gama[0m: Write deprecated gama atom
	 * [33muse_metadata_tags[0m: Use mdta atom for metadata.
	 * [33mskip_trailer[0m: Skip writing the mfra/tfra/mfro trailer for fragmented files
	 * [33mnegative_cts_offsets[0m: Use negative CTS offsets (reducing the need for edit lists)
[32mmoov_size[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): maximum moov size so it can be placed at the begin
[32mrtpflags[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m):   RTP muxer flags
	 * [33mlatm[0m: Use MP4A-LATM packetization instead of MPEG4-GENERIC for AAC
	 * [33mrfc2190[0m: Use RFC 2190 packetization instead of RFC 4629 for H.263
	 * [33mskip_rtcp[0m: Don't send RTCP sender reports
	 * [33mh264_mode0[0m: Use mode 0 for H.264 in RTP
	 * [33msend_bye[0m: Send RTCP BYE packets when finishing
[32mskip_iods[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m): Skip writing iods atom.
[32miods_audio_profile[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: -1-255): iods audio profile atom.
[32miods_video_profile[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: -1-255): iods video profile atom.
[32mfrag_duration[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): Maximum fragment duration
[32mmin_frag_duration[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): Minimum fragment duration
[32mfrag_size[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): Maximum fragment size
[32mism_lookahead[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): Number of lookahead entries for ISM files
[32mvideo_track_timescale[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): set timescale of all video tracks
[32mbrand[0m (str):                   Override major brand
[32muse_editlist[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m): use edit list
[32mfragment_index[0m (sint, default: [3m1[0m, minmax: 1-I): Fragment number of the next fragment
[32mmov_gamma[0m (flt, default: [3m0[0m):   gamma value for gama atom
[32mfrag_interleave[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): Interleave samples within fragments (max number of consecutive samples, lower is tighter interleaving, but with more overhead)
[32mencryption_scheme[0m (str):       Configures the encryption scheme, allowed values are none, cenc-aes-ctr
[32mencryption_key[0m (uint):         The media encryption key (hex)
[32mencryption_kid[0m (uint):         The media encryption key identifier (hex)
[32muse_stream_ids_as_track_ids[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): use stream ids as track ids
[32mwrite_tmcd[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m): force or disable writing tmcd

[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mfifo_format[0m (str):             Target muxer
[32mqueue_size[0m (sint, default: [3m60[0m, minmax: 1-I): Size of fifo queue
[32mformat_opts[0m (str):             Options to be passed to underlying muxer
[32mdrop_pkts_on_overflow[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): Drop packets on fifo queue overflow not to block encoder
[32mrestart_with_keyframe[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): Wait for keyframe when restarting output
[32mattempt_recovery[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): Attempt recovery in case of failure
[32mmax_recovery_attempts[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): Maximal number of recovery attempts
[32mrecovery_wait_time[0m (uint):     Waiting time between recovery attempts
[32mrecovery_wait_streamtime[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): Use stream time instead of real time while waiting for recovery
[32mrecover_any_error[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): Attempt recovery regardless of type of the error

	 * [33mno_duration_filesize[0m: disable duration and filesize zero value metadata for FLV
	 * [33madd_keyframe_index[0m: Add keyframe index metadata

[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mwindow_size[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): number of fragments kept in the manifest
[32mextra_window_size[0m (sint, default: [3m5[0m, minmax: 0-I): number of fragments kept outside of the manifest before removing from disk
[32mmin_frag_duration[0m (lsint, default: [3m10000000[0m, minmax: 0-I): minimum fragment duration (in microseconds)
[32mremove_at_exit[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): remove all fragments when finished

[32mffmx:hls[0m

Description: Apple HTTP Live Streaming
Version: Lavf57.83.100
Configuration: --prefix=/usr --extra-version=0ubuntu0.2 --toolchain=hardened --libdir=/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu --incdir=/usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu --enable-gpl --disable-stripping --enable-avresample --enable-avisynth --enable-gnutls --enable-ladspa --enable-libass --enable-libbluray --enable-libbs2b --enable-libcaca --enable-libcdio --enable-libflite --enable-libfontconfig --enable-libfreetype --enable-libfribidi --enable-libgme --enable-libgsm --enable-libmp3lame --enable-libmysofa --enable-libopenjpeg --enable-libopenmpt --enable-libopus --enable-libpulse --enable-librubberband --enable-librsvg --enable-libshine --enable-libsnappy --enable-libsoxr --enable-libspeex --enable-libssh --enable-libtheora --enable-libtwolame --enable-libvorbis --enable-libvpx --enable-libwavpack --enable-libwebp --enable-libx265 --enable-libxml2 --enable-libxvid --enable-libzmq --enable-libzvbi --enable-omx --enable-openal --enable-opengl --enable-sdl2 --enable-libdc1394 --enable-libdrm --enable-libiec61883 --enable-chromaprint --enable-frei0r --enable-libopencv --enable-libx264 --enable-shared

[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mstart_number[0m (lsint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): set first number in the sequence
[32mhls_time[0m (flt, default: [3m2[0m):    set segment length in seconds
[32mhls_init_time[0m (flt, default: [3m0[0m): set segment length in seconds at init list
[32mhls_list_size[0m (sint, default: [3m5[0m, minmax: 0-I): set maximum number of playlist entries
[32mhls_ts_options[0m (str):          set hls mpegts list of options for the container format used for hls
[32mhls_vtt_options[0m (str):         set hls vtt list of options for the container format used for hls
[32mhls_wrap[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): set number after which the index wraps (will be deprecated)
[32mhls_allow_cache[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: -I-I): explicitly set whether the client MAY (1) or MUST NOT (0) cache media segments
[32mhls_base_url[0m (str):            url to prepend to each playlist entry
[32mhls_segment_filename[0m (str):    filename template for segment files
[32mhls_segment_size[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): maximum size per segment file, (in bytes)
[32mhls_key_info_file[0m (str):       file with key URI and key file path
[32mhls_enc[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): enable AES128 encryption support
[32mhls_enc_key[0m (str):             hex-coded 16 byte key to encrypt the segments
[32mhls_enc_key_url[0m (str):         url to access the key to decrypt the segments
[32mhls_enc_iv[0m (str):              hex-coded 16 byte initialization vector
[32mhls_subtitle_path[0m (str):       set path of hls subtitles
[32mhls_segment_type[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-1): set hls segment files type
	 * [33mmpegts[0m: make segment file to mpegts files in m3u8
	 * [33mfmp4[0m: make segment file to fragment mp4 files in m3u8
[32mhls_fmp4_init_filename[0m (str, default: [3minit.mp4[0m): set fragment mp4 file init filename
[32mhls_flags[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m):  set flags affecting HLS playlist and media file generation
	 * [33msingle_file[0m: generate a single media file indexed with byte ranges
	 * [33mtemp_file[0m: write segment to temporary file and rename when complete
	 * [33mdelete_segments[0m: delete segment files that are no longer part of the playlist
	 * [33mround_durations[0m: round durations in m3u8 to whole numbers
	 * [33mdiscont_start[0m: start the playlist with a discontinuity tag
	 * [33momit_endlist[0m: Do not append an endlist when ending stream
	 * [33msplit_by_time[0m: split the hls segment by time which user set by hls_time
	 * [33mappend_list[0m: append the new segments into old hls segment list
	 * [33mprogram_date_time[0m: add EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME
	 * [33msecond_level_segment_index[0m: include segment index in segment filenames when use_localtime
	 * [33msecond_level_segment_duration[0m: include segment duration in segment filenames when use_localtime
	 * [33msecond_level_segment_size[0m: include segment size in segment filenames when use_localtime
	 * [33mperiodic_rekey[0m: reload keyinfo file periodically for re-keying
[32muse_localtime[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): set filename expansion with strftime at segment creation
[32muse_localtime_mkdir[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): create last directory component in strftime-generated filename
[32mhls_playlist_type[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-2): set the HLS playlist type
	 * [33mevent[0m: EVENT playlist
	 * [33mvod[0m: VOD playlist
[32mmethod[0m (str):                  set the HTTP method(default: PUT)
[32mhls_start_number_source[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-2): set source of first number in sequence
	 * [33mgeneric[0m: start_number value (default)
	 * [33mepoch[0m: seconds since epoch
	 * [33mdatetime[0m: current datetime as YYYYMMDDhhmmss
[32mhttp_user_agent[0m (str):         override User-Agent field in HTTP header

Configuration: --prefix=/usr --extra-version=0ubuntu0.2 --toolchain=hardened --libdir=/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu --incdir=/usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu --enable-gpl --disable-stripping --enable-avresample --enable-avisynth --enable-gnutls --enable-ladspa --enable-libass --enable-libbluray --enable-libbs2b --enable-libcaca --enable-libcdio --enable-libflite --enable-libfontconfig --enable-libfreetype --enable-libfribidi --enable-libgme --enable-libgsm --enable-libmp3lame --enable-libmysofa --enable-libopenjpeg --enable-libopenmpt --enable-libopus --enable-libpulse --enable-librubberband --enable-librsvg --enable-libshine --enable-libsnappy --enable-libsoxr --enable-libspeex --enable-libssh --enable-libtheora --enable-libtwolame --enable-libvorbis --enable-libvpx --enable-libwavpack --enable-libwebp --enable-libx265 --enable-libxml2 --enable-libxvid --enable-libzmq --enable-libzvbi --enable-omx --enable-openal --enable-opengl --enable-sdl2 --enable-libdc1394 --enable-libdrm --enable-libiec61883 --enable-chromaprint --enable-frei0r --enable-libopencv --enable-libx264 --enable-shared

[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mmovflags[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m):   MOV muxer flags
	 * [33mrtphint[0m: Add RTP hint tracks
	 * [33mempty_moov[0m: Make the initial moov atom empty
	 * [33mfrag_keyframe[0m: Fragment at video keyframes
	 * [33mseparate_moof[0m: Write separate moof/mdat atoms for each track
	 * [33mfrag_custom[0m: Flush fragments on caller requests
	 * [33misml[0m: Create a live smooth streaming feed (for pushing to a publishing point)
	 * [33mfaststart[0m: Run a second pass to put the index (moov atom) at the beginning of the file
	 * [33momit_tfhd_offset[0m: Omit the base data offset in tfhd atoms
	 * [33mdisable_chpl[0m: Disable Nero chapter atom
	 * [33mdefault_base_moof[0m: Set the default-base-is-moof flag in tfhd atoms
	 * [33mdash[0m: Write DASH compatible fragmented MP4
	 * [33mfrag_discont[0m: Signal that the next fragment is discontinuous from earlier ones
	 * [33mdelay_moov[0m: Delay writing the initial moov until the first fragment is cut, or until the first fragment flush
	 * [33mglobal_sidx[0m: Write a global sidx index at the start of the file
	 * [33mwrite_colr[0m: Write colr atom (Experimental, may be renamed or changed, do not use from scripts)
	 * [33mwrite_gama[0m: Write deprecated gama atom
	 * [33muse_metadata_tags[0m: Use mdta atom for metadata.
	 * [33mskip_trailer[0m: Skip writing the mfra/tfra/mfro trailer for fragmented files
	 * [33mnegative_cts_offsets[0m: Use negative CTS offsets (reducing the need for edit lists)
[32mmoov_size[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): maximum moov size so it can be placed at the begin
[32mrtpflags[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m):   RTP muxer flags
	 * [33mlatm[0m: Use MP4A-LATM packetization instead of MPEG4-GENERIC for AAC
	 * [33mrfc2190[0m: Use RFC 2190 packetization instead of RFC 4629 for H.263
	 * [33mskip_rtcp[0m: Don't send RTCP sender reports
	 * [33mh264_mode0[0m: Use mode 0 for H.264 in RTP
	 * [33msend_bye[0m: Send RTCP BYE packets when finishing
[32mskip_iods[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m): Skip writing iods atom.
[32miods_audio_profile[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: -1-255): iods audio profile atom.
[32miods_video_profile[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: -1-255): iods video profile atom.
[32mfrag_duration[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): Maximum fragment duration
[32mmin_frag_duration[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): Minimum fragment duration
[32mfrag_size[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): Maximum fragment size
[32mism_lookahead[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): Number of lookahead entries for ISM files
[32mvideo_track_timescale[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): set timescale of all video tracks
[32mbrand[0m (str):                   Override major brand
[32muse_editlist[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m): use edit list
[32mfragment_index[0m (sint, default: [3m1[0m, minmax: 1-I): Fragment number of the next fragment
[32mmov_gamma[0m (flt, default: [3m0[0m):   gamma value for gama atom
[32mfrag_interleave[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): Interleave samples within fragments (max number of consecutive samples, lower is tighter interleaving, but with more overhead)
[32mencryption_scheme[0m (str):       Configures the encryption scheme, allowed values are none, cenc-aes-ctr
[32mencryption_key[0m (uint):         The media encryption key (hex)
[32mencryption_kid[0m (uint):         The media encryption key identifier (hex)
[32muse_stream_ids_as_track_ids[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): use stream ids as track ids
[32mwrite_tmcd[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m): force or disable writing tmcd

[32mencryption_scheme[0m (str):       Configures the encryption scheme, allowed values are none, cenc-aes-ctr

[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mreserve_index_space[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): Reserve a given amount of space (in bytes) at the beginning of the file for the index (cues).
[32mcluster_size_limit[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: -1-I): Store at most the provided amount of bytes in a cluster. 
[32mcluster_time_limit[0m (lsint, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: -1-I): Store at most the provided number of milliseconds in a cluster.
[32mdash[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m):   Create a WebM file conforming to WebM DASH specification
[32mdash_track_number[0m (sint, default: [3m1[0m, minmax: 0-127): Track number for the DASH stream
[32mlive[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m):   Write files assuming it is a live stream.
[32mallow_raw_vfw[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): allow RAW VFW mode
[32mwrite_crc32[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m): write a CRC32 element inside every Level 1 element

[32mffmx:mov[0m

Description: QuickTime / MOV
Version: Lavf57.83.100
Configuration: --prefix=/usr --extra-version=0ubuntu0.2 --toolchain=hardened --libdir=/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu --incdir=/usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu --enable-gpl --disable-stripping --enable-avresample --enable-avisynth --enable-gnutls --enable-ladspa --enable-libass --enable-libbluray --enable-libbs2b --enable-libcaca --enable-libcdio --enable-libflite --enable-libfontconfig --enable-libfreetype --enable-libfribidi --enable-libgme --enable-libgsm --enable-libmp3lame --enable-libmysofa --enable-libopenjpeg --enable-libopenmpt --enable-libopus --enable-libpulse --enable-librubberband --enable-librsvg --enable-libshine --enable-libsnappy --enable-libsoxr --enable-libspeex --enable-libssh --enable-libtheora --enable-libtwolame --enable-libvorbis --enable-libvpx --enable-libwavpack --enable-libwebp --enable-libx265 --enable-libxml2 --enable-libxvid --enable-libzmq --enable-libzvbi --enable-omx --enable-openal --enable-opengl --enable-sdl2 --enable-libdc1394 --enable-libdrm --enable-libiec61883 --enable-chromaprint --enable-frei0r --enable-libopencv --enable-libx264 --enable-shared

[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mmovflags[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m):   MOV muxer flags
	 * [33mrtphint[0m: Add RTP hint tracks
	 * [33mempty_moov[0m: Make the initial moov atom empty
	 * [33mfrag_keyframe[0m: Fragment at video keyframes
	 * [33mseparate_moof[0m: Write separate moof/mdat atoms for each track
	 * [33mfrag_custom[0m: Flush fragments on caller requests
	 * [33misml[0m: Create a live smooth streaming feed (for pushing to a publishing point)
	 * [33mfaststart[0m: Run a second pass to put the index (moov atom) at the beginning of the file
	 * [33momit_tfhd_offset[0m: Omit the base data offset in tfhd atoms
	 * [33mdisable_chpl[0m: Disable Nero chapter atom
	 * [33mdefault_base_moof[0m: Set the default-base-is-moof flag in tfhd atoms
	 * [33mdash[0m: Write DASH compatible fragmented MP4
	 * [33mfrag_discont[0m: Signal that the next fragment is discontinuous from earlier ones
	 * [33mdelay_moov[0m: Delay writing the initial moov until the first fragment is cut, or until the first fragment flush
	 * [33mglobal_sidx[0m: Write a global sidx index at the start of the file
	 * [33mwrite_colr[0m: Write colr atom (Experimental, may be renamed or changed, do not use from scripts)
	 * [33mwrite_gama[0m: Write deprecated gama atom
	 * [33muse_metadata_tags[0m: Use mdta atom for metadata.
	 * [33mskip_trailer[0m: Skip writing the mfra/tfra/mfro trailer for fragmented files
	 * [33mnegative_cts_offsets[0m: Use negative CTS offsets (reducing the need for edit lists)
[32mmoov_size[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): maximum moov size so it can be placed at the begin
[32mrtpflags[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m):   RTP muxer flags
	 * [33mlatm[0m: Use MP4A-LATM packetization instead of MPEG4-GENERIC for AAC
	 * [33mrfc2190[0m: Use RFC 2190 packetization instead of RFC 4629 for H.263
	 * [33mskip_rtcp[0m: Don't send RTCP sender reports
	 * [33mh264_mode0[0m: Use mode 0 for H.264 in RTP
	 * [33msend_bye[0m: Send RTCP BYE packets when finishing
[32mskip_iods[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m): Skip writing iods atom.
[32miods_audio_profile[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: -1-255): iods audio profile atom.
[32miods_video_profile[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: -1-255): iods video profile atom.
[32mfrag_duration[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): Maximum fragment duration
[32mmin_frag_duration[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): Minimum fragment duration
[32mfrag_size[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): Maximum fragment size
[32mism_lookahead[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): Number of lookahead entries for ISM files
[32mvideo_track_timescale[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): set timescale of all video tracks
[32mbrand[0m (str):                   Override major brand
[32muse_editlist[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m): use edit list
[32mfragment_index[0m (sint, default: [3m1[0m, minmax: 1-I): Fragment number of the next fragment
[32mmov_gamma[0m (flt, default: [3m0[0m):   gamma value for gama atom
[32mfrag_interleave[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): Interleave samples within fragments (max number of consecutive samples, lower is tighter interleaving, but with more overhead)
[32mencryption_scheme[0m (str):       Configures the encryption scheme, allowed values are none, cenc-aes-ctr
[32mencryption_key[0m (uint):         The media encryption key (hex)
[32mencryption_kid[0m (uint):         The media encryption key identifier (hex)
[32muse_stream_ids_as_track_ids[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): use stream ids as track ids
[32mwrite_tmcd[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m): force or disable writing tmcd


[32mffmx:mp2[0m

Description: MP4 (MPEG-4 Part 14)
Version: Lavf57.83.100
Configuration: --prefix=/usr --extra-version=0ubuntu0.2 --toolchain=hardened --libdir=/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu --incdir=/usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu --enable-gpl --disable-stripping --enable-avresample --enable-avisynth --enable-gnutls --enable-ladspa --enable-libass --enable-libbluray --enable-libbs2b --enable-libcaca --enable-libcdio --enable-libflite --enable-libfontconfig --enable-libfreetype --enable-libfribidi --enable-libgme --enable-libgsm --enable-libmp3lame --enable-libmysofa --enable-libopenjpeg --enable-libopenmpt --enable-libopus --enable-libpulse --enable-librubberband --enable-librsvg --enable-libshine --enable-libsnappy --enable-libsoxr --enable-libspeex --enable-libssh --enable-libtheora --enable-libtwolame --enable-libvorbis --enable-libvpx --enable-libwavpack --enable-libwebp --enable-libx265 --enable-libxml2 --enable-libxvid --enable-libzmq --enable-libzvbi --enable-omx --enable-openal --enable-opengl --enable-sdl2 --enable-libdc1394 --enable-libdrm --enable-libiec61883 --enable-chromaprint --enable-frei0r --enable-libopencv --enable-libx264 --enable-shared

[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mmovflags[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m):   MOV muxer flags
	 * [33mrtphint[0m: Add RTP hint tracks
	 * [33mempty_moov[0m: Make the initial moov atom empty
	 * [33mfrag_keyframe[0m: Fragment at video keyframes
	 * [33mseparate_moof[0m: Write separate moof/mdat atoms for each track
	 * [33mfrag_custom[0m: Flush fragments on caller requests
	 * [33misml[0m: Create a live smooth streaming feed (for pushing to a publishing point)
	 * [33mfaststart[0m: Run a second pass to put the index (moov atom) at the beginning of the file
	 * [33momit_tfhd_offset[0m: Omit the base data offset in tfhd atoms
	 * [33mdisable_chpl[0m: Disable Nero chapter atom
	 * [33mdefault_base_moof[0m: Set the default-base-is-moof flag in tfhd atoms
	 * [33mdash[0m: Write DASH compatible fragmented MP4
	 * [33mfrag_discont[0m: Signal that the next fragment is discontinuous from earlier ones
	 * [33mdelay_moov[0m: Delay writing the initial moov until the first fragment is cut, or until the first fragment flush
	 * [33mglobal_sidx[0m: Write a global sidx index at the start of the file
	 * [33mwrite_colr[0m: Write colr atom (Experimental, may be renamed or changed, do not use from scripts)
	 * [33mwrite_gama[0m: Write deprecated gama atom
	 * [33muse_metadata_tags[0m: Use mdta atom for metadata.
	 * [33mskip_trailer[0m: Skip writing the mfra/tfra/mfro trailer for fragmented files
	 * [33mnegative_cts_offsets[0m: Use negative CTS offsets (reducing the need for edit lists)
[32mmoov_size[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): maximum moov size so it can be placed at the begin
[32mrtpflags[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m):   RTP muxer flags
	 * [33mlatm[0m: Use MP4A-LATM packetization instead of MPEG4-GENERIC for AAC
	 * [33mrfc2190[0m: Use RFC 2190 packetization instead of RFC 4629 for H.263
	 * [33mskip_rtcp[0m: Don't send RTCP sender reports
	 * [33mh264_mode0[0m: Use mode 0 for H.264 in RTP
	 * [33msend_bye[0m: Send RTCP BYE packets when finishing
[32mskip_iods[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m): Skip writing iods atom.
[32miods_audio_profile[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: -1-255): iods audio profile atom.
[32miods_video_profile[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: -1-255): iods video profile atom.
[32mfrag_duration[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): Maximum fragment duration
[32mmin_frag_duration[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): Minimum fragment duration
[32mfrag_size[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): Maximum fragment size
[32mism_lookahead[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): Number of lookahead entries for ISM files
[32mvideo_track_timescale[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): set timescale of all video tracks
[32mbrand[0m (str):                   Override major brand
[32muse_editlist[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m): use edit list
[32mfragment_index[0m (sint, default: [3m1[0m, minmax: 1-I): Fragment number of the next fragment
[32mmov_gamma[0m (flt, default: [3m0[0m):   gamma value for gama atom
[32mfrag_interleave[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): Interleave samples within fragments (max number of consecutive samples, lower is tighter interleaving, but with more overhead)
[32mencryption_scheme[0m (str):       Configures the encryption scheme, allowed values are none, cenc-aes-ctr
[32mencryption_key[0m (uint):         The media encryption key (hex)
[32mencryption_kid[0m (uint):         The media encryption key identifier (hex)
[32muse_stream_ids_as_track_ids[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): use stream ids as track ids
[32mwrite_tmcd[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m): force or disable writing tmcd

	 * [33minitial_discontinuity[0m: Mark initial packets as discontinuous

[32mffmx:psp[0m

Description: PSP MP4 (MPEG-4 Part 14)
Version: Lavf57.83.100
Configuration: --prefix=/usr --extra-version=0ubuntu0.2 --toolchain=hardened --libdir=/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu --incdir=/usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu --enable-gpl --disable-stripping --enable-avresample --enable-avisynth --enable-gnutls --enable-ladspa --enable-libass --enable-libbluray --enable-libbs2b --enable-libcaca --enable-libcdio --enable-libflite --enable-libfontconfig --enable-libfreetype --enable-libfribidi --enable-libgme --enable-libgsm --enable-libmp3lame --enable-libmysofa --enable-libopenjpeg --enable-libopenmpt --enable-libopus --enable-libpulse --enable-librubberband --enable-librsvg --enable-libshine --enable-libsnappy --enable-libsoxr --enable-libspeex --enable-libssh --enable-libtheora --enable-libtwolame --enable-libvorbis --enable-libvpx --enable-libwavpack --enable-libwebp --enable-libx265 --enable-libxml2 --enable-libxvid --enable-libzmq --enable-libzvbi --enable-omx --enable-openal --enable-opengl --enable-sdl2 --enable-libdc1394 --enable-libdrm --enable-libiec61883 --enable-chromaprint --enable-frei0r --enable-libopencv --enable-libx264 --enable-shared

[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mmovflags[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m):   MOV muxer flags
	 * [33mrtphint[0m: Add RTP hint tracks
	 * [33mempty_moov[0m: Make the initial moov atom empty
	 * [33mfrag_keyframe[0m: Fragment at video keyframes
	 * [33mseparate_moof[0m: Write separate moof/mdat atoms for each track
	 * [33mfrag_custom[0m: Flush fragments on caller requests
	 * [33misml[0m: Create a live smooth streaming feed (for pushing to a publishing point)
	 * [33mfaststart[0m: Run a second pass to put the index (moov atom) at the beginning of the file
	 * [33momit_tfhd_offset[0m: Omit the base data offset in tfhd atoms
	 * [33mdisable_chpl[0m: Disable Nero chapter atom
	 * [33mdefault_base_moof[0m: Set the default-base-is-moof flag in tfhd atoms
	 * [33mdash[0m: Write DASH compatible fragmented MP4
	 * [33mfrag_discont[0m: Signal that the next fragment is discontinuous from earlier ones
	 * [33mdelay_moov[0m: Delay writing the initial moov until the first fragment is cut, or until the first fragment flush
	 * [33mglobal_sidx[0m: Write a global sidx index at the start of the file
	 * [33mwrite_colr[0m: Write colr atom (Experimental, may be renamed or changed, do not use from scripts)
	 * [33mwrite_gama[0m: Write deprecated gama atom
	 * [33muse_metadata_tags[0m: Use mdta atom for metadata.
	 * [33mskip_trailer[0m: Skip writing the mfra/tfra/mfro trailer for fragmented files
	 * [33mnegative_cts_offsets[0m: Use negative CTS offsets (reducing the need for edit lists)
[32mmoov_size[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): maximum moov size so it can be placed at the begin
[32mrtpflags[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m):   RTP muxer flags
	 * [33mlatm[0m: Use MP4A-LATM packetization instead of MPEG4-GENERIC for AAC
	 * [33mrfc2190[0m: Use RFC 2190 packetization instead of RFC 4629 for H.263
	 * [33mskip_rtcp[0m: Don't send RTCP sender reports
	 * [33mh264_mode0[0m: Use mode 0 for H.264 in RTP
	 * [33msend_bye[0m: Send RTCP BYE packets when finishing
[32mskip_iods[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m): Skip writing iods atom.
[32miods_audio_profile[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: -1-255): iods audio profile atom.
[32miods_video_profile[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: -1-255): iods video profile atom.
[32mfrag_duration[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): Maximum fragment duration
[32mmin_frag_duration[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): Minimum fragment duration
[32mfrag_size[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): Maximum fragment size
[32mism_lookahead[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): Number of lookahead entries for ISM files
[32mvideo_track_timescale[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): set timescale of all video tracks
[32mbrand[0m (str):                   Override major brand
[32muse_editlist[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m): use edit list
[32mfragment_index[0m (sint, default: [3m1[0m, minmax: 1-I): Fragment number of the next fragment
[32mmov_gamma[0m (flt, default: [3m0[0m):   gamma value for gama atom
[32mfrag_interleave[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): Interleave samples within fragments (max number of consecutive samples, lower is tighter interleaving, but with more overhead)
[32mencryption_scheme[0m (str):       Configures the encryption scheme, allowed values are none, cenc-aes-ctr
[32mencryption_key[0m (uint):         The media encryption key (hex)
[32mencryption_kid[0m (uint):         The media encryption key identifier (hex)
[32muse_stream_ids_as_track_ids[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): use stream ids as track ids
[32mwrite_tmcd[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m): force or disable writing tmcd


[32mffmx:rawvideo[0m

Version: Lavf57.83.100

[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mrtpflags[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m):   RTP muxer flags
	 * [33mlatm[0m: Use MP4A-LATM packetization instead of MPEG4-GENERIC for AAC
	 * [33mrfc2190[0m: Use RFC 2190 packetization instead of RFC 4629 for H.263
	 * [33mskip_rtcp[0m: Don't send RTCP sender reports
	 * [33mh264_mode0[0m: Use mode 0 for H.264 in RTP
	 * [33msend_bye[0m: Send RTCP BYE packets when finishing
[32mpayload_type[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: -1-127): Specify RTP payload type
[32mssrc[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: -I-I): Stream identifier
[32mcname[0m (str):                   CNAME to include in RTCP SR packets
[32mseq[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: -1-65535): Starting sequence number

[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32minitial_pause[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): do not start playing the stream immediately
[32mrtpflags[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m):   RTP muxer flags
	 * [33mlatm[0m: Use MP4A-LATM packetization instead of MPEG4-GENERIC for AAC
	 * [33mrfc2190[0m: Use RFC 2190 packetization instead of RFC 4629 for H.263
	 * [33mskip_rtcp[0m: Don't send RTCP sender reports
	 * [33mh264_mode0[0m: Use mode 0 for H.264 in RTP
	 * [33msend_bye[0m: Send RTCP BYE packets when finishing
[32mrtsp_transport[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m): set RTSP transport protocols
	 * [33mudp[0m: UDP
	 * [33mtcp[0m: TCP
	 * [33mudp_multicast[0m: UDP multicast
	 * [33mhttp[0m: HTTP tunneling
[32mrtsp_flags[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m): set RTSP flags
	 * [33mfilter_src[0m: only receive packets from the negotiated peer IP
	 * [33mlisten[0m: wait for incoming connections
	 * [33mprefer_tcp[0m: try RTP via TCP first, if available
[32mallowed_media_types[0m (uint, default: [3m15[0m): set media types to accept from the server
	 * [33mvideo[0m: Video
	 * [33maudio[0m: Audio
	 * [33mdata[0m: Data
	 * [33msubtitle[0m: Subtitle
[32mmin_port[0m (sint, default: [3m5000[0m, minmax: 0-65535): set minimum local UDP port
[32mmax_port[0m (sint, default: [3m65000[0m, minmax: 0-65535): set maximum local UDP port
[32mtimeout[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: -I-I): set maximum timeout (in seconds) to wait for incoming connections (-1 is infinite, imply flag listen)
[32mstimeout[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: -I-I): set timeout (in microseconds) of socket TCP I/O operations
[32mreorder_queue_size[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: -1-I): set number of packets to buffer for handling of reordered packets
[32mbuffer_size[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: -1-I): Underlying protocol send/receive buffer size
[32muser-agent[0m (str, default: [3mLavf57.83.100[0m): override User-Agent header

[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mreference_stream[0m (str, default: [3mauto[0m): set reference stream
[32msegment_format[0m (str):          set container format used for the segments
[32msegment_format_options[0m (str):  set list of options for the container format used for the segments
[32msegment_list[0m (str):            set the segment list filename
[32msegment_header_filename[0m (str): write a single file containing the header
[32msegment_list_flags[0m (uint, default: [3m1[0m): set flags affecting segment list generation
	 * [33mcache[0m: allow list caching
	 * [33mlive[0m: enable live-friendly list generation (useful for HLS)
[32msegment_list_size[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): set the maximum number of playlist entries
[32msegment_list_type[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: -1-4): set the segment list type
	 * [33mflat[0m: flat format
	 * [33mcsv[0m: csv format
	 * [33mext[0m: extended format
	 * [33mffconcat[0m: ffconcat format
	 * [33mm3u8[0m: M3U8 format
	 * [33mhls[0m: Apple HTTP Live Streaming compatible
[32msegment_atclocktime[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): set segment to be cut at clocktime
[32msegment_clocktime_offset[0m (uint): set segment clocktime offset
[32msegment_clocktime_wrap_duration[0m (uint): set segment clocktime wrapping duration
[32msegment_time[0m (str):            set segment duration
[32msegment_time_delta[0m (uint):     set approximation value used for the segment times
[32msegment_times[0m (str):           set segment split time points
[32msegment_frames[0m (str):          set segment split frame numbers
[32msegment_wrap[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): set number after which the index wraps
[32msegment_list_entry_prefix[0m (str): set base url prefix for segments
[32msegment_start_number[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): set the sequence number of the first segment
[32msegment_wrap_number[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): set the number of wrap before the first segment
[32mstrftime[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): set filename expansion with strftime at segment creation
[32mincrement_tc[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): increment timecode between each segment
[32mbreak_non_keyframes[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): allow breaking segments on non-keyframes
[32mindividual_header_trailer[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m): write header/trailer to each segment
[32mwrite_header_trailer[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m): write a header to the first segment and a trailer to the last one
[32mreset_timestamps[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): reset timestamps at the beginning of each segment
[32minitial_offset[0m (uint):         set initial timestamp offset
[32mwrite_empty_segments[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): allow writing empty 'filler' segments

[32mffmx:3g2[0m

Description: 3GP2 (3GPP2 file format)
Version: Lavf57.83.100
Configuration: --prefix=/usr --extra-version=0ubuntu0.2 --toolchain=hardened --libdir=/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu --incdir=/usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu --enable-gpl --disable-stripping --enable-avresample --enable-avisynth --enable-gnutls --enable-ladspa --enable-libass --enable-libbluray --enable-libbs2b --enable-libcaca --enable-libcdio --enable-libflite --enable-libfontconfig --enable-libfreetype --enable-libfribidi --enable-libgme --enable-libgsm --enable-libmp3lame --enable-libmysofa --enable-libopenjpeg --enable-libopenmpt --enable-libopus --enable-libpulse --enable-librubberband --enable-librsvg --enable-libshine --enable-libsnappy --enable-libsoxr --enable-libspeex --enable-libssh --enable-libtheora --enable-libtwolame --enable-libvorbis --enable-libvpx --enable-libwavpack --enable-libwebp --enable-libx265 --enable-libxml2 --enable-libxvid --enable-libzmq --enable-libzvbi --enable-omx --enable-openal --enable-opengl --enable-sdl2 --enable-libdc1394 --enable-libdrm --enable-libiec61883 --enable-chromaprint --enable-frei0r --enable-libopencv --enable-libx264 --enable-shared

[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mmovflags[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m):   MOV muxer flags
	 * [33mrtphint[0m: Add RTP hint tracks
	 * [33mempty_moov[0m: Make the initial moov atom empty
	 * [33mfrag_keyframe[0m: Fragment at video keyframes
	 * [33mseparate_moof[0m: Write separate moof/mdat atoms for each track
	 * [33mfrag_custom[0m: Flush fragments on caller requests
	 * [33misml[0m: Create a live smooth streaming feed (for pushing to a publishing point)
	 * [33mfaststart[0m: Run a second pass to put the index (moov atom) at the beginning of the file
	 * [33momit_tfhd_offset[0m: Omit the base data offset in tfhd atoms
	 * [33mdisable_chpl[0m: Disable Nero chapter atom
	 * [33mdefault_base_moof[0m: Set the default-base-is-moof flag in tfhd atoms
	 * [33mdash[0m: Write DASH compatible fragmented MP4
	 * [33mfrag_discont[0m: Signal that the next fragment is discontinuous from earlier ones
	 * [33mdelay_moov[0m: Delay writing the initial moov until the first fragment is cut, or until the first fragment flush
	 * [33mglobal_sidx[0m: Write a global sidx index at the start of the file
	 * [33mwrite_colr[0m: Write colr atom (Experimental, may be renamed or changed, do not use from scripts)
	 * [33mwrite_gama[0m: Write deprecated gama atom
	 * [33muse_metadata_tags[0m: Use mdta atom for metadata.
	 * [33mskip_trailer[0m: Skip writing the mfra/tfra/mfro trailer for fragmented files
	 * [33mnegative_cts_offsets[0m: Use negative CTS offsets (reducing the need for edit lists)
[32mmoov_size[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): maximum moov size so it can be placed at the begin
[32mrtpflags[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m):   RTP muxer flags
	 * [33mlatm[0m: Use MP4A-LATM packetization instead of MPEG4-GENERIC for AAC
	 * [33mrfc2190[0m: Use RFC 2190 packetization instead of RFC 4629 for H.263
	 * [33mskip_rtcp[0m: Don't send RTCP sender reports
	 * [33mh264_mode0[0m: Use mode 0 for H.264 in RTP
	 * [33msend_bye[0m: Send RTCP BYE packets when finishing
[32mskip_iods[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m): Skip writing iods atom.
[32miods_audio_profile[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: -1-255): iods audio profile atom.
[32miods_video_profile[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: -1-255): iods video profile atom.
[32mfrag_duration[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): Maximum fragment duration
[32mmin_frag_duration[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): Minimum fragment duration
[32mfrag_size[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): Maximum fragment size
[32mism_lookahead[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): Number of lookahead entries for ISM files
[32mvideo_track_timescale[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): set timescale of all video tracks
[32mbrand[0m (str):                   Override major brand
[32muse_editlist[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m): use edit list
[32mfragment_index[0m (sint, default: [3m1[0m, minmax: 1-I): Fragment number of the next fragment
[32mmov_gamma[0m (flt, default: [3m0[0m):   gamma value for gama atom
[32mfrag_interleave[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): Interleave samples within fragments (max number of consecutive samples, lower is tighter interleaving, but with more overhead)
[32mencryption_scheme[0m (str):       Configures the encryption scheme, allowed values are none, cenc-aes-ctr
[32mencryption_key[0m (uint):         The media encryption key (hex)
[32mencryption_kid[0m (uint):         The media encryption key identifier (hex)
[32muse_stream_ids_as_track_ids[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): use stream ids as track ids
[32mwrite_tmcd[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m): force or disable writing tmcd

[32mmovflags[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m):   MOV muxer flags
	 * [33mrtphint[0m: Add RTP hint tracks
	 * [33mempty_moov[0m: Make the initial moov atom empty

	 * [33mglobal_sidx[0m: Write a global sidx index at the start of the file
	 * [33mwrite_colr[0m: Write colr atom (Experimental, may be renamed or changed, do not use from scripts)
	 * [33mwrite_gama[0m: Write deprecated gama atom
	 * [33muse_metadata_tags[0m: Use mdta atom for metadata.
	 * [33mskip_trailer[0m: Skip writing the mfra/tfra/mfro trailer for fragmented files
	 * [33mnegative_cts_offsets[0m: Use negative CTS offsets (reducing the need for edit lists)
[32mmoov_size[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): maximum moov size so it can be placed at the begin
[32mrtpflags[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m):   RTP muxer flags
	 * [33mlatm[0m: Use MP4A-LATM packetization instead of MPEG4-GENERIC for AAC
	 * [33mrfc2190[0m: Use RFC 2190 packetization instead of RFC 4629 for H.263
	 * [33mskip_rtcp[0m: Don't send RTCP sender reports
	 * [33mh264_mode0[0m: Use mode 0 for H.264 in RTP
	 * [33msend_bye[0m: Send RTCP BYE packets when finishing
[32mskip_iods[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m): Skip writing iods atom.
[32miods_audio_profile[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: -1-255): iods audio profile atom.
[32miods_video_profile[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: -1-255): iods video profile atom.
[32mfrag_duration[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): Maximum fragment duration
[32mmin_frag_duration[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): Minimum fragment duration
[32mfrag_size[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): Maximum fragment size

[32muse_editlist[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m): use edit list
[32mfragment_index[0m (sint, default: [3m1[0m, minmax: 1-I): Fragment number of the next fragment

[32mffmx:mkvtimestamp_v2[0m

Configuration: --prefix=/usr --extra-version=0ubuntu0.2 --toolchain=hardened --libdir=/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu --incdir=/usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu --enable-gpl --disable-stripping --enable-avresample --enable-avisynth --enable-gnutls --enable-ladspa --enable-libass --enable-libbluray --enable-libbs2b --enable-libcaca --enable-libcdio --enable-libflite --enable-libfontconfig --enable-libfreetype --enable-libfribidi --enable-libgme --enable-libgsm --enable-libmp3lame --enable-libmysofa --enable-libopenjpeg --enable-libopenmpt --enable-libopus --enable-libpulse --enable-librubberband --enable-librsvg --enable-libshine --enable-libsnappy --enable-libsoxr --enable-libspeex --enable-libssh --enable-libtheora --enable-libtwolame --enable-libvorbis --enable-libvpx --enable-libwavpack --enable-libwebp --enable-libx265 --enable-libxml2 --enable-libxvid --enable-libzmq --enable-libzvbi --enable-omx --enable-openal --enable-opengl --enable-sdl2 --enable-libdc1394 --enable-libdrm --enable-libiec61883 --enable-chromaprint --enable-frei0r --enable-libopencv --enable-libx264 --enable-shared

[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mwrite_bext[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): Write BEXT chunk.
[32mwrite_peak[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-2): Write Peak Envelope chunk.
	 * [33moff[0m: Do not write peak chunk.
	 * [33mon[0m: Append peak chunk after wav data.
	 * [33monly[0m: Write only peak chunk, omit wav data.
[32mrf64[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: -1-1): Use RF64 header rather than RIFF for large files.
	 * [33mauto[0m: Write RF64 header if file grows large enough.
	 * [33malways[0m: Always write RF64 header regardless of file size.
	 * [33mnever[0m: Never write RF64 header regardless of file size.
[32mpeak_block_size[0m (sint, default: [3m256[0m, minmax: 0-65536): Number of audio samples used to generate each peak frame.
[32mpeak_format[0m (sint, default: [3m2[0m, minmax: 1-2): The format of the peak envelope data (1: uint8, 2: uint16).
[32mpeak_ppv[0m (sint, default: [3m2[0m, minmax: 1-2): Number of peak points per peak value (1 or 2).

[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mcluster_size_limit[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: -1-I): Store at most the provided amount of bytes in a cluster. 
[32mcluster_time_limit[0m (lsint, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: -1-I): Store at most the provided number of milliseconds in a cluster.
[32mdash[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m):   Create a WebM file conforming to WebM DASH specification
[32mdash_track_number[0m (sint, default: [3m1[0m, minmax: 0-127): Track number for the DASH stream
[32mlive[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m):   Write files assuming it is a live stream.
[32mallow_raw_vfw[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): allow RAW VFW mode
[32mwrite_crc32[0m (bool, default: [3mtrue[0m): write a CRC32 element inside every Level 1 element

[32mffmx[0m

Description: FFMPEG muxer
Version: Lavf57.83.100
Configuration: --prefix=/usr --extra-version=0ubuntu0.2 --toolchain=hardened --libdir=/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu --incdir=/usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu --enable-gpl --disable-stripping --enable-avresample --enable-avisynth --enable-gnutls --enable-ladspa --enable-libass --enable-libbluray --enable-libbs2b --enable-libcaca --enable-libcdio --enable-libflite --enable-libfontconfig --enable-libfreetype --enable-libfribidi --enable-libgme --enable-libgsm --enable-libmp3lame --enable-libmysofa --enable-libopenjpeg --enable-libopenmpt --enable-libopus --enable-libpulse --enable-librubberband --enable-librsvg --enable-libshine --enable-libsnappy --enable-libsoxr --enable-libspeex --enable-libssh --enable-libtheora --enable-libtwolame --enable-libvorbis --enable-libvpx --enable-libwavpack --enable-libwebp --enable-libx265 --enable-libxml2 --enable-libxvid --enable-libzmq --enable-libzvbi --enable-omx --enable-openal --enable-opengl --enable-sdl2 --enable-libdc1394 --enable-libdrm --enable-libiec61883 --enable-chromaprint --enable-frei0r --enable-libopencv --enable-libx264 --enable-shared

Mulitiplexes files and open output protocols using FFMPEG.
See FFMPEG documentation (https://ffmpeg.org/documentation.html) for more details.
To list all supported muxers for your GPAC build, use [33m[3mgpac -h ffmx:*[0m.This will list both supported output formats and protocols.
Output protocols are listed with [33m[3mDescription: Output protocol[0m, and the subclass name identitfes the protocol scheme.
For example, if [33m[3mffmx:rtmp[0m is listed as output protocol, this means [33m[3mrtmp://[0m destination URLs are supported.

Some URL formats may not be sufficient to derive the multiplexing format, you must then use [33m[3mffmt[0m to specify the desired format.

Unlike other multiplexing filters in GPAC, this filter is a sink filter and does not produce any PID to be redirected in the graph.
The filter can however use template names for its output, using the first input PID to resolve the final name.
The filter watches the property [33m[3mFileNumber[0m on incoming packets to create new files.



[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mdst[0m (cstr):                    location of destination file or remote URL
[32mstart[0m (dbl, default: [3m0.0[0m):     set playback start offset. Negative value means percent of media duration with -1 equal to duration
[32mspeed[0m (dbl, default: [3m1.0[0m):     set playback speed. If speed is negative and start is 0, start is set to -1
[32mavioflags[0m (uint):               
	* [33mdirect[0m: reduce buffering
[32mpacketsize[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-I): set packet size
[32mfflags[0m (uint):                  
	* [33mflush_packets[0m: reduce the latency by flushing out packets immediately
	* [33mlatm[0m: enable RTP MP4A-LATM payload
	* [33mbitexact[0m: do not write random/volatile data
	* [33mshortest[0m: stop muxing with the shortest stream
	* [33mautobsf[0m: add needed bsfs automatically (delays header until each stream's first packet is written)
[32mfdebug[0m (uint):                 print specific debug info
	* [33mts[0m: 
[32mmax_delay[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: -1-I): maximum muxing or demuxing delay in microseconds
[32mstart_time_realtime[0m (lsint, default: [3m-9223372036854775808[0m, minmax: -9223372036854775808-I): wall-clock time when stream begins (PTS==0)
[32maudio_preload[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-2147483646): microseconds by which audio packets should be interleaved earlier
[32mchunk_duration[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-2147483646): microseconds for each chunk
[32mchunk_size[0m (sint, default: [3m0[0m, minmax: 0-2147483646): size in bytes for each chunk
[32mflush_packets[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: -1-1): enable flushing of the I/O context after each packet
[32mmetadata_header_padding[0m (sint, default: [3m-1[0m, minmax: -1-I): set number of bytes to be written as padding in a metadata header
[32moutput_ts_offset[0m (uint):       set output timestamp offset
[32mmax_interleave_delta[0m (lsint, default: [3m10000000[0m, minmax: 0-I): maximum buffering duration for interleaving
[32mf_strict[0m (sint):               how strictly to follow the standards (deprecated; use strict, save via avconv)
	* [33mstrict[0m: how strictly to follow the standards
	* [33mvery[0m: strictly conform to a older more strict version of the spec or reference software
	* [33mstrict[0m: strictly conform to all the things in the spec no matter what the consequences
	* [33mnormal[0m: 
	* [33munofficial[0m: allow unofficial extensions
	* [33mexperimental[0m: allow non-standardized experimental variants
[32mavoid_negative_ts[0m (sint):      shift timestamps so they start at 0
	* [33mauto[0m: enabled when required by target format
	* [33mdisabled[0m: do not change timestamps
	* [33mmake_non_negative[0m: shift timestamps so they are non negative
	* [33mmake_zero[0m: shift timestamps so they start at 0
[32mdump_separator[0m (str, default: [3m, [0m): set information dump field separator
[32m*[0m (str):                       any possible options defined for AVFormatContext and sub-classes. See [33m[3mgpac -hx ffmx[0m and [33m[3mgpac -hx ffmx:*[0m


[32mjsf[0m

Description: JavaScript filter

This filter runs a javascript file specified in [33m[3mjs[0m defining a new JavaScript filter.
  
For more information on how to use JS filters, please check https://wiki.gpac.io/jsfilter



[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mjs[0m (cstr):                     location of script source
[32m*[0m (str):                       any possible options defined for the script. See [33m[3mgpac -hx jsf:js=$YOURSCRIPT[0m


[32mrouteout[0m

Description: ROUTE output

The ROUTE output filter is used to distribute a live file-based session using ROUTE.
The filter supports DASH and HLS inputs, ATSC3.0 signaling and generic ROUTE signaling.

The filter is identified using the following URL schemes:
	* [33m`atsc://`[0m: session is a full ATSC 3.0 session
	* [33m`route://IP:port`[0m: session is a ROUTE session running on given multicast IP and port

The filter only accepts input PIDs of type [33m[3mFILE[0m.
- HAS Manifests files are detected by file extension and/or MIME types, and sent as part of the signaling bundle or as LCT object files for HLS subplaylists.
- HAS Media segments are detected using the [33m[3mOrigStreamType[0m property, and send as LCT object files using the DASH template string.
- A PID without [33m[3mOrigStreamType[0m property set is delivered as a regular LCT object file (called [33m[3mraw[0m hereafter).
  
For [33m[3mraw[0m file PIDs, the filter will look for the following properties:
	* [33m`ROUTEName`[0m: set resource name. If not found, uses basename of URL
	* [33m`ROUTECarousel`[0m: set repeat period. If not found, uses [33m[3mcarousel[0m. If 0, the file is only sent once
	* [33m`ROUTEUpload`[0m: set resource upload time. If not found, uses [33m[3mcarousel[0m. If 0, the file will be sent as fast as possible.

When DASHing for ROUTE or single service ATSC, a file extension, either in [33m[3mdst[0m or in [33m[3mext[0m, may be used to identify the HAS session type (DASH or HLS).
[33mExample:
"route://IP:PORT/manifest.mpd", "route://IP:PORT/:ext=mpd"[0m

When DASHing for multi-service ATSC, forcing an extension will force all service to use the same formats.
[33mExample:
"atsc://:ext=mpd", "route://IP:PORT/manifest.mpd"[0m
If multiple services with different formats are needed, you will need to explicit your filters:
[33mExample:
gpac -i DASH_URL:#ServiceID=1 @ dashin:forward=file:FID=1 -i HLS_URL:#ServiceID=2 @ dashin:forward=file:FID=2 -o atsc://:SID=1,2[0m
[33mgpac -i MOVIE1:#ServiceID=1 @ dasher:FID=1:mname=manifest.mpd -i MOVIE2:#ServiceID=2 @ dasher:FID=2:mname=manifest.m3u8 -o atsc://:SID=1,2[0m


[31m[1mWarning: When forwarding an existing DASH/HLS session, do NOT set any extension or manifest name.[0m


By default, all streams in a service are assigned to a single route session, and differentiated by ROUTE TSI (see [33m[3msplitlct[0m).
TSI are assigned as follows:
- signaling TSI is always 0
- raw files are assigned TSI 1 and increasing number of TOI
- otherwise, the first PID found is assigned TSI 10, the second TSI 20 etc ...

Init segments and HLS subplaylists are sent before each new segment, independently of [33m[3mcarousel[0m.

[32mATSC 3.0 mode[0m

In this mode, the filter allows multiple service multiplexing, identified through the [33m[3mServiceID[0m property.
By default, a single multicast IP is used for route sessions, each service will be assigned a different port.
The filter will look for [33m[3mROUTEIP[0m and [33m[3mROUTEPort[0m properties on the incoming PID. If not found, the default [33m[3mip[0m and [33m[3mport[0m will be used.

The ATSC short service name can be set using PID property [33m[3mShortServiceName[0m. If not found, [33m[3mServiceName[0m is checked, otherwise default to [33m[3mGPAC[0m.


[32mROUTE mode[0m

In this mode, only a single service can be distributed by the ROUTE session.
[36m[3mNote: [33m[1mip[0m is ignored, and [33m[1mfirst_port[0m is used if no port is specified in [33m[1mdst[0m.[0m
The ROUTE session will include a multi-part MIME unsigned package containing manifest and S-TSID, sent on TSI=0.


[32mLow latency mode[0m

When using low-latency mode, the input media segments are not re-assembled in a single packet but are instead sent as they are received.
In order for the real-time scheduling of data chunks to work, each fragment of the segment should have a CTS and timestamp describing its timing.
If this is not the case (typically when used with an existing DASH session in file mode), the scheduler will estimate CTS and duration based on the stream bitrate and segment duration. The indicated bitrate is increased by [33m[3mbrinc[0m percent for safety.
If this fails, the muxer will trigger warnings and send as fast as possible.
[36m[3mNote: The LCT objects are sent with no length (TOL header) assigned until the final segment size is known, potentially leading to a final 0-size LCT fragment signaling only the final size.[0m


[32mExamples[0m

Since the ROUTE filter only consumes files, it is required to insert:
- the dash demuxer in file forwarding mode when loading a DASH session
- the dash muxer when creating a DASH session

Muxing an existing DASH session in route:
[33mExample:
gpac -i source.mpd dashin:forward=file @ -o route://225.1.1.0:6000/[0m
Muxing an existing DASH session in atsc:
[33mExample:
gpac -i source.mpd dashin:forward=file @ -o atsc://[0m
Dashing and muxing in route:
[33mExample:
gpac -i source.mp4 dasher:profile=live @ -o route://225.1.1.0:6000/manifest.mpd[0m
Dashing and muxing in route Low Latency (experimental):
[33mExample:
gpac -i source.mp4 dasher @ -o route://225.1.1.0:6000/manifest.mpd:profile=live:cdur=0.2:llmode[0m

Sending a single file in ROUTE using half a second upload time, 2 seconds carousel:
[33mExample:
gpac -i URL:#ROUTEUpload=0.5:#ROUTECarousel=2 -o route://225.1.1.0:6000/[0m

Common mistakes:
[33mExample:
gpac -i source.mpd -o route://225.1.1.0:6000/[0m
This will only send the manifest file as a regular object and will not load the dash session.
[33mExample:
gpac -i source.mpd dasher @ -o route://225.1.1.0:6000/[0m
[33mgpac -i source.mpd dasher @ -o route://225.1.1.0:6000/manifest.mpd[0m
These will load the dash session, instantiate a new dasher filter (hence a new DASH manifest), sending the output of the dasher to ROUTE
[33mExample:
gpac -i source.mpd dashin:forward=file @ -o route://225.1.1.0:6000/manifest.mpd[0m
This will force the ROUTE muxer to only accept .mpd files, and will drop all segment files (same if [33m[3mext[0m is used).



[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mdst[0m (cstr):                    destination URL - see filter help
[32mttl[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m):        time-to-live for multicast packets
[32mmtu[0m (uint, default: [3m1472[0m):     size of LCT MTU in bytes
[32msplitlct[0m (enum, default: [3moff[0m): split mode for LCT channels
	* [33moff[0m: all streams are in the same LCT channel
	* [33mtype[0m: each new stream type results in a new LCT channel
	* [33mall[0m: all streams are in dedicated LCT channel, the first stream being used for STSID signaling

[32mkorean[0m (bool, default: [3mfalse[0m): use Korean version of ATSC 3.0 spec instead of US
[32mrunfor[0m (uint, default: [3m0[0m):     run for the given time in ms


[32mrftruehd[0m

Description: TrueHD reframer

This filter parses Dolby TrueHD files/data and outputs corresponding audio PID and frames.


[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mindex[0m (dbl, default: [3m1.0[0m):     indexing window length


[32mcryptin[0m

Description: CryptFile input

This filter dispatch raw blocks from encrypted files with AES 128 CBC in PKCS7 to clear input files

The filter accepts URL with scheme [33m[3mgcryp://URL[0m, where [33m[3mURL[0m is the URL to decrypt.

The filter can process http(s) and local file key URLs, and expects a full key (16 bytes) as result of resource fetching.
The special URL [33m[3murn:gpac:keys:value:VALUE[0m can also be used, with [33m[3mVALUE[0m containing the 16 bytes of the key in hexadecimal.



[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32msrc[0m (cstr):                    location of source file


[32mcryptout[0m

Description: CryptFile output

This filter dispatch raw blocks from clear input files to encrypted files with AES 128 CBC in PKCS7

The filter accepts URL with scheme [33m[3mgcryp://URL[0m, where [33m[3mURL[0m is the URL to encrypt.


[32mOptions (basic):[0m

[32mdst[0m (cstr):                    location of source file
